name: Double room with ensuite bathroom
summary: Fantastic location for work, rest or play. Easy access to central London,  close to Kingston Uni, Wimbledon, Twickenham and Sandown & Kempton Park Racecourses.  Kingston offers the best shopping outside of London. Richmond & Bushy Parks 1 mile away.
space: We offer a warm welcome and a spacious, double room with en suite bathroom in our family home. We live in a quiet, residential area with direct access to central London - 25 minutes by train from either Kingston or Norbiton stations. The guest room is on the 1st floor and garden facing so nice and quiet.  It has a king size bed, wardrobe, chest of drawers, a desk and chair and plenty of storage. There are tea & coffee making facilities available in your room. The ensuite bathroom has a large roll top bath, and a power shower is available in the downstairs bathroom if preferred. We can provide a large pop up cot for babies / toddlers.
description: Fantastic location for work, rest or play. Easy access to central London,  close to Kingston Uni, Wimbledon, Twickenham and Sandown & Kempton Park Racecourses. We live in a quiet, residential area with direct access to central London - 25 minutes by train from either Kingston or Norbiton stations. The guest room is on the 1st floor and garden facing so nice and quiet.  It has a king size bed, wardrobe, chest of drawers, a desk and chair and plenty of storage. There are tea & coffee making facilities available in your room. The ensuite bathroom has a large roll top bath, and a power shower is available in the downstairs bathroom if preferred. We can provide a large pop up cot for babies / toddlers. The main rooms you have access to are the guest bedroom and the downstairs dining room. In the summer, pleas
neighborhood_overview: Kingston is a leafy suburban town in Surrey near the River Thames so ideal for boat trips into London/Richmond. Also well located for visiting Kew Gardens and Hampton Court Palace.  Kingston upon Thames is a thriving town with a beautiful old market and one of the best shopping areas outside central London. It has many great restaurants and pubs and bars, should you want to eat out during your stay - we're happy to recommend our favourites!  We're also within walking distance of many of Kingston's office buildings, if you are coming to stay with us for work - only a 15 minute walk from the offices of VSO, Bausch + Lomb (Valeant), Wolters Kluwer, Travel Republic, Unilever and more.
notes: A continental breakfast is included in your stay.  Bed linen and towels are provided.  Wireless internet is included.  Babies and young children are welcome, and can sleep in our large pop up cot. For little ones over two years old there will be an additional charge of å£5 per night.  Please let us know what you need in advance and we'll work out the details! We don't have off street parking, but can provide parking permits for a small cost (å£2 per full day). There is a cleaning fee of å£5 per booking.
transit: The house is located half a mile from Kingston (5 min drive / 15 min walk) and Norbiton (5 min drive / 15 min walk) train stations (Zone 5/6) and trains run every 15 minutes into the centre of London.
access: The main rooms you have access to are the guest bedroom and the downstairs dining room. In the summer, please feel free to sit outside in our garden.  You're also welcome to use the kitchen to make tea, coffee and for the preparation of light snacks and meals. However, our fridge is quite small so please keep this in mind if you would like to store anything!
interaction: One of us will be there to welcome you on your arrival and to show you where everything is and to answer any questions. We are around most evenings with our two year old daughter.  This is a warm, family environment and we want to make all our guests feel welcome - we'll all be living together during your stay, but our aim is to make your time with us as comfortable as possible. This is a bi-lingual house (French and English and basic Spanish), so we can offer extra support to some international visitors!
house_rules: We try and keep things nice and friendly so not too many rules... This is a strictly non-smoking house. Please take off your shoes when walking round the house (feel free to bring your slippers!)!  Kitchen facilities are available if needed, but please ask us first and tidy up and wash up afterwards. Also - the fridge is small so we'll have to manage with limited space! Please don't invite other people back to our home - no extra guests apart from those on the booking, without prior arrangement. Please treat our stuff as you would like your stuff to be treated!
host_location: Kingston upon Thames, England, United Kingdom
host_about: A friendly family who enjoy riverside walks, fun and games in the park, a good pub lunch and the chance to adventure together as often as possible!

neighborhood_overview: Kingston is a buzzing town with amazing shopping and entertainment. You have everything within walking distance from supermarkets, designer shops, theatre shows, an Odeon cinema showcasing the latest blockbuster releases to exploring the beautiful Richmond Park where you can run/cycle/walk/have a picnic and not forgetting the River Thames where you can spot some swans and even ride on one of the boats down to Richmond. The Town Centre is 10 mins walk away. Access to Richmond Park (Kingston Gate) is 5 mins away and so is Kingston Hospital. The nearest train station is Norbiton Station (zone 5) and it's only a 2 mins walk away. It's a quick 25mins train ride to get to Waterloo or 10mins train ride to Wimbledon.

neighborhood_overview: Local amenities in New Malden include a variety of shops, bars & restaurants, a library, local park with tennis court and a leisure centre with gym & swimming pool.  The train route from New Malden provides direct access to Waterloo including the South Bank Centre and London Eye. From Waterloo there are easy links to all other tourist attractions. The pleasant open spaces of Richmond Park are also nearby with a golf course and very good cycle routes for all abilities. There is a direct rail link to Hampton Court where you can visit the beautiful historic site of Royal Hampton Court Palace, explore the maze & gardens or take a boat trip along the River Thames. Other routes from New Malden can transport you to various places of interest in and around the London and Surrey area including the beautiful Kew Gardens. Suggestions for day visits further afield include Windsor to visit Windsor Castle or Legoland, and Brighton on the south coast where you can "see the sea"!  These are both about
house_rules: NO PETS and STRICTLY NO SMOKING !
host_about: My husband and I have lived in the local area for 16 years and  have brought up both our children here, which has been great as it is a family-friendly place with plenty of amenities on our doorstep. Together, we run our own company called "Core AV", specialising in audio/visual & lighting control. When we get the time, we love travelling and our latest holiday was to New York where our eldest son is now working. Next time we go, we will definitely be using airbnb to find somewhere to stay. We also enjoy going to nice restaurants and the theatre etc. and love having all that London has to offer so close by. We are very happy to give advice on places to visit and how to plan your stay with us.

name: Charming room, very close to centre
summary: Quiet, cosy, double bedroom in a Victorian converted flat in the center of Kingston. The flat overlooks Fairfield park and is very close to the Knights Park campus of the University. It is just 10mins walk away from train station (zone 6 of London).
space: It's a small room with an English double bed (quite small compared to double beds in Europe and US). The flat has a range of Victorian features and in the bedroom there is an original fireplace. Bedding and towels are provided
description: Quiet, cosy, double bedroom in a Victorian converted flat in the center of Kingston. The flat overlooks Fairfield park and is very close to the Knights Park campus of the University. It is just 10mins walk away from train station (zone 6 of London). It's a small room with an English double bed (quite small compared to double beds in Europe and US). The flat has a range of Victorian features and in the bedroom there is an original fireplace. Bedding and towels are provided You will have full access to the lounge, kitchen and bathroom. I'm afraid we don't offer breakfast but you're welcome to use the kitchen to cook meals whenever you want. There is wifi and cable TV (Virgin media, super fast!) We work during the day but we are usually about in the evenings Kingston is a wonderful area to be. It is surrounded by 3 major parks (including the great Richmond Park), it has a superb shopping area and a true village feeling. It is situated along the river Thames, where you can enjoy long walks
neighborhood_overview: Kingston is a wonderful area to be. It is surrounded by 3 major parks (including the great Richmond Park), it has a superb shopping area and a true village feeling. It is situated along the river Thames, where you can enjoy long walks in the nature, nice cafes and restaurants and boat connection to Hampton Court, Richmond and central London.  It is a leafy area, with a big University just around the corner.
notes: Please be aware that this is our home, not a hotel. That is the spirit of Airbnb. So check-in and check-out must be planned with us and we can't welcome you too late at night. Also, the flat is part of a 1860's building, with quirky features, funny old doors and creaky floorboards. To be honest people usually fall in love with it, but please don't expect a modern block or a hotel room (it's just our spare room after all!) Thanks ;-)
transit: The flat is a short walk to the town centre and the train station. Kingston is very well connected to central London with trains about every 15 min. You can get to Waterloo station in about 25 min.
access: You will have full access to the lounge, kitchen and bathroom. I'm afraid we don't offer breakfast but you're welcome to use the kitchen to cook meals whenever you want. There is wifi and cable TV (Virgin media, super fast!)
interaction: We work during the day but we are usually about in the evenings
house_rules: No smoking inside the flat. No check-in after 9pm on working nights. However once you have your key, you are welcome to come and go as you please.
host_location: Kingston upon Thames, England, United Kingdom
host_about: Hello my name is Ryan I am 35 and live with my partner Simon in Kingston upon Thames in Surrey. I originally come from Norwich and Simon originally comes from Italy. Simon is an artist and I am a lecturer at Brooklands college, working with young people with learning difficulties. We rent out our spare room with Airbnb and often use Airbnb when we go abroad, we love it!

neighborhood_overview: Kingston is a thriving market town 7 days a week.  It has a bustling retail area with most high streets shops.  It is also home to several bars & restaurants not to mention a source of huge historical interest.  It is also a short bus ride or drive to the Royal Parks Richmond and Bushy and Hampton Court Palace.   There are 2 great Youngs pubs and eateries within a stones throw.  The property is located in one of Kingston's premier residential roads and is a short walk into town.
transit: The property is located between Kingston and Surbiton mainline stations.  Both have strong links into London Waterloo, with Surbiton being on the express line. This makes it an ideal location for a city break without the inner city prices.
access: Guests will have full access of the bungalow and surrounding gardens.  Parking is also available on the property.
interaction: The bungalow is located in the grounds of our family house.  We are always happy to help if we are around.   We have 3 teenage children, dogs and cats.
house_rules: We expect any guests to treat our property as if it were their own, and to respect our neighbouring community.  Smoking is permitted in outside areas only.  Please make sure ashtrays are used.

neighborhood_overview: Local amenities in New Malden include a variety of shops, bars & restaurants, a library, local park with tennis court and a leisure centre with gym & swimming pool.  The train route from New Malden provides direct access to Waterloo including the South Bank Centre and London Eye. From Waterloo there are easy links to all other tourist attractions. The pleasant open spaces of Richmond Park are also nearby with a golf course and very good cycle routes for all abilities. There is a direct rail link to Hampton Court where you can visit the beautiful historic site of Royal Hampton Court Palace, explore the maze & gardens or take a boat trip along the River Thames. Other routes from New Malden can transport you to various places of interest in and around the London and Surrey area including the beautiful Kew Gardens. It's an incredibly safe neighbourhood too with a real sense of community.

neighborhood_overview: Surbiton, especially the more affluent 'River Road' conservation area really is a well-kept secret...right by the river for local towpath walks up to Kingston, Teddington & Richmond then back to Hampton Court & Esher.  Quick & easy access to London, you're also perfectly positioned for Twickenham Stadium, Sandown Racecourse, great award-winning local eateries & bars, Richmond Park & its deer, shopping, Wimbledon, Hampton Court Palace, the Flower Shows & concerts held there, etc....you may even want to move here!
notes: No smoking (sorry), you'll be given a key, it's a quiet place, we respect each others space & privacy but I'm easy going & will help make your trip as great as I can!
transit: The local parking is restricted, if you wanted to drive we'd need to plan scratch parking vouchers for you in advance.  But the transport links by train to London are fast, frequent & reliable (the main reason this area is so desirable with city professionals), loads of buses, cabs, etc....
access: You have your room with everything you need and access to the bathroom you share with me, spotlessly clean.  Good shower (above the bath) with never-ending hot water. Access to the kitchen (newly fitted) is limited but of course access to the fridge to keep things chilled, make tea, etc....
interaction: I will give you my mobile which I have with me all the time & I can help you with travel plans, directions or good places to visit, local places to eat/drink, etc... just ask me if you need anything, I'll do my best to help you!
house_rules: No smoking, no candles, please don't wear high heels inside on the wooden floorboards, the kitchen isn't really a zone open for cooking big meals but of course you can use it to grab a drink & chill your wine!

host_about: Hello! I moved to England in 1966 although I was originally from Prague where I went to University to study as a teacher.  I speak Czech, Russian and am studying French and I also enjoy theatre, classical music, horticulture, history, cross country skiing , swimming, medau and walking in the countryside.I have done many things in my life including working in several shops, as a secretary, a cycle proficiency instructor, an interpretor, a translator.....I have driven lorries for a company and ambulances for London Ambulance Service and amongst all this, I have brought up 4 children... perhaps the biggest challenge in (URL HIDDEN) now I try to relax .... That's when I am not looking after the grandchildren on behalf of my 2 grown up sons. I would like you to feel welcome in my homeÛ_and like to have guests who enjoy evenings out but not those who are here for the clubbing scene as it would disturb me. Strictly non smokers either inside or out, thank you very much!

space: The double room is clean, bright and includes linen. There are 2 friendly house cats who reside in my two bedroom cottage. Should you wish to have a Costa coffee, visit Waitrose or KFC then they are approx 10-12 minutes walk away just past the train station. There is a bus stop at the end of the road which takes you to Kingston, New Malden, Sutton so mega convenient. To eat out then there is a choice of Korean, Japanese, Indian and traditional British 'pub' food all within easy walking distance. name: Comfortable king size sofa bed
summary: Surbiton is very convenient  for getting into central London  as well as being a lovely suburb in its own right, The River Thames is a 5 minute walk away.  My flat is a welcoming space and the sofa bed is a large king size with a proper mattress.
space: A welcoming flat in sunny Surbiton.  My flat is in a quiet residential street but only a 2 minute walk from the high street and 7 minute walk to the train station.  Historic Hampton Court Palace, a must see on any visit to London, is only 10 minutes away (or 2 train stops). Bed linen and towels are provided There is a garden for your use if the weather is good. Surbtion is very friendly with lots of places to eat nearby, catering for whatever your tastes may be from fast food to gourmet dining.  There are 2 supermarkets within walking distance. It is a strictly no smoking property and not suitable for babies or young children under 5.
description: Surbiton is very convenient  for getting into central London  as well as being a lovely suburb in its own right, The River Thames is a 5 minute walk away. It is a strictly no smoking property and not suitable for babies or young children under 5. You have access to a sitting room which is a shared space by day, and private to you at night, after 9pm.  The
notes: Please note that a cat, Ziggy, lives at the property and will be going in and out via his cat flap!
transit: Waterloo station and therefore central London is only 20 minutes away by train, of which there are approximately 7 per hour running from Surbiton to Waterloo and vice versa.  Wimbledon station, where you can hook up with the London Underground (district line) is only 10 minutes away. Surbtion is in zone 6 of London Transport but there is no tube station. You can use your Oyster card on the trains to here and on the local buses. Parking is on street with residents permits only, valid Monday to Saturday.  There are parking meters for daily parking nearby.
access: You have access to a sitting room which is a shared space by day, and private to you at night, after 9pm.  The sofa bed may be folded back into a sofa for daytime use and made up into a bed each night for your use.  You also have access to a shared bathroom, please clean up after yourself! and a kitchen, but ask before you want to cook anything please. This is my home and I may be using it myself!
interaction: I am at work most days but am happy to chat in the evenings.
house_rules: There is no smoking in the flat anywhere, as I am allergic to cigarette smoke. Please be considerate of my downstairs neighbour and keep the noise down.  No loud music at any time. You are welcome to use the kitchen facilities to make your own food, if I am not using them myself, but you must ask first.  I don't offer a maid service so please be sure to clean up after yourselves and wash any dishes that you have used when cooking for yourself.
host_about: An aging well travelled ex-backpacker! who loves to explore the world we live in.  Staying with local people whilst travelling is important to me, rather than in faceless hotels.  The memories of cities I've visited are closely tied in with the people I've met in those places.

neighborhood_overview: - Central London in less than 30 mins - easy access to local shops and restaurants - Wimbledon village and Centre Court 10 mins away by car - easy access to Richmond Park - great local pub (The Glasshouse) - nearby Nepalese restaurant (The Royal Gurkha)   New Malden is one of the biggest Korean communities outside of South Korea, so you'll find lots of authentic Korean restaurants and deli stores.  My favourite thing about the neighbourhood: you are less than 10 min drive to the natural beauty (and wild deer) in Richmond Park.
notes: IMPORTANT NOTE: the sofa bed is in an open plan living room / kitchen space, so there may be housemates using the kitchen before 8am to grab some breakfast. There is a screen for privacy. I want you to have a great stay. If you have any special needs or questions please ask before you book and I'll see what we can do.
transit: The apartment is only a few minutes walk to New Malden, with fast transport to Central London. There are also local buses and trains to Wimbledon, Kingston, Richmond, Sutton etc.  For help planning travel around London check out Transport for London website using New Malden or New Malden station as the start / end point. It may be worth getting a one day or one week travel card if you are doing much traveling. You can get these from the local train station.  Parker Cars is a local mini cab service offering a good value airport pick up and drop off service.
access: There's a shared bathroom, a shared kitchen and spacious studio living room.  Off street parking may be possible for one vehicle - please ask in advance before booking. The flat is not suitable for wheelchairs due to restricted access (steps).
interaction: Who will you meet when you stay: If I'm not here to greet you, one of my housemates will meet you in the evening, show you the room and answer any questions.
house_rules: The sofa bed is bookable for one or two people, 18+ unless agreed beforehand.  If you have any special requirements, please ask before booking and will do my best to accommodate. Check-in typically after 6pm, unless agreed beforehand. The space is yours for 12 hours a night, from 8pm in the evening to 8am in the morning and there's a screen for privacy.  Please leave the kitchen, living room and bathroom clean and tidy after use. In return you can expect to find these areas clean and tidy when you want to use them. Please open the windows in the open plan living room / kitchen if you are cooking. Please keep noise to a minimum after 10:30pm to enable others to get a good night's sleep. An off street parking permit may be available if you request before booking.  Lost keys charged at å£220.00 to change locks, å£100 for lost parking permit.
host_about: Thanks for considering staying at my place and checking out my profile.Following are a few things about myself: I've travelled widely - Asia, North America and Latin America . I'm reasonably well educated (no claims to intelligence). Always enjoy meeting interesting people. Love remote Greek islands, high mountains and wild remote places. Occasional meditator. Infrequent teacher of interesting things. Helpful and collaborative by nature. I appreciate the tranquility of the early morning. I write a bit. Ex-buddhist monk. I work for Apple. If you have any questions, please just ask.Ed

neighborhood_overview: Kingston is a leafy suburban town in Surrey near the River Thames so ideal for boat trips into London/Richmond. Also well located for visiting Kew Gardens and Hampton Court Palace. Kingston upon Thames is a thriving town with a beautiful old market and one of the best shopping areas outside central London. It has many great restaurants and pubs and bars, should you want to eat out during your stay - we're happy to recommend our favourites! We're also within walking distance of many of Kingston's office buildings, if you are coming to stay with us for work - only a 15 minute walk from the offices of VSO, Bausch + Lomb (Valeant), Wolters Kluwer, Travel Republic, Unilever and more.
notes: Bed linen and towels are provided.  Wireless internet is included.  Babies and young children are welcome, and can sleep in our large pop up cot.  We don't have off street parking, but can provide parking permits for a small cost (å£2 per full day).
transit: The house is located half a mile from Kingston (5 min drive / 15 min walk) and Norbiton (5 min drive / 15 min walk) train stations (Zone 5/6) and trains run every 15 minutes into the centre of London.
interaction: We will be available remotely to help out as needed.
house_rules: We try and keep things nice and friendly so not too many rules... This is a strictly non-smoking house. Please don't invite other people back to our home - no extra guests apart from those on the booking, without prior arrangement. Please treat our stuff as you would like your stuff to be treated!

Kingston is situated 25 and 35 minutes drive from Heathrow and Gatwick airports respectively.

name: LARGE TENT IN LEAFY SUBURBAN GARDEN
summary: Our 6-person tent in secluded, usually quiet garden is ideal for campers on a budget! Access Central London in just 25 mins from New Malden Station. Enjoy continental breakfast provided on our shady patio or sunny decked area.
space: This 6-person tent has a separate zip-up sleeping compartment, and a living area large enough to stand up in. It is pitched in our generally quiet, medium-sized back garden between our willow and cherry trees, on the lawn. A good quality double inflatable mattress with your choice of either duvet or sleeping bag, feather or foam pillows, should provide you with a comfortable night's sleep close to nature; there is also a single camping mattress suitable for a third person, available for an extra å£10 per night.
description: Our 6-person tent in secluded, usually quiet garden is ideal for campers on a budget! Access Central London in just 25 mins from New Malden Station. Enjoy continental breakfast provided on our shady patio or sunny decked area. This 6-person tent has a separate zip-up sleeping compartment, and a living area large enough to stand up in. It is pitched in our generally quiet, medium-sized back garden between our willow and cherry trees, on the lawn. A good quality double inflatable mattress with your choice of either duvet or sleeping bag, feather or foam pillows, should provide you with a comfortable night's sleep close to nature; there is also a single camping mattress suitable for a third person, available for an extra å£10 per night. The tent is a roomy Zempire Invert 6. We provide a back door key for use of the shared bathroom with both shower and bath. Continental breakfast is included, and can be served on our shady patio or on our sunny decked area. We have a conservatory dining roo
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbours are usually quiet, although they do very occasionally entertain in their gardens.
notes: We have an elderly, very friendly labrador who also uses the garden, as well as 2 cats. At the end of the garden is a workshop which we let to a local instrument-maker. He is usually quiet and keeps sociable hours. There are 3 of us staying in the main house - ourselves and a lodger.
transit: Parking is free on our street, usually with plenty of available spaces outside the house. New Malden rail station is 15 mins walk away. We can offer lifts to & from if you wish. Waterloo is 25 mins from the station, and there are frequent local buses to Kingston-upon-Thames (15 mins) and surrounding towns. There is also a local bus route serving Heathrow Airport, or we can drive you to and from either Gatwick or Heathrow Airports for the cost of the fuel and a little for time if we are available.
access: The tent is a roomy Zempire Invert 6. We provide a back door key for use of the shared bathroom with both shower and bath. Continental breakfast is included, and can be served on our shady patio or on our sunny decked area. We have a conservatory dining room if raining/cold!
interaction: Our mobile will be on 24 hours a day, if you need to ask us anything at all while you are here. You may use the Conservatory for charging phones/laptops. The kitchen may be used for making hot drinks and toast only. There are many restaurants and takeaways of different kinds within 15 mins walk. The lounge is for our family use only.
house_rules: Since there is only one bathroom/loo with several people sharing, we would expect everyone to be fairly flexible about its use. We will do our very best to accommodate your needs at any time of day.
host_about: My partner and myself are in our 50s, and enjoy B&B ing around the country. Airbnb was recommended to us by a friend as a much cheaper alternative. We are a folk duo, both play guitar & sing, mostly at Folk Clubs & charity gigs, but do get the occasional paid one! We also love watching our favourite musicians 'live', especially at festivals. We enjoy walking in the country, discovering local history and Real Ale.

name: Spacious private garden studio.
summary: This spacious garden studio is a private, bright, quiet haven. Self contained bathroom and kitchen perfect for one or two guests. Access through side gate through the garden. 10 min. walk to Norbiton station or 20 min. stroll to centre of Kingston.
space: This private garden studio is a self contained unit with some space outside to sit and sip your morning coffee should you wish to.  The space is bright thanks to a top skylight and being tucked away in the garden tends to be very quiet. It comes with a fairly chunky library of books on architecture and some travel magazines.  This is a self catered accommodation with fully functioning kitchen but simple breakfast supplies can be provided for your convenience at request and extra cost (receipt will be included). Tea, coffee, sugar, olive oil and basic spices are provided.  There is usually someone in the house if you need any assistance but I tend to give my guests peace and quite to relax. I am available outside of working hours and on the weekends and any time on my mobile.  Guests will be provided with towels and fresh bedding. name: Pretty flat, 6min walk Surbiton Stn
summary: Perfect base to explore London/Surrey! Unique 1 bed flat in character building, own entrance. Great views of communal gardens & leafy conservation area yet convenient for shops/restaurants, river & park walks, Kingston shops, London Waterloo (16min).
space: Cosy, unique, flat in an impressive black/white building in a prime location extremely convenient for the station, Surbiton itself (Waitrose, MnS, Sainsburys, Health foods, Coffee shops, Restaurants and Pubs) and great train links to Wimbledon (7 min), Hampton Court (5 min), London Waterloo (from 16 min). 5 minute drive to A3, Heathrow 35 min drive, Gatwick 40 min drive. Frequent buses make Kingston Upon Thames, with its market, riverside walks/cafes, extensive shopping facilities and nightlife very accessible. From the nearby river you can walk/cycle along the riverbanks to Kingston/Teddington/Richmond and beyond, or Hampton Wick with its impressive Palace/Parkland and antique shops. Happy to advise guests on good places to walk/cycle/eat/shop! The flat has its own entrance (up a fairly steep set of stairs) and is first (top) floor. It has small entrance hallway leading to open-plan lounge/kitchen and double doors to good-sized double bedroom with large built in storage and separate c
description: Perfect base to explore London/Surrey! Unique 1 bed flat in character building, own entrance. Great views of communal gardens & leafy conservation area yet convenient for shops/restaurants, river & park walks, Kingston shops, London Waterloo (16min). Cosy, unique, flat in an impressive black/white building in a prime location extremely convenient for the station, Surbiton itself (Waitrose, MnS, Sainsburys, Health foods, Coffee shops, Restaurants and Pubs) and great train links to Wimbledon (7 min), Hampton Court (5 min), London Waterloo (from 16 min). 5 minute drive to A3, Heathrow 35 min drive, Gatwick 40 min drive. Frequent buses make Kingston Upon Thames, with its market, riverside walks/cafes, extensive shopping facilities and nightlife very accessible. From the nearby river you can walk/cycle along the riverbanks to Kingston/Teddington/Richmond and beyond, or Hampton Wick with its impressive Palace/Parkland and antique shops. Happy to advise guests on good places to walk/cycle/eat
neighborhood_overview: The road is considered a primary location in Surbiton as it's quiet and leafy and on the edge of decidedly up-market Southborough Conservation Area with its large character houses, but a short walk to the station (Surbiton is popular with commuters due to its excellent train service and being Zone 6, yet close to open countryside). It's a good area for relaxing strolls looking at posh houses, and river and woodland walks are close by.
notes: The flat has a washer/dryer, fridge with freezer section (NOT just an ice-box!), toaster, kettle, iron, ironing board, microwave can be provided if wanted. There is no broadband or phone, but I can supply a freeview TV. The flat is largely single glazed, with secondary glazing in the bedroom but the road is reasonably quiet (no buses or train noise) and although I cannot guarantee silence from the flat below I have never had any complaint of noise and my parents who stayed there this month reported they found it very quiet.
transit: 6 minute level walk to Zone 6 Surbiton Station (direct trains to Hampton Court, Esher, Guildford, Wimbledon, Clapham Jn, London Waterloo), shorter walk to bus stops for Kingston, Richmond, Chessington World of Adventures etc.  If arriving by train or public transport I can normally meet or drop off guests and their luggage. A3 is within 5 minutes, linking quickly to M25 at jn10, SW or central London around 35 minutes, and Heathrow and Gatwick are both under 40 minutes away.  PARKING: There are parking meters right outside the block, free after 18.30 and on Sundays but there is free parking up til 1pm, and from 12 noon onwards within 4 minutes walk which is useful but if you're travelling by car and need somewhere to park for a few days I can show you the nearest places to park for free.
access: Guests will have the entire flat to themselves and use of communal gardens. Please note NO parties, smoking, or extra guests allowed without prior permission.
interaction: I will meet guests at Surbiton station or at the flat. I will be reachable by phone or email and am happy to advise on places to explore/shop/eat/drink/walk/cycle/dance/swim... I can also advise where to park for free locally :) I have lived in the area since 1992, and have rented properties here since 2000 and take pride in ensuring my guests are well looked after.
house_rules: I expect guests to leave the flat in the same condition that they find it. The carpet is new so I ask guests to remove shoes and also to take care of the wooden worktops. No smoking or pets are allowed (sorry!) and definitely no parties as I expect guests to be considerate to neighbours too. Breakages or any damage to the fixtures/fittings will be charged to the guest.

space: This is a comfortable two bed house, which can comfortably house and sleep up to seven people. There is a rear garden if you wish to entertain or have a bar-b-q. description: Comfortable, spacious 2 bedroom apartment with two queen size beds, one single bed & sofa which can be used as a single bed, private garden. Tea/Coffee. Sleeps 2-6. It is in a great location right on the A3 yet close to Surbiton and Kingston. It is ideal for a family looking to see London and tour the south of England or visiting relatives. You have sole access to the house and garden. We are happy to give you an overview of where to go and how best to get round London. We are happy to drop round fresh milk etc as and when. This is a quiet neighborhood very close to the A3 main artery from central London to the South Coast.  It is twenty minutes from Wimbledon stadium, twenty minutes from Chessington World of Adventures and half an hour from Waterloo. The London Eye is a twenty minute direct train from Surbiton Station. host_about: I am an Irish guy living in London. I used to play rugby, hockey and GAA, but I am of an age now where I make do with watching games. I am a sociable helpful kind of person, so hopefully will make you feel really welcome if you choose to come and stay.

summary: Lovely detached four bedroom house where I live with my dogs (they don't go upstairs).  I have a lovely double bedroom with ensuite facilities. Lots of storage space, TV, wifi and 50 metres from the riverside. Near public transport
space: My home is 50 metres from the River Thames towpath. Easy access to both Kingston and Richmond town centres.
description: Lovely detached four bedroom house where I live with my dogs (they don't go upstairs).  I have a lovely double bedroom with ensuite facilities. Lots of storage space, TV, wifi and 50 metres from the riverside. Near public transport My home is 50 metres from the River Thames towpath. Easy access to both Kingston and Richmond town centres. Use of kitchen facilities to make breakfast. I supply tea, coffee and milk. As much or as little as you prefer. It's very green, peaceful but has loads of amenities. Three theatres, many cinemas and lots of shops and restaurants. It's also not far to Kew Gardens, Hampton Court and Ham house.  Richmond park is near, so lots of lovely open spaces to enjoy.   A pay as you go gym is walking distance from the house too. 65 bus route very nearby.  It goes to Richmond station that gives you underground, overground and SW trains to get wherever you need to go. name: En-suite Double room in Kingston
summary: A comfortable, cool  room within short walking distance of shops and entertainment. The room has a king size bed ensuite  shower room and is in a detached Victorian house in quiet residential area. Loads to see and do locally or take short train journey into central London.
space: Great location with easy access to the local historical sites or take a short train journey into central London.
description: A comfortable, cool  room within short walking distance of shops and entertainment. The room has a king size bed ensuite  shower room and is in a detached Victorian house in quiet residential area. Loads to see and do locally or take short train journey into central London. Great location with easy access to the local historical sites or take a short train journey into central London. You will have access to bedroom, ensuite shower room, kitchen and garden. We live in the house and will be using the communal areas which you are welcome to share with us. We will be around to help/ advise you if required. We have lived here for 19 years and love the area. It is so convenient for all the local amenities, so close to centre of town yet so quiet and friendly. You can walk to public transport, excellent shopping area and the many historical sites such as Hampton Court Palace, Ham House, Wimbledon, or you may wish to walk/cycle around Richmond Park and see the lovely baby deer roaming freely
neighborhood_overview: We have lived here for 19 years and love the area. It is so convenient for all the local amenities, so close to centre of town yet so quiet and friendly. You can walk to public transport, excellent shopping area and the many historical sites such as Hampton Court Palace, Ham House, Wimbledon, or you may wish to walk/cycle around Richmond Park and see the lovely baby deer roaming freely or walk along the river Thames.  We will be happy to make suggestions on the best restaurants and places to go so you can make the most of your stay in Kingston Upon Thames.
transit: The train and bus stations are within 5 minutes walk. Trains run 4 times an hour into London Waterloo and the journey takes around 25/30 minutes. Trains/buses also run to Twickenham and Richmond  and a bus runs from Kingston to Heathrow.
access: You will have access to bedroom, ensuite shower room, kitchen and garden.
interaction: We live in the house and will be using the communal areas which you are welcome to share with us. We will be around to help/ advise you if required.
house_rules: The room is within a family house consisting of me and my husband and our lovely black cat. We are very easy going and sociable and, if required, we will be happy to give you hints and tips so you can get the most out of the area.  Please note that the house is strictly no smoking.
host_about: I am married and have a son who is currently at university but occasionally ventures home when he wants to attend a rugby match, has laundry needing attention, or is in want of a good meal!  My Husband works for Sky TV and loves his job. We enjoy life to the full and spend as much time as we can in South West of France. We love cooking/entertaining/ travelling/ and spending time with our loved ones. We also have a very lovely but independent cat who comes and goes as he pleases. If you Airbnb with us you can expect a warm welcome and a very comfortable stay in the heart of Kingston.

summary: Easy and fast commute to lively Central London. 7min walk to high street and shops. Great location for Hampton Court, Wimbledon, Twickenham Rugby Stadium and Richmond Park. Wifi, Apple TV, powerful sound system and free parking space available.
space: This is a cute two-bedroom flat in a very safe and quiet neighbourhood that could not be better connected to London. The predominant colour in the flat is white, which I assure you will help you relaxing after a busy day in this lively city.
description: Easy and fast commute to lively Central London. 7min walk to high street and shops. Great location for Hampton Court, Wimbledon, Twickenham Rugby Stadium and Richmond Park. Wifi, Apple TV, powerful sound system and free parking space available. This is a cute two-bedroom flat in a very safe and quiet neighbourhood that could not be better connected to London. The predominant colour in the flat is white, which I assure you will help you relaxing after a busy day in this lively city. Entire flat is available for rent, which includes a double bed (main bedroom), a single bed (smaller bedroom), a sofa and a chaise lounge (living room). I can be contacted via phone or message if help is needed during your stay. Surbiton is a quiet neighbourhood with everything you will need in terms of shops, supermarkets and good restaurants. It combines the best of both worlds since it is an easy and fast commute to lively Central London (17mins to Waterloo). I recommend you getting an Oyster card for Lon
neighborhood_overview: Surbiton is a quiet neighbourhood with everything you will need in terms of shops, supermarkets and good restaurants. It combines the best of both worlds since it is an easy and fast commute to lively Central London (17mins to Waterloo).
notes: You will be surprised with Surbiton's independent restaurants. Here a selection of my favourites: * Nay Thai * The Red Rose (Indian) * The Grove (gastropub with modern British cuisine... and a beer garden !)  But to be fair, any restaurants along Maple Road tend to be very good. Also, for a cheeky pint, I strongly recommend The Surbiton's Flyer (next to Surbiton train station).  For a good brunch, I suggest the Pickled Pantry on your way to the station (St Mark's Hill).
transit: I recommend you getting an Oyster card for London (this is zone 6). If you do have a car, the flat includes free parking space inside the front garden.
access: Entire flat is available for rent, which includes a double bed (main bedroom), a single bed (smaller bedroom), a sofa and a chaise lounge (living room).
interaction: I can be contacted via phone or message if help is needed during your stay.
house_rules: There are just few basic rules I would love for you to follow during your stay: * no smoking inside the flat * take your shoes off and leave them by the main entrance, in the porche * keep the house neat and tidy during your stay * when leaving the flat and before locking the main door with the key, lift the door handle and then lock the door with the key  * take the key with you when you leave the flat; otherwise, you will be completely locked out once you simply close the door and it will take me (best case scenario) three hours commute to come and rescue you ! * lock the windows once you leave the flat, Surbiton is super safe but prevention is always good * contact me for further instructions if you plan to use the washer/dryer * use the green box outside for your recycling and compost, please use it ! * use the big black bin outside if you need to replace your rubbish bag * empty the dehumidifier (next to the white chaise lounge in the living room) out when full so we reduce the le

summary: Large Edwardian house off New Malden High Street, 5 minutes' walk from the train station (25 minutes from centre of London); 45 minutes from Heathrow and Gatwick. Within walking distance are excellent coffee bars, restaurants, parks and a gym.
space: The ground floor bedroom has a double bed, wardrobe, cupboards and shelves and an en-suite toilet and sink. The decor is Far Eastern with features from my many travels to that area. The shared bathroom upstairs for the use of guests is very spacious with a bath, a separate shower cubicle and cupboard with tumble drier and washing machine. The decor is Tuscan from when I lived in Italy for 10 years.
description: Large Edwardian house off New Malden High Street, 5 minutes' walk from the train station (25 minutes from centre of London); 45 minutes from Heathrow and Gatwick. Within walking distance are excellent coffee bars, restaurants, parks and a gym. The ground floor bedroom has a double bed, wardrobe, cupboards and shelves and an en-suite toilet and sink. The decor is Far Eastern with features from my many travels to that area. The shared bathroom upstairs for the use of guests is very spacious with a bath, a separate shower cubicle and cupboard with tumble drier and washing machine. The decor is Tuscan from when I lived in Italy for 10 years. The sitting room with smart TV and most Sky channels  is available to guests if the room is free. The decor is Indian from my many trips to that country.  There is a large garden (Moroccan this time!) with tables and chairs for outside snacks and there are sunbeds available if desired.  The kitchen is available for breakfast and to store small items in
neighborhood_overview: This is a great neighbourhood with friendly neighbours and shops. If you come to stay at my home, I can recommend all the places to eat, walk and enjoy the area. We are close to the famous Richmond Park which has beautiful plantations, a restaurant and miles of walks. Many bus routes also operate on the High Street. My home is less than 10 minutes by train from the renowned Wimbledon Lawn Tennis Club.
notes: I have two delightful young lodgers, one of whom works in the events industry and the other is a kindergarten nurse. They both come and go as friends and travel a lot, so they are sometimes there and often not.  I have a gorgeous Russian Blue cat (one of the few cats which people with allergies can cope with).
transit: The Uber taxi service is available in New Malden, and, as per above train stations and bus stops are within a 5 minute walk from the front door. A car rental agency is situated a short bus ride away.
access: The sitting room with smart TV and most Sky channels  is available to guests if the room is free. The decor is Indian from my many trips to that country.  There is a large garden (Moroccan this time!) with tables and chairs for outside snacks and there are sunbeds available if desired.  The kitchen is available for breakfast and to store small items in the fridge. Unfortunately the kitchen is not available for making meals but breakfast or other meals can be ordered by prior arrangement - I am a good cook, she says modestly!
interaction: I have lived in the London area all my life (apart from 10 years in sunny Tuscany) and really do know it well. I can recommend all the sights, good restaurants, West End shows in London and in the suburbs e.g. Hampton Court is close by, where Henry VIII lived!. I work in the events industry and so have a lot of knowledge of the places not to miss in the UK such as Oxford, Cambridge, Bath, Edinburgh and how to get to them.
house_rules: I do not allow smoking in the house and am very strict about this. Obviously, as I have a cat, other pets are not very welcome - especially dogs! The kitchen is available for the making of cups of tea and coffee and the fridge and ice-making machine are for your use.  However, I am not able to offer the kitchen for eating takeaway food as I and my lodgers require the room in the evenings. Obviously takeaway food also cannot be eaten in the bedroom.
host_about: I have been a freelance events organiser for many years and have travelled the world with my job and whenever I get a free minute! I own a large Edwardian house 30 minutes from London. I have a 29 year old daughter who has her own flat nearby and with whom I have a really great relationship and see often. I travel a lot - Barbados being my favourite place to spend Xmas and the New Yeart - and visit friends and family abroad at every opportunity. I love reading, movies, the theatre and music of all kinds (except, sadly, classical). I'm an avid cook and, having lived in Italy for 10 years in the past, pasta is my speciality. I cook a lot and eat out a couple of times a week - different nationality food and restaurants are my idea of heaven.

name: Smart & simple large double room
summary: Convenient, comfortable apartment with friendly young housemates. Only 20 minutes to Central London with good transport links to Wimbledon, Kingston and surrounding areas. It's quiet after 10:30pm, so hopefully you'll get a good night's sleep.
space: The room is a large double and offers clean and comfortable accommodation for one or two people in a standard double bed with an orthopaedic mattress.  There are a number of things for your convenience, including: - fresh cotton linen - clean towels - fast wi fi - an extra set of linen (if you are staying for 4 days or more) There is a little noise from nearby trains during the day. It's quiet after 11pm. Guest 'welcome' is usually after 6pm. Check out is before 10am.
description: Convenient, comfortable apartment with friendly young housemates. Only 20 minutes to Central London with good transport links to Wimbledon, Kingston and surrounding areas. It's quiet after 10:30pm, so hopefully you'll get a good night's sleep. The room is a large double and offers clean and comfortable accommodation for one or two people in a standard double bed with an orthopaedic mattress.  There are a number of things for your convenience, including: - fresh cotton linen - clean towels - fast wi fi - an extra set of linen (if you are staying for 4 days or more) There is a little noise from nearby trains during the day. It's quiet after 11pm. Guest 'welcome' is usually after 6pm. Check out is before 10am. There's a shared bathroom, a shared kitchen and spacious studio living room.  Off street parking may be possible for one vehicle - please ask in advance before booking. The flat is not suitable for wheelchairs due to restricted access (steps). - Central London in 20 mins - easy acce
neighborhood_overview: - Central London in 20 mins - easy access to local shops and restaurants - Wimbledon village and Centre Court 10 mins away by car - easy access to Richmond Park - great local pub (The Glasshouse) - nearby Nepalese restaurant (The Royal Gurkha)   New Malden is one of the biggest Korean communities outside of South Korea, so you'll find lots of authentic Korean restaurants and deli stores.  My favourite thing about the neighbourhood: you are less than 10 min drive to the natural beauty (and wild deer) in Richmond Park.
access: There's a shared bathroom, a shared kitchen and spacious studio living room.  Off street parking may be possible for one vehicle - please ask in advance before booking. The flat is not suitable for wheelchairs due to restricted access (steps).
house_rules: If you have any special requirements, please ask before booking. I want you to have a great stay and will do my best to accommodate. The room is bookable for one or two people. Guests 18+ unless agreed beforehand. No additional guests other than those booking unless agreed beforehand. Check-in typically after 6pm, unless agreed beforehand.
host_about: Thanks for considering staying at my place and checking out my profile.Following are a few things about myself: I've travelled widely - Asia, North America and Latin America . I'm reasonably well educated (no claims to intelligence). Always enjoy meeting interesting people. Love remote Greek islands, high mountains and wild remote places. Occasional meditator. Infrequent teacher of interesting things. Helpful and collaborative by nature. I appreciate the tranquility of the early morning. I write a bit. Ex-buddhist monk. I work for Apple. If you have any questions, please just ask.Ed

house_rules: No smoking household! Please note, the kitchen is only available by arrangement and the preparation of light snacks only. We can make exceptions when necessary! neighborhood_overview: This is a safe and friendly area popular with young families, an easy train ride to Wimbledon and to London. A short walk takes you to the River Thames and its waterside restaurants and pubs. It is also close to Richmond Park which is pleasant for a stroll.
notes: This is a mid-19th century house and the stairs up to the bedrooms are steep by modern standards. This would not be suitable for someone with mobility problems. The bathroom is downstairs so please note this if it would be an issue to use stairs during the night. Also the doors in the older part of the house are not high - anyone over about 6 foot 2 / 188 cm should take care. The parking space outside the house is generally _not_ available for guest use, at least not during the week in term time. Please enquire if you want to know about parking. There are public car parks nearby.
transit: Trains go from London Waterloo to Kingston (a ten-minute walk) and Norbiton (slightly further). Direct trains to Wimbledon & London every 15 minutes (30 minutes on Sundays). Faster trains from Surbiton (a short bus ride or 30-minute walk) into London or to the south of England. Buses stop at the top of the road including the 371 to Richmond and the 85 to Putney and Fulham as well as local buses. More bus routes from the centre of Kingston. 24-hour buses run to and from Heathrow Airport, Fulham and Wimbledon.

neighborhood_overview: The Apartment is situated on City's Doorstep and is situated in beautiful landscaped gardens in Kingston-upon-Thames, London, England - which is located within the zone 6 London transport area.  Kingston Upon Thames is one of London's finest historic settings,   known for its great shopping, river-side restaurants and cafes  and has a well regarded theatre 'The Rose' with a full and varied programme to suit all tastes.
notes: There is secure underground parking available if you need this. There is Wi-Fi available on a 'pay as you go' basis from Wifinity a local provider, this is very easy to access an costs approx å£7.00 per week for 4 devices. There is a å£100.00 cash (GBP) security deposit due at check-in which is fully refundable at check-out assuming no major damage. The minimum stay duration is one week.  Weekend-check-in is 15:00 and check-out is 12:00. Mid-week check-in is from 17:00 and check-out is by arrangement (usually early morning or evening).
transit: For travel links, Kingston Station (National Rail) is nearby - only a brisk five minute walk. Buses are very frequent. The train journey is 20 minutes into London Waterloo with at least 4 trains per hour Mon to Sat. Wimbledon is a 15 minute journey - good for tennis fans!  The apartment is located close to the open spaces of Richmond Park, Bushy Park, Home Park, the world famous Kew Gardens and King Henry VIII's Hampton Court Palace, which can be reached by river bus in just 15 minutes. The apartment is located moments from the banks of the River as well as walking distance from extensive shopping and entertainment facilities including the Bentalls Centre & John Lewis mega-store. Kingston bars, cafes and shops.
access: The apartment is situated within a secure gated complex with concierge management.  There is a gym on site to which all residents have access.
interaction: Maggie & Giovanni your hosts love living in London - there's so much to do - you'll always have something exciting to plan for! We also love travelling ourselves and meeting new people and we try to get away as often as we can with our two boys (school holidays are the only limiting factor!). We hope you'll come to London and discover just how amazing this great city really is! We live close to the apartment and will meet you at check-in to give you the keys and show you around.
house_rules: The apartment has a no smoking, no pet policy.
host_about: Maggie and Giovanni are your hosts. We've lived in London for more than 20 years and love it! We know you'll love this great city too. We love cycling and walking on the Thames path and in the Royal Parks - especially Richmond. You can do this easily when your London base is Kingston. It's easy to get into the city centre from Kingston - 20 minutes brings you to the top West End shows and restaurants. We're looking forward to welcoming you to Kingston - one of London's nicest suburbs and a destination in its own right!
street: Seven Kings Way, Kingston upon Thames, KT2, United Kingdom

host_about: Very much a live and let live character. I enjoy life as much as I can with many varying interests from art to antiques, sewing to yoga, cooking to sunbathing. I am a relaxed and inclusive person, who loves to chat to her guests to learn about their travels and lifestyle. I have an open door policy, and will keep you safe. That sounds like a contradiction in terms but it means, I accept people at face value, but I am very security conscious. So if you think you might like to try your luck at either conning, tricking, scamming, or defrauding me, don't bother, I'm already on to you. That's the joy of the open door policy.

name: Luxury bedroom with Cabin retreat
summary: My very comfortable two bedroom apartment has a spacious open plan living area which leads onto a very tranquil sunny garden . There is a spacious summer house too which guests are welcome to use, which is great for relaxing in on lovely summer evenings.There are plenty of great restaurants and local pubs too within a very short walk. A great base to visit London as its just 18mins on the train to Waterloo but you have a great suburban local feel when you gravitate back home.
space: The bedroom is very spacious  with a king size comfortable bed  with team and coffee making faculties in the room . Although the bathroom is not en suite it is immediately next door to the bedroom .  The property is a ground floor flat in a lovely period building . The main living area is open plan with bi folding doors to the garden where there is seating areas to relax in plus a summer house to enjoy . If you are travelling here on business the wifi hub is the bedroom  so the wifi speed is pretty good and there is a writing bureau if you require space to work .

neighborhood_overview: I have lived in this area now just over 25 years ands I love living here. I originally moved here from Wales l I love the out doors and so  this area has all what a great London Suburb can offer  with great restaurants coffee shops and pubs with some of the most beautiful walks along the river Thames to Hampton court and Richmond and beautiful parks like Richmond and bushy park .  It's a great base for visiting London or if you are planning a visit to Hampton court flower show  then it's just 6mins on the train to Hampton court . It's a great base for Wimbledon too .  Kingston is  just a short 15/20 minutes walk away and has one of the best shopping centres outside London . A old market town which has developed into a vibrant busy town with great places to eat along the river .
notes: Pets are welcome . I have two dogs of my own living at the property . Rosie a 1 year old westie and Charlie a 12 year old bichone . Both dogs are very friendly .  I am happy for guests to smoke in the garden .
transit: There's great transport here .surbiton station is the nearest with trains so frequent you really do not need to check the train times and it's only 18 mins to Waterloo and the station is just a 12 min walk from  my flat  . There is a bus stop immediately outside the flat where you can catch the k1 to the train station or across the road if you plan a shopping trip to Kingston
access: Guests are very welcome to use the open plan living area ,garden and summer house.. Feel free to make yourself tea and coffee .  There is Sky TV in the lounge so please feel free to make yourself comfortable .
interaction: I will be present at the property and would like to make you feel very welcome  , it's your home too . If you need any travel advise please ask or would like any recommendations for the local area.

name: 4 bed house Wimbledon
summary: This lovely family home is located in Outer London, in a leafy neighbourhood called Kingston upon Thames which borders Wimbledon to the east and Richmond to the north.
space: The All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club, which hosts the Wimbledon Championships in the summer, can be reached in approximately 30 minutes via public transport, and just 10 minutes by car. As you step inside the house, you will find towards the right is a modern, sizeable kitchen fitted with pine cabinetry and granite surfaces. It comes with a 5-seater breakfast bar as well as modern amenities which include an American-style fridge with ice dispenser, double oven and 5-burner gas hob. There is a handy utility room just off the kitchen where essential facilities are stored such as washing machine and tumble dryer. Towards the far end of the ground floor is a spacious living and dining room that is flooded with natural sunlight from large French doors to the garden. The sitting space has a tasteful design with cream carpeting and matching leather sofas, arranged by a striking fireplace. The sleek dining table is arranged to one side with leather chairs to seat six guests comfortably
description: This lovely family home is located in Outer London, in a leafy neighbourhood called Kingston upon Thames which borders Wimbledon to the east and Richmond to the north. The All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club, which hosts the Wimbledon Championships in the summer, can be reached in approximately 30 minutes via public transport, and just 10 minutes by car. As you step inside the house, you will find towards the right is a modern, sizeable kitchen fitted with pine cabinetry and granite surfaces. It comes with a 5-seater breakfast bar as well as modern amenities which include an American-style fridge with ice dispenser, double oven and 5-burner gas hob. There is a handy utility room just off the kitchen where essential facilities are stored such as washing machine and tumble dryer. Towards the far end of the ground floor is a spacious living and dining room that is flooded with natural sunlight from large French doors to the garden. The sitting space has a tasteful design with cream c
neighborhood_overview: Kingston is a popular neighbourhood with both families and young people as it offers easy access into Central London with trains reaching Waterloo in 35 minutes. Norbiton and New Malden train stations can be reached in 12-15 via bus, for mainline trains. The number 57 bus will get you to Norbiton and lively central Kingston in 15 minutes for a huge choice of excellent restaurants, cafes and cocktail bars as well as a large shopping centre with a mix of high street and high end shops.
notes: OTHER THINGS TO NOTE: The lead guest will be required to sign an Occupation Agreement prior to arrival. Please note that the lead guest must be over 25 years old. Normal check in time is between 3pm and 7pm. All other times may incur an additional fee.
transit: The area is blessed with the gorgeous Richmond Park which is a a short drive away. The Royal Park boasts 2400 acres of parkland with wildlife including deer roaming free, a wonderful place to stroll and picnic.
host_about: Greetings from London!  My name is Tom and I manage this collection of hand-picked apartments and houses for their individual owners while they are away. Each property is carefully selected and offers a stylish living experience and excellent value. As a lifelong Londoner I love having the opportunity to share these spaces, my knowledge and personal recommendations about this great city with those visiting for both short and long term stays. All our guests will be greeted personally at the property by a member of our hospitality team, and 24 hour guest assistance is also provided by our professional customer service team should any problems arise during your stay.  If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me and I will be sure to answer them promptly.

name: Double ensuite private room on 2nd floor for you!
summary: Stylish Edwardian family home in Kingston upon Thames, conveniently close to transport links into central London. Attractive, spacious and private, double ensuite bedroom on top floor. Pubs, restaurants, shops, cafÌ©s, markets, the river Thames and Richmond Park nearby.
space: Our house is a home - it is lived in and loved, quirky and unique.  The room, suitable for single person or a couple, is at the top of the house on 2nd floor, giving you space to relax in privacy.  The windows on opposing sides of the room, fill the space with light, both morning and evening.  The room is clean and bright with a double bed and firm orthopaedic mattress. Ample hanging space, shelves, chest of drawers and bedside table are provided along with hairdryer, toiletries, towels and facecloths.  A 24in LED TV in the room is tuned for Freeview channels. Free Wifi available, good reception. We have a newly installed ensuite bathroom with toilet, handbasin and shower for your private use. We also have another (shared) shower room which you can use also if you prefer.
description: Stylish Edwardian family home in Kingston upon Thames, conveniently close to transport links into central London. Attractive, spacious and private, double ensuite bedroom on top floor. Free Wifi available, good reception. We have a newly installed ensuite bathroom with toilet, handbasin and shower for your private use. We also have another (share
neighborhood_overview: We live on a fairly busy road and are very well situated - for either a 15 minute walk/5 minute bus ride into Kingston town centre, with all the major shops (John Lewis, Bentall Centre) and bustling market (every day) with many excellent food stalls or 7 minute walk to Norbiton Station, where you can catch a train and be in Waterloo in 25 minutes.  Richmond Park, Hampton Court, Ham House, the riverside, the towpath - all are within easy reach.   If you are wanting to catch Wimbledon Tennis, during June/July, it can be reached by train (25 mins) or 2 buses within approx 45 minutes.  For rugby, travel to Twickenham Stadium by train and walking, will take approx 45 minutes.  We have a very good pub, 2 minutes down the Hill where you can enjoy lunch and dinner menus and many different restaurants in Kingston.  We are 2 minutes away from Kingston Hospital.  Hampton Court Flower Show in July is approx 20 minutes away by bus or train.  For rugby fans, Twickenham Stadium is approx 45 minutes a
notes: As we are here working most of the time, we can be flexible about your check-in time - we will communicate with you before your arrival date, to find out how best to accommodate your travel plans and will make every effort to be here to welcome you at your desired arrival time.   We will provide a "help yourself" type breakfast downstairs in our kitchen each morning - home made bread for toast and jam/marmite/peanut butter, fruit and fibre cereal, muesli & granola, tea and coffee. We make our own wine at home, so you may find us in the kitchen, sterilising and bottling wine! We have a tortoise in the garden, he has his own house and the run of the garden - you might see him walking on the grass in the sun.  Of course, he hibernates over winter.
transit: We have a steep drive on which it is permissible for guests to park by prior agreement with ourselves. We often have visitors, so we would advise you the best way to park on the drive to avoid blocking any other cars in. Free parking for 1 car, but for longer than 3 days, there will be a small charge - to be discussed. Trains to Waterloo, Wimbledon, Clapham Junction, Vauxhall are very frequent, buses into Kingston, Wimbledon, Twickenham, Teddington, Richmond are also very frequent.  Trains to and from Gatwick and Heathrow - nearest station Clapham Junction (14 min train journey). From Kingston there is a bus which takes you to Heathrow (leave 1 hour max to get there) for the price of a single bus fare - approx. å£1.50 with Oyster card or contactless travel! There are night buses which run to and from central London.
access: We have a lovely garden in which you are very welcome to sit and relax, eat breakfast, drink tea/coffee if you wish. We have a small 2nd fridge where food and drink can be stored. Accommodation is on a room only basis and therefore the kitchen is not for general use except for preparing light refreshments/snacks and tea/coffee. Your room is on the top floor of the house and directly outside, there is a little landing space which guests can also use.  There is an ensuite bathroom with shower gel, shampoo and other miscellaneous toiletries all provided.  Towels and facecloths provided as well. Free guest wifi is provided. Free Parking, however longer term parking (anything beyond 3 days) will require special arrangement at minimal cost (please discuss with us). We have a very steep drive - if you need help getting up the drive, please knock and we can come out and help you.  Please park considerately so that your car does not block our car from exiting.  We also have bicycles which we ne
interaction: We have our own office at home, so one (or two of us) will be here working most of the time. We are very happy to offer advice about travel and local information if you require.  Just ask if you need help!  We both can speak some French and a little Spanish - enough to get by.
house_rules: No smoking on the premises please, at the back of the garden is fine  - ashtray provided!  No pets allowed. Please do not invite anyone to our house, unless previously agreed with us. We will provide you with a spare set of keys - if you come in late or go out early, please be mindful that we both work and therefore need our beauty sleep! We would appreciate it if you close the windows in the room when you go out, so as not to let any rain in. If you have a car, we provide free parking for up to 3 days - there will be a charge for further days - please discuss with us.  It is important that you park considerately so that BOTH your car and our car can get in and out of the drive easily at all times. Sorry, but we do not allow anyone other than our guests to park on our drive. Please clean up after yourself in kitchen. Nothing but toilet paper in toilet please.
host_location: Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames, England, United Kingdom
host_about: We are Lee and Charlie and are married with 2 children - 27 and 29 years old. We have a small IT consultancy business working with small businesses, troubleshooting computers particularly Apple Macs.  We have a beautiful, Edwardian home in Kingston upon Thames.  I particularly love cooking, we both like films, gardening, music of all kinds and making wines.  Although it is not strictly a hobby for us, our house is a "work in progress" and we often have DIY projects on the go.

host_about: I am Mike but with me you get Jean too so more of a mature couple than a crusty old codger. We are an active loving couple who enjoy travel, caravaning, dinghy and ocean sailing. I have lived in South Africa and Australia and Jean in Venezuela, hence the multilingualism.Having traveled extensively, Jean and I have many friends around the world and we love them to visit us when they are in the UK so the house often vibrates with different accents and languages. We welcome our Airbnb guests in the same way we welcome our friends and success for us is to add our guests to the long list of friends who have shared our home. Come as welcome guests and leave as lifelong friends.       Having hosted ten couples over the past few months we are now aiming for Super Host Status that means 5 star service for all our guests.  Motto: Be kind, deal honestly, maintain a great attitude, be tenacious. I try!

host_location: Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames, England, United Kingdom
host_about: Hello! I moved to England in 1966 although I was originally from Prague where I went to University to study as a teacher.  I speak Czech, Russian and am studying French and I also enjoy theatre, classical music, horticulture, history, cross country skiing , swimming, medau and walking in the countryside.I have done many things in my life including working in several shops, as a secretary, a cycle proficiency instructor, an interpretor, a translator.....I have driven lorries for a company and ambulances for London Ambulance Service and amongst all this, I have brought up 4 children... perhaps the biggest challenge in (URL HIDDEN) now I try to relax .... That's when I am not looking after the grandchildren on behalf of my 2 grown up sons. I would like you to feel welcome in my homeÛ_and like to have guests who enjoy evenings out but not those who are here for the clubbing scene as it would disturb me. Strictly non smokers either inside or out, thank you very much!

neighborhood_overview: Our house is a detached Victorian villa in a quiet tree-lined, friendly  residential road.
transit: The house is approx 5 minute walk from the bustling market town shopping centre or Kingston train station from where you can take one of the frequent trains to Central London, Wimbledon or Twickenham. Richmond park and the river are also within easy walking distance and you may want to take a beautiful boat trip along the river Thames and alight at Richmond Bridge.  Kingston is ideally placed for Heathrow airport (short taxi ride or there is a bus that runs to Kingston station). Gatwick airport is also easily accessible although slightly further away than Heathrow.
access: The room is on the top floor of the house and is reached via the front entrance to the house. Our family accommodation is on the ground and first floor. The washer/dryer is in the utility room on the ground floor and guests  are welcome to use these facilities.
interaction: We love Kingston and would be very happy to give you as much (or as little) advice you need so that you can enjoy the area like a local. We have a lovely local pub within a couple of minutes walk if you like that sort of thing or you may wish to walk/bike around Richmond Park to see the gorgeous baby deer roaming freely around you. Why not get lost in the famous Hampton Court Maze, or if sport is your thing, go to see the tennis at Wimbledon or the rugby at Twickenham. Or take a short train ride into Central London to visit the many art galleries, theatres, I could go on and on...!
house_rules: Û¢ Check-in time is 3PM. This is our family home so would like are guests to feel relaxed and comfortable whilst treating the home respectfully and with consideration. It is a strictly non-smoking household and the room is for booked guests only.

My Husband works for Sky TV and loves his job. We enjoy life to the full and spend as much time as we can in South West of France. We love cooking/entertaining/ travelling/ and spending time with our loved ones. We also have a very lovely but independent cat who comes and goes as he pleases. If you Airbnb with us you can expect a warm welcome and a very comfortable stay in the heart of Kingston.

name: Victorian semi-detached family home
summary: Our cosy victorian family home is on a quiet street on the edge of historic Kingston's town centre with its excellent shopping & night life. Easy access to central London by train (30mins).  Perfect accomodation for a family break.
space: The house is a lovely victorian character semi -detached in a pleasant street just a few minutes walk from Kingston Upon Thames town centre and Norbiton Rail station.  It's a family home (we have a three year old daughter) and so has all the kit necessary to cater for a little one.  There are two ensuite double bedrooms (one with a futon bed).  Our daughter's room has a kids single bed that would suit a child up to 10ish and we also have a moses basket and a cot.  We have a flip out single bed which can be accomodated in any of the other rooms, and the lounge has a comy sofa bed.

neighborhood_overview: Kingston is a fantastic neighbourhood situated on the edge of London.  Indeed it's big enough to be considered a town in itself and is a large shopping and leisure destination.  The thing that sets it apart from other similar areas around London is the beautiful Thames riverside and the green space - both Richmond and Bushy Park are stunning deer parks with acres of woodland and heathland walks to enjoy.  If you like cosy pubs there are loads to choose from, most with excellent food and real ale/craft beers on tap.
notes: Please note - our home isn't really suitable for groups of single guests. We don't accept single sex parties or groups of people under 20 - sorry. Whilst parking is restricted Mon-Sat we can provide permits for one vehicle.
transit: Closest rail station - Norbiton is a 10minute walk and it takes 28mins to London Waterloo and 20 mins to Richmond. Surbiton station is 20min walk and allows quick access to south west England without needing to bother with central London. Lots of nice walking and cycling routes along the river and through Richmond Park/Bushy Park.  Good road access via A3 to M25/M3 etc.  The area is in a controlled parking zone, however we can provide permits.
access: The letting is for the whole house, so includes all appliances, furniture etc.  We have a widescreen TV with Freeview and BT Vision (including BT Sport), DVD player and free broadband and Wifi. You can download hundreds of films on BT vision (at an additional cost). We also have three pedal cycles (two with child seats) guests are welcome to use to explore Richmond Park/The Thames etc; as well as heaps of toys suitable for young children.
interaction: We don't tend to be around during lettings - hence why the house is available!
house_rules: As you would in your own place (assuming you tend to look after where you call home!).  We don't charge extra for cleaning but please leave the house as you found it.  We live in a family neighbourhood (and we like our neighbours!) so this isn't the place for late night parties. All guests must keep noise outside and loud music etc generally to a minimum after 11pm.

Flat is also located very close to the Surbiton British rail train station for Central London (fast trains to Waterloo take only 17min) and bus stops near-by with bus connections to the surrounding areas such as Richmond Park, Bushy Park, 16th Century Hampton Court Palace, Chessington World of Adventures and Heathrow Airport. There is a large supermarket (Waitrose), dry cleaners, post office, cafes, takeaway shops about 8min walk from the flat. The double room is comfy, bright and freshly decorated.
