name: Lovely family home
summary: Our lovely 4-bedroom family home is a great choice for people who want to be close to London and the countryside. Lots of space and light and the pleasure of having a whole house to relax in while you're on holiday.
space: Our spacious family home has an open plan, contemporary kitchen/diner/living room where we spend the majority of our time.  There is direct access to an outside patio area with dining area and a garden. There is a playroom with sofa bed where our young children play and keep their toys (they'll be very happy to share). We also have a downstairs toilet. There are two  spacious double bedrooms on the first floor with a luxurious bathroom. On the second floor is single room suitable for a young child and a double bedroom with en-suite bathroom and a lovely view.

name: Large Double Room in a Family Home
summary: Come and stay with us in our large double room in our family home ÛÒ a home away from home on your travels.
space: I am offering a large spacious, double room in my family home - a Victorian house, located in a residential area on the outskirts of London.  The house throughout is very clean and bright. The room is on the 1st floor and contains a double bed, wardrobe, chests of drawers, a desk and chair and plenty of storage.  There is also a 32" flatscreen TV and an iPad available for use in the room - allowing you to watch TV, iPlayer, movies and listen to music or the radio.  There are also tea & coffee making facilities available in your room. The room is designed for two people, sharing the double bed - however we can accommodate three people by use of a good quality camp bed, which we will provide.  For our younger guests there is also a travel cot and mattress available for use - please let us know if you need it! The large, shared bathroom is just along the landing (the bathroom is only shared with our seven year old daughter, so you have it to yourself most of the time - it's for your use o
description: Come and stay with us in our large double room in our family home ÛÒ a home away from home on your travels. I am offering a large spacious, double room in my family home - a Victorian house, located in a residential area on the outskirts of London.  The house throughout is very clean and bright. The room is on the 1st floor and contains a double bed, wardrobe, chests of drawers, a desk and chair and plenty of storage.  There is also a 32" flatscreen TV and an iPad available for use in the room - allowing you to watch TV, iPlayer, movies and listen to music or the radio.  There are also tea & coffee making facilities available in your room. The room is designed for two people, sharing the double bed - however we can accommodate three people by use of a good quality camp bed, which we will provide.  For our younger guests there is also a travel cot and mattress available for use - please let us know if you need it! The large, shared bathroom is just along the landing (the bathroom is only
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Kingston, a leafy suburban town in Surrey ideally located for Hampton Court Palace, Richmond, Wimbledon, Twickenham Rugby Stadium, Sandown Park and Kempton Park Racecourse.  We are also a great base for anyone coming to see the tennis at Wimbledon - just a short train ride away, with three stations within walking distance of the house.
notes: Bed linen and towels are provided.  Wireless internet is included.  Children are welcome, and can sleep on an extra bed in the large bedroom, for an extra charge - let us know what you need in advance and we'll work out the details! We don't have off street parking, but can provide parking permits for a small cost (å£3 per full day). There is a cleaning fee of å£10.00 per booking if less than a week, or å£10.00 per week if longer. Finally, the room does face on to a road and so there can be a little traffic noise, but no more than expected from anywhere in Greater London!
transit: For those coming to experience the centre of London, the house is only a short distance from Surbiton (approximately a 4 minute drive / 20 minute walk), Kingston (4 min drive / 14 min walk) and Norbiton (5 min drive / 17 min walk) train stations (Zone 5/6) and trains are very frequent into the centre of London (the quickest train from Waterloo station takes 17 minutes to Surbiton).  There is also a bus stop nearby where regular buses can take you to Surbiton station, if you don't feel like walking! We are very near the River Thames with all of it's amenities - go for a walk beside the river, try the boat trips into London/Richmond and Hampton Court, or get a bus from Kingston to visit nearby Kew Gardens.  We also have the benefit of plenty of green space nearby, with two Royal Parks - Bushy Park and Richmond Park - close by. Kingston upon Thames is a thriving town with a beautiful old market and one of the best shopping areas outside central London, only a 10 minute walk from the front
access: The main rooms you have access to are the bedroom and the bathroom on the same floor (as detailed above).  You're also welcome to use the kitchen to make tea, coffee and for the preparation of light snacks and meals.  However, be warned - the fridge is quite small so please keep this in mind if you would like to store anything!   Also in the kitchen is our computer with attached printer, which you're welcome to use if you need to check your email, or print street maps, directions or flight boarding passes etc.
interaction: One of us will be there to welcome you to our home on your arrival and show you where everything is, how it works, and to answer any questions you may have.  The family is around most evenings, so join us for a coffee and a chat if youÛªre around.  This is a warm, family environment and we want to make all our guests feel welcome - weÛªll all be living together during your stay, but our aim is to make your time with us as comfortable as possible. This is a bi-lingual house (Spanish and English), so we can offer extra support to some international visitors!  We also have a small dog in the house - a Maltese terrier called Holly, who will welcome you to the house.  She is quiet, well behaved and lives downstairs, so shouldn't affect your stay at all!
house_rules: We try and keep things nice and friendly so not too many rules... This is a strictly non-smoking house. No high heeled shoes or stilettos on our wooden floors (bring your slippers!)!  Kitchen facilities are available if needed, but please ask us first and tidy up and wash up afterwards. Also - the fridge is very small so we'll have to manage with limited space! Please don't invite other people back to our home - no extra guests apart from those on the booking, without prior arrangement. Please treat our stuff as you would like your stuff to be treated!
host_location: Kingston Upon Thames, England, United Kingdom
host_about: My name is James and I live in Kingston upon Thames, a buzzing suburb of London, with my wife, Yolanda, and our young daughter, Rebeca.  I work in IT, fairly locally, so I am available to help with anything you need during your stay (and may be able to pick you up from one of the local stations if needed!).  I was brought up in the area and so can give you an insider's knowledge about the best things to do, both locally and across London.I enjoy watching sport, especially rugby, and am a season ticket holder at the local rugby club Harlequins.  I also enjoy running (you're welcome to join me for an early morning run!), food - both cooking and eating - and photography.
street: Villiers Road, Kingston upon Thames, Surrey KT1 3AP, United Kingdom

name: Edwardian 4 bed House - SW London
summary: 5 minutes walk to the station and 25 minutes from Waterloo.  Perfect base to visit London, Richmond Park and Richmond, Hampton Court Palace and the market town of Kingston upon Thames.  Come back to a relaxing well-equipped house just for you.
space: Our house is a traditional Edwardian semi-detached house in a quiet leafy neighbourhood with enough beds to accommodate 10 guests, 3 minutes from a well-equipped park and 5 minutes from the station which is on the mainline to Waterloo.   There are 4 bedrooms within the house (1 double, 2 singles and a twin room).  The beds in the twin room have extra stowaway beds below (with proper mattresses). We also have a garden room which has a double sofa bed in.  The garden room has a table tennis table, a treadmill and an exercise bike.  There is electricity and wifi access in this room also. The garden is small, but has a patio and outdoor table and chairs (plus deck chairs) for outdoor living.

neighborhood_overview: New Malden is a really diverse community.  It has the largest Korean population of anywhere in Europe and consequently the supermarkets and Korean restaurants have a many interesting delicacies.  The High Street has its fair share of cafes and there is a nice pub called the Glasshouse near the station which does good food.  Richmond park is close by and great for long walks
notes: We have two cats (Cosmo and Nacho) who will need to be fed.  They are very friendly and only really live in the kitchen where they have baskets where they sleep.
transit: To get here from Heathrow airport there is a bus, the X26 or from Gatwick take the train to Clapham Junction and then cross to platform 11 for the trains to New Malden - whole journey takes approximately 1 hour.  There is street parking outside the house with no restrictions
access: Guests will have access to the entire space for their own private use.
interaction: We will be available by telephone to answer any questions and will have someone local to help with any problems if required.
house_rules: We would like guests to treat the house as if it were their own.   The house is in a neighbourhood where many families with small children live.  Loud noise and all-night parties are therefore not allowed at this house.
host_about: I live in New Malden with my husband, Steve and our 3 children (the youngest is 12).  We both work Monday to Friday but have a spare bedroom and so decided to offer it on Airbnb as we enjoy meeting new people.  I think I'm a good host - I tend to play it by ear - if you want to be left in peace then fine, if not come and share a coffee and a chat ( if we're around!)

name: Riverside house close to station
summary: This charming 40's house was built within a 19th century walled garden with a cosy cottage feel. Nestled on the edge of Canbury Park on banks of the river Thames the house is 90 meters from the water and Boater Pub and 1km from the train station.
space: This spacious family home has 3 main living areas. A large living room, large dining room and good sized eat in kitchen. There are 3 double rooms all with double beds the smallest being a surprisingly comfortable futon. The master has a en suite and dressing room and the two guest rooms are serviced by a generous family bathroom. The ground floor has a toilet and shower room.
description: This charming 40's house was built within a 19th century walled garden with a cosy cottage feel. Nestled on the edge of Canbury Park on banks of the river Thames the house is 90 meters from the water and Boater Pub and 1km from the train station. This spacious family home has 3 main living areas. A large living room, large dining room and good sized eat in kitchen. There are 3 double rooms all with double beds the smallest being a surprisingly comfortable futon. The master has a en suite and dressing room and the two guest rooms are serviced by a generous family bathroom. The ground floor has a toilet and shower room. The crowning glory of this home is its beautiful garden, accessible by a side door from the kitchen or double opening doors from the dinning room, it is south facing and captures the sun all day. There is a outdoor dinning set and BBQ for 'al fresco dinning and small pond (no fish only a family of frogs).  The front of the house has parking for one car but there is ample
neighborhood_overview: Richmond Park, Deer Park and Bushy park are all within 2 miles of the house as is Ham Common and Richmond Green, Ham House, Marble Hill House and Gardens are all just few miles more down the road. Kingston has a vibrant shopping scene with Bentalls shopping mall, John Lewis and other major department stores and a bustling town center full of shops, cafes and restaurants such as Jamie Oliver's among others. And of course the riverside is teaming with bars and pubs.
transit: Kingston rail station is 1km away. there is onsite parking for 1 car and good free parking option in Bank Lane and the neighboring streets. A bus service runs from Richmond road, 50 meters away towards Richmond/Clapham Park or Surbiton in the other direction. The M3, M4, M25 and A3 are all accessible with a few miles.
access: The crowning glory of this home is its beautiful garden, accessible by a side door from the kitchen or double opening doors from the dinning room, it is south facing and captures the sun all day. There is a outdoor dinning set and BBQ for 'al fresco dinning and small pond (no fish only a family of frogs).  The front of the house has parking for one car but there is ample un metered street parking on Bank Lane and neighboring streets.  Kingston Mainline station runs a service to London Waterloo every 15 minutes (except Sundays, every 30) taking just 27minutes or the opposite way to Richmond and Shepperton. Wimbledon is just 4 stops (10 minutes) and there is the no. 65 bus at the  end of the street which also heads towards Richmond in around 15-20 mins.
interaction: We are able to offer hints and tip for the local area in the lead up to your stay but unfortunately not during in person. A contact number will be provided for emergencies and you are welcome email or text any general questions during your stay.
house_rules: This is our home and although it is not brand new, we like to keep it clean and tidy. Please treat it as you would your own. Please take your shoes off at the door and there is strictly no smoking inside. The kitchen is fully equipped and available to use  including a dishwasher, please wash and put away items that are used. You may help yourself to cereal and condiments from the cupboards. A clothes washer and dryer are also both available to use. We live in  mostly quite neighborhood so wild parties are out of the question, evening meals and drinks in the back yard are perfectly fine but please respect our neighbors by not carrying on loud conversations into the early morning.  Recycling goes out once a week and rubbish once every two weeks for which we provide a schedule, these only need to be moved a meter or two into site the night before so the bin men collect them.
host_about: Seasoned traveller. From Five Stars to Five Billion stars I have stayed in some amazing places. Five things I cant live without? My wife, a place to relax, something adventurous to do, a few creature comforts and comfortable bed.As a guest I'm always grateful and love to get to know somewhere from a locals perspective. As a host I'm always happy to share information and experiences and ensure you get the best experience.  My life motto: Work hard, then relax.
street: Bank Lane, Kingston upon Thames, KT2 5AZ, United Kingdom

The apartment accommodates only one or two persons.

I am offering a light and airy double (king size bed) or twin room, and your own private living room in my Victorian home, located in the residential area of north Kingston.  Your bedroom has plenty of drawer storage, space for hanging clothes, a dressing table/desk and chair,  and a hairdryer.  Your comfortable living room has a sofa, armchair, flat screen TV/DVD player with various cable channels and radio. Guests share the bathroom with just me (and I never hog it!), a second loo, and the kitchen and dining area too for light meals, which looks out on to my beautiful, peaceful garden, where you can relax if the weather allows.  Guests are given a couple of shelves in my fridge, your own food cupboard space, and you are free to use all kitchen facilities to cook light meals.  You can also hop on to my wi-fi. I am out at work 3 days a week, then work from home the rest of the time so I am av
neighborhood_overview: The house is in a great location, just 2 minutes walk away from the Royal Richmond Park, and 15 minutes walk from the River Thames, Kingston station and town centre.  Kingston is a busy market town with a wealth of shops, pubs, bars, cafes and restaurants that cater for all tastes.   It's a friendly and safe area.  Hampton Court Palace is a 10 minute drive or a 50 minute walk along the river too.  Richmond is also very close by (a 50 minute walk through the park or a 20 minute bus ride away).  I've been living here for nearly 5 years now and I still feel like I'm on holiday!
notes: For security reasons, I only accept reservations requests from guests who have included verifications in their Airbnb profiles. Check in times have to be arranged around my hours of work.  If you are arriving by public transport and if you have a mobile phone, you can call me and I can pick you up from Norbiton station or Kingston bus station which will save you a 10/15 minute walk with your luggage.    Please note that without a call from you I can not pick you up as parking and waiting time at Norbiton and Kingston is very limited.  I provide bed linen and towels. You can help yourself to tea, coffee and milk during your stay but please note I don't provide breakfast. Visitors parking permits for outside the house are å£3 a day, and for around the corner å£1.50 a day.  There is free parking about a 2 minute walk away but spaces are not always available. Optional å£10 for cleaning of bedroom if staying for more than one week. Both your bedroom and living room do face on to a road, so the
transit: Public transport links are very good for local travel and also for getting in to central London:  Norbiton station is also only a 12 minute walk away from the house with trains running about every 15 minutes for a 25 minute ride in to central  London Waterloo, and 15 minutes from Wimbledon if you're here for the tennis.
access: Guests share the bathroom with just me (and I never hog it!), a second loo, and the kitchen and dining area too for light meals, which looks out on to my beautiful, peaceful garden, where you can relax if the weather allows.  Guests are given a couple of shelves in my fridge, your own food cupboard space, and you are free to use all kitchen facilities to cook light meals.  You can also hop on to my wi-fi.
interaction: I am out at work 3 days a week, then work from home the rest of the time so I am available to answer guest's questions most of the time.  I love meeting people from all over the world through Airbnb and am happy to chat in the kitchen and dining area, but I do respect guest's privacy too.
house_rules: No guests No pets No smoking Please tidy up after yourself in the kitchen and bathroom Please eat your meals in the dining area and not in your bedroom or lounge. If you're back after me at night, please make sure all lights are turned off.

neighborhood_overview: Kingston upon Thames is a vibrant Surrey market town at the heart one of LondonÛªs liveliest boroughs. The town is in a beautiful location as it nestles on the banks of the River Thames and, as itÛªs just 12 miles south west of central London, itÛªs the ideal place to escape to from the City. Kingston boasts everything you would expect from a thriving market town including superb shopping, a vibrant cafÌ© culture, a well respected university and a great nightlife. Events in Kingston include a packed schedule of art, music, theatre and family events throughout the year, so whenever you visit Kingston youÛªll find plenty to do. KingstonÛªs history dates back to 838 when the town was first recorded in a royal document, and by the tenth century the town made its mark on history when it became a coronation place for Anglo Saxon kings. Kingston Town Centre retains much of its historic past including beautiful Tudor buildings, the Ancient Market and All Saints Church. Today, an exciting mix of them

summary: Our newly renovated 1300sqft home is a 7 min walk (0.3 mi) to Surbiton town centre & Surbiton Rail Station (20min to Waterloo Tube & Rail + famous South Bank, 10-12 trains/hr). Beautiful rooms, sunny spaces, gorgeous garden & luxurious amenities in a family ready home.  Our home is spacious, airy & convenient! Perfect for couples, groups, families. 10 min by train to Wimbledon. Fast, frequent buses to Kingston. Available 8 Jul-25 Aug. Note: Prices are auto-set by Airbnb. Discounts for 1 week+.
space: This is a newly renovated 3-4 bedroom family home. We redesigned it with the help of an architect, and the result is an oasis of 1300 sqft within 20 minutes of central London. It features an open-concept kitchen-dining-reception area, a chef's kitchen, patio with awning, massive garden with climbing frame, 3-4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and hardwood floors. And for a good night's sleep: a bespoke bed, Egyptian cotton sheets, and all manner of pillows and comforters. Bedroom 1: The bed will comfortably accommodate tall people. In North America, it is Queen size, in the UK, it is King size. Bedroom 2: There is a bunk bed. The top bunk can accommodate a small adult. Anyone can sleep on the bottom which has a very comfortable foam mattress. Bedroom 3: This is currently being used as an office, but we have a single mattress which can be placed on the floor if required. Bedroom 4/Storage room: I've advertised this is as a 3BR home, but we actually have 4 bedrooms. We are using the 4th bedroom as

This is a newly renovated 3-4 bedroom family home. We redesigned it with the help of an architect, and the result is an oasis of 1300 sqft within 20 minutes of central London. It features an open-concept kitchen-dining-reception area, a chef's kitchen, patio with awning, massive garden with climbing frame, 3-4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and hardwood floors. And for a good night's sleep: a bespoke bed, Egyptian cotton sheets, and all manner of pillows and comforters. Bedroom 1: The bed will comfortabl
neighborhood_overview: I have so much to say about Surbiton, which I *love*. It is a mixed, middle-class neighbourhood- some people have lived here forever and others are new families who have immigrated to London from around the world. It has a pretty good university (Kingston University), a beautiful riverside, a thriving community spirit, excellent schools, and an all-important fast connection to Waterloo station. In practice, this means that it's full of professional couples and young families who work in Central London, and want a quick commute + some green space. For you, this means easy access to the West End and a lot more space to move around. Conveniences: Waitrose (posh supermarket), Marks & Spencers Simply Food, Sainsbury's (3 locations within 10 minute walk), Jenning's Butchers (excellent meat!), Surbiton Farmer's Market, Robert's dry cleaners, 4 Banks, Regency Bookshop, Post office. Favourite places to eat: The Press Room (indie coffee shop), Basilico Pizzeria, Thai Secret, Pisces Fish & Chips,
transit: - 7 min walk (0.3 mi) to Surbiton town centre & Surbiton Rail Station (20min to Waterloo Tube & Rail + famous South Bank, 10-12 trains/hr). - Bus stop is around the corner on Ewell Rd. VERY frequent buses to Kingston. (5-8 min ride, every 2-4 min).
access: We own the entire house, however, we are only renting out the ground floor flat. Our tenant, who lives upstairs, has a private entrance on the left side of the house. She is very quiet and it is important to us that all guests are respectful about noise.
interaction: I'm happy to tell you everything you need to know about our house, about Surbiton/Kingston, and about London. We will be available by email and by phone throughout your stay. Our friends or neighbours will check you in and answer any questions you have.
house_rules: No drugs. No shoes in the house.
host_about: I am a faculty member at King's College London. My husband is a computer programmer. We are Canadians who have lived in the UK for over a decade, and London is now home. We can help you navigate the city, and we know all the best places to eat and hang out around Kingston, Surbiton, and Hampton Court. We can set you up for a great time whether you're here as a tourist, or staying for a longer stretch and want to live more like a local.

host_about: My name is Patricia, I live in Kingston-upon-Thames with my husband and 2 teenage boys. Our home is typically quaint and Victorian, with 5 bedrooms. I have lived in this area for many years - I trained as a registered nurse at Kingston hospital, then worked with British Airways travelling the world until I my first son was 2 years old. My passion has always been health and wellbeing. I now run a naturopathic health business from home, and sometimes travel with my training work. I have recently started a Raw Juice delivery service, so can offer my guests a fresh juice with breakfast during their stay.

name: London's Best 5 Bedroom Family Home
summary: Our 5 bedroom SW London home is just minutes from the River Thames, Richmond Park, Kingston, Heathrow & 1 hour from downtown.  The study, kitchen, dining, living & music rooms are rustic & sunny.  There are 3 1/2 baths, a giant garden, & a driveway.
space: We have 5 bedrooms. Three are en suite.  The master bedroom on the 1st floor has a king size bed, a walk in closet and a bathroom with a shower.  The bedroom in the loft has a full size bed and its own bathroom with a shower and separate tub. It's a sort of guest apartment minus a kitchen. Very nice. The loft also has a view of Richmond Park and Pembroke Lodge - for those of you who might be getting married there!  The other three bedrooms share one shower/tub bathroom. They are kids' rooms but work very well for adults as well. One of the bedrooms has a full size bed. The second and third bedrooms both have decent sized bunk beds.
description: Our 5 bedroom SW London home is just minutes from the River Thames, Richmond Park, Kingston, Heathrow & 1 hour from downtown.  The study, kitchen, dining, living & music rooms are rustic & sunny.  There are 3 1/2 baths, a giant garden, & a driveway. We have 5 bedrooms. Three are en suite.  The master bedroom on the 1st floor has a king size bed, a walk in closet and a bathroom with a shower.  The bedroom in the loft has a full size bed and its own bathroom with a shower and separate tub. It's a sort of guest apartment minus a kitchen. Very nice. The loft also has a view of Richmond Park and Pembroke Lodge - for those of you who might be getting married there!  The other three bedrooms share one shower/tub bathroom. They are kids' rooms but work very well for adults as well. One of the bedrooms has a full size bed. The second and third bedrooms both have decent sized bunk beds. Did we mention we've got Spotify, Sonos and three different listening zones? You'll have the place to yourself
neighborhood_overview: Kingston is a quiet residential neighbourhood on the Thames riverside.  The river's great for walking and there's a couple great pubs right along it within a couple minutes.  We like the Boaters in Canbury Gardens - it's about a ten minute walk - and the Anglers at Teddington Lock - which is about a 15 minute walks.   Richmond Park - about a 20 minute walk away - is London's largest and is home to the Queen's deer.  There are many good places to run - including the loop around the two bridges - out our front park but there is no better place for the runner, biker or nature lover than Richmond Park.  This is the place to stay if you're doing something at Pembroke Lodge.  We've hosted more than a couple wedding parties passing through Pembroke.  Oh and if you like you're shopping, Kingston & Richmond themselves have PLENTY of it.  The very closest place to eat is (URL HIDDEN) and it's just a 5 minute walk away.  There are also a number of good places to eat on Ham Parade, which is also a
notes: We like history.  You'll see plenty of it in our home.
transit: The bus on Richmond Road is the 65.  It goes to Kingston & Richmond.  Commuter trains into London go from Kingston & Richmond.  The tube/subway also runs from Richmond.  We're a 35 minute drive from Heathrow, 50 minutes from Gatwick.  Plan on leaving yourself an hour to/from our house into central London.  Uber now covers our neighbourhood pretty well as do of course all the mini-cab companies.  We also have a two-bay drive way you can use if you fancy renting a car or using your own.
access: Did we mention we've got Spotify, Sonos and three different listening zones?
interaction: You'll have the place to yourself; we won't be around other than to answer any questions you might have.
house_rules: No pets.  No eating or drinking outside the kitchen and dining area. No shoes on the carpets. No smoking inside (front and back garden fine).  Please be considerate of neighbours, we like to keep them happy :)  No loud noise after 11pm or before 7am  No extra guests without prior written consent Guests are responsible for damage, breakages etc  No-one under 21 unless accompanied by a parent or guardian

name: Cosy Room in a Happy Home
summary: This room is cosy and full of light. It's located on a peaceful road in a thriving, diverse community.
description: This room is cosy and full of light. It's located on a peaceful road in a thriving, diverse community. My guest can access the kitchen, the garden, the garage if they needed I will do my best to help in every aspects. New Malden is a thriving, diverse community. There are many places to eat and drink, including Korean, Italian and Japanese restaurants, as well as a few charming local pubs. We have many discount shops and supermarkets, as well as charity shops and a farmers' market once a month. As well as all of this, it is only a bus-ride away from many well-known areas like Kingston-Upon-Thames, Sutton and Wimbledon. Kingston has a wide range of attractions including riverside restaurants, shopping centres, a museum, a library, art shops, pop-up shops, vintage clothes shops and beautiful scenery. It is only three bus stops away from Hampton Court Palace, the distinguished home of Henry VIII, perfect for a day out! Sutton is a very green area, with beautiful trees waving you towards a
neighborhood_overview: New Malden is a thriving, diverse community. There are many places to eat and drink, including Korean, Italian and Japanese restaurants, as well as a few charming local pubs. We have many discount shops and supermarkets, as well as charity shops and a farmers' market once a month. As well as all of this, it is only a bus-ride away from many well-known areas like Kingston-Upon-Thames, Sutton and Wimbledon. Kingston has a wide range of attractions including riverside restaurants, shopping centres, a museum, a library, art shops, pop-up shops, vintage clothes shops and beautiful scenery. It is only three bus stops away from Hampton Court Palace, the distinguished home of Henry VIII, perfect for a day out! Sutton is a very green area, with beautiful trees waving you towards a weekly market. Wimbledon is simply amazing, a seamless blend of modern shops and interesting events and places. These include a tranquil Buddhist temple, a historical windmill adjacent to a park and many traditional b
transit: There is a train station in Motspur Park that leads to Waterloo Station, and another in New Malden. There are also many buses that can take you to Kingston, Sutton, Wimbledon, Tolworth, Epsom, Surbiton and other places. Although the house is on a quiet road, it isn't too far away from the motorway, which can take you straight to London.
access: My guest can access the kitchen, the garden, the garage if they needed
interaction: I will do my best to help in every aspects.
house_rules: Please be tidy and considerate. Respect the household and ask permission before bringing visitors in.
host_about: I'm a very positive person, every day is a new day for me. I can't live without a work-out at the gym, cooking, laughing, traveling and, of course, eating chocolate!My favourite books are 'Creative Visualisation', 'The Power of your Subconscious' and 'The Secret'.My favourite destinations are Thailand and Ko Samui Island.

interaction: The Hosts: Claire & Alan are 2 semi retired quiet professionals, We love gardening, travelling, scuba diving, skiing. We share the house with 2 lazy cats Sambal & Chiko. summary: Convenient, comfortable apartment with friendly young housemates. Only 20 minutes to Central London with good transport links to Wimbledon, Kingston and surrounding areas. It's quiet after 10:30pm, so hopefully you'll get a good night's sleep.
space: The room is a large double and offers clean and comfortable accommodation for one or two people in a standard double bed with an orthopaedic mattress.  There are a number of things for your convenience, including: - fresh cotton linen - clean towels - fast wi fi - an extra set of linen (if you are staying for 4 days or more) There is a little noise from nearby trains during the day. It's quiet after 11pm. Guest 'welcome' is usually after 6pm. Check out is before 10am. There's a shared bathroom, a shared kitchen and spacious studio living room.  Off street parking may be possible for one vehicle - please ask in advance before booking. The flat is not suitable for wheelchairs due to restricted access (steps).  If you are renting the large double ro
neighborhood_overview: - Central London in 20 mins - easy access to local shops and restaurants - Wimbledon village and Centre Court 10 mins away by car - easy access to Richmond Park - great local pub (The Glasshouse) - nearby Nepalese restaurant (The Royal Gurkha)   New Malden is one of the biggest Korean communities outside of South Korea, so you'll find lots of authentic Korean restaurants and deli stores.  My favourite thing about the neighbourhood: you are less than 10 min drive to the natural beauty (and wild deer) in Richmond Park.
notes: I want you to have a great stay. If you have any special needs or questions please ask before you book and I'll see what we can do.
transit: The apartment is only a few minutes walk to New Malden, with fast transport to Central London. There are also local buses and trains to Wimbledon, Kingston, Richmond, Sutton etc.  For help planning travel around London check out Transport for London website using New Malden or New Malden station as the start / end point. It may be worth getting a one day or one week travel card if you are doing much traveling. You can get these from the local train station.  Parker Cars is a local mini cab service offering a good value airport pick up and drop off service.
access: There's a shared bathroom, a shared kitchen and spacious studio living room.  Off street parking may be possible for one vehicle - please ask in advance before booking. The flat is not suitable for wheelchairs due to restricted access (steps).
interaction: If you are renting the large double room this means I'll be away for all or part of your stay. I have three other housemates who share the house:  If I'm not here to greet you, one of my housemates will meet you in the evening, show you the room, give you your key and answer any questions.
house_rules: If you have any special requirements, please ask before booking. I want you to have a great stay and will do my best to accommodate. The room is bookable for one or two people. Guests 18+ unless agreed beforehand. Check-in typically after 6pm, unless agreed beforehand. The room is daily offered from 6pm-10am. If you wish to have access during the day, please let me know beforehand. Please leave the kitchen, living room and bathroom clean and tidy after use. In return you can expect to find these areas clean and tidy when you want to use them. Please open the windows in the open plan living room / kitchen if you are cooking. Please close all windows and double lock the door when you leave the apartment. Please keep noise to a minimum after 10:30pm to enable others to get a good night's sleep. An off street parking permit may be available if you request before booking. Additional visitor permit (2 hours). There is clamping of vehicles not displaying a valid permit.  Lost keys charged at
host_about: Thanks for considering staying at my place and checking out my profile.Following are a few things about myself: I've travelled widely - Asia, North America and Latin America . I'm reasonably well educated (no claims to intelligence). Always enjoy meeting interesting people. Love remote Greek islands, high mountains and wild remote places. Occasional meditator. Infrequent teacher of interesting things. Helpful and collaborative by nature. I appreciate the tranquility of the early morning. I write a bit. Ex-buddhist monk. I work for Apple. If you have any questions, please just ask.Ed

name: Large Room in Happy Home
summary: A large room, full of natural light from a large window, with a sofa and a coffee table. It's situated on a quiet road in the diverse community of New Malden. Not far from Central London, and just a bus ride from Wimbledon, Sutton and Kingston.
description: A large room, full of natural light from a large window, with a sofa and a coffee table. It's situated on a quiet road in the diverse community of New Malden. Not far from Central London, and just a bus ride from Wimbledon, Sutton and Kingston. Their room, the kitchen, a shared bathroom, a downstairs toilet and a charming back garden. You're allowed to use the kitchen appliances (including your own space in the fridge). We will answer any questions you may have about the area. We also offer breakfast, and a wide variety of wholesome Mediterranean dishes (for an additional fee). New Malden is a thriving, diverse community. There are many places to eat and drink, including Korean, Italian and Japanese restaurants, as well as a few charming local pubs. We have many discount shops and supermarkets, as well as charity shops and a farmers' market once a month. As well as all of this, it is only a bus-ride away from many well-known areas like Kingston-Upon-Thames, Sutton and Wimbledon. Kingst
neighborhood_overview: New Malden is a thriving, diverse community. There are many places to eat and drink, including Korean, Italian and Japanese restaurants, as well as a few charming local pubs. We have many discount shops and supermarkets, as well as charity shops and a farmers' market once a month. As well as all of this, it is only a bus-ride away from many well-known areas like Kingston-Upon-Thames, Sutton and Wimbledon. Kingston has a wide range of attractions including riverside restaurants, shopping centres, a museum, a library, art shops, pop-up shops, vintage clothes shops and beautiful scenery. It is only three bus stops away from Hampton Court Palace, the distinguished home of Henry VIII, perfect for a day out! Sutton is a very green area, with beautiful trees waving you towards a weekly market. Wimbledon is simply amazing, a seamless blend of modern shops and interesting events and places. These include a tranquil Buddhist temple, a historical windmill adjacent to a park and many traditional b
transit: There is a train station in Motspur Park that leads to Waterloo Station, and another in New Malden. There are also many buses that can take you to Kingston, Sutton, Wimbledon, Tolworth, Epsom, Surbiton and other places. Although the house is on a quiet road, it isn't too far away from the motorway, which can take you straight to London.
access: Their room, the kitchen, a shared bathroom, a downstairs toilet and a charming back garden. You're allowed to use the kitchen appliances (including your own space in the fridge).
interaction: We will answer any questions you may have about the area. We also offer breakfast, and a wide variety of wholesome Mediterranean dishes (for an additional fee).
house_rules: Non-smokers, please? Please be tidy and respect my house, and ask me before inviting people to stay with you.
host_about: I'm a very positive person, every day is a new day for me. I can't live without a work-out at the gym, cooking, laughing, traveling and, of course, eating chocolate!My favourite books are 'Creative Visualisation', 'The Power of your Subconscious' and 'The Secret'.My favourite destinations are Thailand and Ko Samui Island.

name: Double room in newly refurbed flat
summary: Set in a magnificent Tudor building this delightful fully refurbished two bedroom flat has a stunning kitchen/dining/bed room overlooking the Church where the 7 Saxon Kings of England were crowned, 2 mins walk from the Thames and central market sq.
space: Set in a magnificent Tudor building this delightful fully refurbished two bedroom flat (photos of interior to follow) on Thames Street has a stunning kitchen/dining room overlooking the Church where the Seven Saxon Kings of England were crowned. Turn left out of the house and enjoy the medieval market square, which has retained the magic of its historic origins with exciting daily food and craft stalls. Situated in the heart of Kingston's old quarter and heritage protected area you will be able to enjoy Kingston's myriad of historic tourist attractions first-hand and the characters of the area, including the fish seller, whose family has been selling cod and salmon here since the 18th century and the merry-go-round family, whose descendants were the great circus performers born in Fairfield, which turns out to be the reason for its name.   Only a few minutes walk from the River Thames are some of the areas most celebrated restaurants and you can also pick up a riverboat ride to Hampton

The famous old market square, the river, the Bentall's centre and John Lewis are all a couple of minutes walk away.
transit: The central bus and train stations are close to each other and only 6 minutes walk away from the flat. You can also get the wonderful ferry from Turk's Pier, 5 mins walk away, to Hampton Court upriver or downriver to Richmond. There is paid parking about 5 minutes walk away by the river on Thames Side road.

name: Magnificent Georgian-style Mansion
summary: Situated 25 mins away from London Bridge, within walking distance of the station, the luxurious and highly private villa offers the best of country and city life. The sumptuous interior extends to 8877sqft, and big gardens  secluded with mature trees.
space: Ideal for small conferences and board meetings up to 16 people, family/friends get together, celebrities or whomever require high level of privacy. Writers and artists are particularly welcome for a period living at a significant discount. Bespoke services available include laundry and cleaning, chauffeur (complimentary service for the station to London), English afternoon tea, fixed menu lunch or dinner subject to an additional cost. Complimentary continental breakfast, Wifi and Cable TV are available. Complimentary parking for up to 7 cars in the gated front garden.

neighborhood_overview: The property is situated on the prestigious Webb Estate which consists of approximately 260 acres which is now a designated conservation area.  The Estate was originally laid out by William Webb whose dream was to create an environment which would offer the best of English country and London city life.  Each road is unique and makes a special contribute to the Estate.
notes: The premise is alarmed and protected by CCTV,  which  covers all outdoor area around the property and indoors reception area for safety reasons. Kitchen is mainly for breakfast and catering service at an additional charge.
transit: The property is within walking distance of Purley town centre and railway station with excellent commuter train services to Victoria, London Bridge(20mins), Gatwick (or20mins drive) and the south coast.  There is a wide choice of leisure, entertainment and shopping facilities, including golf courses, tennis clubs and gyms. The M25/23 motorway network can be accessed at Hooley providing motorway links to Gatwick, Heathrow and the south coast.
access: Guests can access the lounge, tea room, formal dining/conference room, kitchen and breakfast, study, scenery sun room, indoors swimming pool and gardens including BBQ hut and children's play ground, subject to terms and conditions.
interaction: We are available to provide local informations and help with bookings such as West End theatres and local restaurants, English social events, and guided tours across  the UK if needed, which may occur an additional charge.
house_rules: Strictly no smoking, no pets. It is guest's responsibility to make sure to use the pool safely. Children must be under adult's supervision in the pool complex. Guest must keep the noise to minimum when the villa is not in sole usage.
host_about: I used to work in media and accademia for long time, and now focus on UK property investment while continue to write books and get involved in documentary production. My hobbies are swimming, ski, tennis and literature as well as film.

space: Hi there. I've got a very large double/twin room available in a clean and tidy home. Public transport is very convenient. Only 25 minutes to Victoria or London Bridge by tram and train. The tram stop is 100 yards away. I am in zone 5. My house is also only 19 minutes from Wimbledon by tram. If you are a night owl, trains run from Victoria to Croydon all night. The room is bright and comfortable, with plenty of wardrobe space. It contains a large double bed, and I can put in another single bed if you choose.There is plenty of room in my kitchen if you would like to cook your own meals, and there is a large Sainsbury's supermarket one tram stop away. I can also point out some great restaurants in Croydon, Wimbledon or London. There is free wifi, clean towels and bed linen. From Heathrow I advise catching the X26 bus straight to Croydon. Guests will be sharing house with us - married couple in their 50 s. We are here. If you need help with anything during your s
neighborhood_overview: We have been living in the area since 2000 and have been hosting for a while, mainly to young students who come from abroad for their study in UK. The area is very nice and quiet residential area with local amenities, Sainsbury's, Mark & Spencer, fast food, restaurants and few parks.
transit: There is a bus stop located just 3 minutes walk from our house and it takes roughly 10-15 minutes to get to Croydon town centre as well as the main train station, East Croydon. From the main train station, you can catch the train to London Victoria which will take about 15 minutes ( 2 stops ) to arrive there. Trains come regularly every 3-4 mins. during rush hours and every 5-10 mins at other times. There are 3 buses from East Croydon that come to our house which are the 119,198 and 194. There are also; - West Wickham station which is a 15 minutes walk from the house, with trains going to London Bridge or Charing Cross. - West Croydon overground station and bus no 198 that comes to our house.
access: wifi - garden Included in the price is tea/coffee and toast/cereal each morning.  Guests are welcome to use our garden, dining and living room area. We don't allow cooking in our house but guests are welcome to use microwave and feel free to help yourself with tea/ coffee any time.
interaction: Guests will be sharing house with us - married couple in their 50 s. We are here. If you need help with anything during your stay, we will help whenever we can.
house_rules: :We don't allow smoking and pets in our house. :No alcohol or food consumed in the bedroom. :Strictly no shoes in the house. :Only guests allowed in the house. :We also prefer guests to not get in after 12am.
host_about: We have been hosting for some time, usually to young foreign students, and like to share experience with guests.We originally came from Thailand and have been living in UK for 30 years. We also like to travel in our spare time.

name: Spacious double room free wireless
space: I have a 3 bedroom semi detached house is Selsdon, South Croydon, and there is a double room available for you to rent! (I also have one other double room available, so if ou need more space please check out my other listing!) The house is in a quiet and lovely area, and the massive 100 foot garden backs on to Littleheath Woods. You room is a spacious double with a comfortable bed, wardrobe and a desk. During you stay you will have access to the fully equipped, fully fitted kitchen, with washing machine and tumble dryer. The house has wireless internet throughout and a recently installed sky box and TV. If you are bringing your car you can make use of our ample parking space; there is room for 3 or 4 cars on the driveway! Within walking distance of the house you will find all the amenities you will need for a great stay; there are supermarkets, cafes takeaways and restaurants just 2 minutes away. Croydon is also packed with shops, bars and clubs ...there is always something to see and

host_about: Hi, I am Sylvie and I am originally from France but have been living in Uk for over 20 years. I love travelling and eating different cuisine but also meeting and connecting with people. I am very approachable and would be happy to discuss or suggest things you could do if visiting the area or London,  but equally, I am happy to live you in your space, not talk and let you relax if this is what you are looking for. No offence will be taken. I love living here because in 5 minutes walking distance, I have the choice of eating different cuisine from Italy, Mauritius, France, English to name a few  but can also go for walks in parks near. Another passion of mine is taking photos and I am currently looking at combining all my photos from various trips and make it a project story. Here's a quote I like "ÛÏStress is caused by being Û÷hereÛª but wanting to be Û÷there.Ûª Eckhart Tolle

name: Lake view, 2 bed, Crystal Palace
summary: Exclusive use of a beautiful, modern 2 bed 2 bthm flat. The living space is cosy with great views, overlooking a boating lake, tennis & basketball courts and cricket field. 10 minute walk away from Crystal Palace station, restaurants and amenities.
space: The best view of the lake is in the autumn & winter, the sun rises above the lake so breakfast on the balcony is recommended for early birds. Great living room with comfy sofas and cosy heating. Tv and Netflix and a sound soundsystem for rainy days, open plan kitchen. A selection of restaurants, cocktail bars, cafes only 10 mins away. There is a private decking area and garden, the rest of the garden is shared. A private off street parking space can be provided. Communal gate which accesses the park, lake and cafes.

neighborhood_overview: Crystal palace is an outstanding area with markets, antique shops and boutiques. There is an excellent choice of restaurants and lonightlife . South Norwood park has boaters on the lake wednesdays & saturdays, and cricket sundays. There are many walks around the area and Crystal Palace park is home to the dinosaur statues.
transit: There is a bus stop right outside the house which goes to Crystal Palace & South Norwood. Crystal Palace train station is a pretty 10/15 minute walk along Auckland road. Norwood Junction train station a 10 minute walk and 14 minutes to London Bridge. Both with excellent links to major stations and the overground directly linking you to East London. If you drive, there is a free parking space in the driveway.
access: This listing is for exclusive use of the whole apartment.  I will be local if you need anything. If you would like to only rent one room, this is an option, please get in touch
interaction: I will be staying nearby and am happy to chat or leave you in peace. I can assist with any recommendations or requests, or leave guests to enjoy themselves. There is local information available, I have lived in Crystal Palace for years and can recommend some great spots nearby.
house_rules: Just to be respectful of the house, neat and tidy. All damages will be payable by you. Please respect the neighbours. Tennis and basketball courts are free and there is a childrens playground further through the park. The lake is popular with runners and the area provides many walks.
host_about: Hi there. I have lived in crystal palace for years and can show you all the great spots, and recommend great places to eat nearby. I will be ether staying locally or sharing the communal space with you, depending on if you chose to rent one room or the whole apartment. Im happy to welcome guests and show you around the house. Please don't hesitate to ask if you need anything at all!

name: Stylish House near Crystal Palace
summary: Only 14 minutes by train to London Bridge, my beautiful newly refurbished house is set in on a quiet street and features open plan living areas downstairs, two very comfortable double bedrooms and spacious garden. Perfect for a London getaway!
space: This house is my home and I love it. I lovingly refurbished it last year and as I travel for work a lot I rent it out on Airbnb.  It's a traditional Victorian London layout with the open plan living, dining room and kitchen on the ground floor and bathroom and bedrooms upstairs. The two bedrooms are of equal size and are both furnished with very comfortable beds. One is a King size and the other is a double. neighborhood_overview: Crystal Place is a great location: the vibrant central area has a village atmosphere with artisan delis, independent cafes and shops, restaurants and leisure facilities.  There are lots of beautiful spots for walks, including the lovely Crystal Palace park as well as South Norwood Lake (one of our favourites) and Westow park.
notes: We're a 17 minute walk (or a short bus ride) from either Crystal Palace station or Gipsy Hill station, with frequent trains to London Victoria and London Bridge stations and overground trains to East London.  There is also a bus terminus nearby serving different parts of London.
transit: We're a 17 minute walk (or a short bus ride) from either Crystal Palace station or Gipsy Hill station, with frequent trains to London Victoria and London Bridge stations and overground trains to central London.  There is also a bus terminus nearby serving different parts of London.   From Gatwick airport, trains run frequently to East Croydon where you can get a bus to Upper Beulah Hill (ask for details), a few mins walk from us.
access: You'll have full access to our large open plan communal area - a combined kitchen, dining room and living room. The kitchen is well-equipped with kettle/toaster/nespresso coffee maker/ dishwasher/ 9-hob cooker and oven and grill (we have most things except a microwave!), and you can also use our washer/ dryer and iron.  We have a TV with bbc iplayer, netflix etc.  The garden and patio are open to guests and make a great place for an afternoon cup of tea or glass of wine on sunny summers days.  If you need a quiet place to work please check with us before you book as you can most likely use our study.
interaction: We are a bilingual family (Swedish/English) with a young son.  We are chatty  and easy-going, and love to be helpful so please do let us know if you have questions or want tips.  Tom runs a yoga studio in the local area so he is often home during parts of the day.
house_rules: Please leave outdoor shoes at the front door (we're scandi in that way!) No other guests than yourself unless agreed beforehand. Smoking only allowed outside. Sorry no pets.
host_about: I'm swedish by background but have lived in London since 2003, and i love this city!  East London in particular, with lots of parks, cafes, markets, music venues and alternative stuff popping up all the time.  I love yoga so i can recommend yoga places around town, as well as dancing, eating yummy (and ideally healthy) food, exploring galleries, going to plays and shows and hanging out with friends.  I'm very easy going, have travelled and lived in lots of countries, and get on with most people.  I love my flat, and really enjoy hosting people and letting people use the space as their own home away from home.

neighborhood_overview: Local Attractions The local town centre - Croydon is London's second largest shopping and cultural centre after the West End. Croydon is 5 minutes away by car or by bus or 15 minutes' walk.  The Whitgift and the newly opened Centrale shopping centres house a variety of department stores. Croydon town centre boasts of plenty of restaurants and bars and exciting nightlife. The Fairfield Halls (consisting of a concert hall, the Ashcroft Theatre and Arnhem Gallery) is the home of the London Mozart Players and has hosted a number of many famous faces. Fairfield Halls presents a variety of entertainment ranging from professional plays, musical recitals, orchestral concerts, pop concerts, comedy and professional wrestling.  The halls also offer conference, meeting, wedding and party spaces for hire. The newly built Vue Grants Cinema in Croydon High Street, has 10 screens with state-of-the-art Digital Dolby Surround Sound in every screen showing all the latest releases.  Valley Park Retail & L

East Croydon train station offers a 15-minute service to Central London and London Gatwick Airport. The station is 9 minutes' drive, 15 minutes by bus and 20 minutes' walk.   West Croydon, Selhurst, Thornton Heath and Waddon Train Stations are also within close proximity. Croydon Tramlink runs between Beckenham and Wimbledon through Croydon. The tram stop is an 8-minute walk away. Local buses offer vast connections to destinations across London and surrounding counties. The bus stop is a 2-minute walk away.

space: This large flat is in a converted telephone exchange, and retains that character - with very high ceilings. Both the bedroom and the kitchen / living room are very large. It is down a quiet street (and the flat is heavy sound insulated), and is right in the heart of Croydon (entrance is in Matthews Yard and v near Surrey St Market). The flat is completed to excellent spec and is modern in style and occupies a foot print of 65 metres squared ( 750 sq ft). The doors in particular are so high they look like they were designed for a giant to live there (this is what I told my daughter!).

notes: This listing is brand new, I have literally just purchased the apartment. access: You would be able to rent the whole space at weekends or UK school holidays, on weekdays part of the space is available (I am going to list this separately).

name: Fun self-contained garden studio
summary: Private guest cabin with double bed, kitchenette with fridge & microwave & en-suite shower room.  In large garden with use of swimming pool in summer months. Tranquil location but close to shops, cafes & good transport to central London.
space: Fantastic place for people wanting something a bit different on their trip to London.  A small but well-equipped studio room, bright and pretty with lots of natural light, plenty of privacy and all the amenities you need for one or two people.  The kitchenette has a fridge with freezer compartment, a microwave, toaster, kettle, crockery, cutlery and utensils.  The en-suite has a WC, basin and shower.  As well as a table in the room, there is a little raised patio directly outside with small table and chairs.  We are fortunate to have a large garden overlooking the beautiful green space of Streatham Common and the studio sits adjacent to but separate from the main house.  Guests have their own key and can come and go as they like.  We supply tea and coffee-making supplies, fresh bedding and towels and there is free wifi access.  From mid-May to mid-Sept we have a heated outdoor swimming pool which our guests are welcome to enjoy.  It's unusual to find a property like this so close to ce
description: Private guest cabin with double bed, kitchenette with fridge & microwave & en-suite shower room.  In large garden with use of swimming pool in summer months. Tranquil location but close to shops, cafes & good transport to central London. Fantastic place for people wanting something a bit different on their trip to London.  A small but well-equipped studio room, bright and pretty with lots of natural light, plenty of privacy and all the amenities you need for one or two people.  The kitchenette has a fridge with freezer compartment, a microwave, toaster, kettle, crockery, cutlery and utensils.  The en-suite has a WC, basin and shower.  As well as a table in the room, there is a little raised patio directly outside with small table and chairs.  We are fortunate to have a large garden overlooking the beautiful green space of Streatham Common and the studio sits adjacent to but separate from the main house.  Guests have their own key and can come and go as they like.  We supply tea and cof
neighborhood_overview: We live very close to Streatham Common with its beautiful woodland and open spaces.  The formal Edwardian garden, The Rookery, is one of London's hidden gems and a great place to explore. The centre of Streatham is also close by with great shops, restaurants and pubs, plus a fantastic jazz bar, and all the amenities you might need, from supermarkets to banks to an excellent library.  Slightly further afield is Crystal Palace with its historic park and great selection of antique shops, art galleries and hip, new bars and eateries.
notes: For security, the studio door has a good lock, and we also have a lockable cabinet in the room if you wish to bring a padlock with you for your valuables.   The swimming pool is only in use from May to Sept and guests may use it entirely at their own risk.  We are happy to help in any way with planning your stay - we have lived in various areas of London for many years and know it well!
transit: Two useful buses go from the end of our road and can take you to a variety of stations from where there are frequent trains to Victoria, London Bridge, Blackfriars and St. Pancras.  There is also public transport to Brixton for the fast tube service up the Victoria Line, or to Tooting for the Northern Line.   A number of excellent local taxi firms also operate near us if you wish to use them. You can reach us on public transport from all the London airports - Gatwick is particularly easy.  Depending on what time you arrive, we may be able to collect you from one of the local stations if you have bags with you. If you are driving, you can park your car in our drive at no extra cost and avoid the difficulty and expense of parking in many areas of London.
access: Aside from the studio itself, guests are very welcome to join us in the main house (a mid-Century detached house that we are in the process of renovating) for a coffee and a chat, or to get information about good places to visit.  Our washing machine and other kitchen facilities are also available.  Guests can enjoy our terrace, garden and swimming pool during the summer months.
interaction: We are happy to get to know our guests and very much enjoy meeting them and hearing about their plans for their trips.  If they prefer to be entirely private, then that is fine too!
house_rules: The studio, house and garden are strictly no smoking as we have young children.  Otherwise, all we ask is that our guests respect our home and property, and if they wish to use the pool that they must follow instructions regarding safety, using the cover and so on.
host_about: We are a happy, busy family with three children (age 15, 13 and 10) who enjoy welcoming visitors to our large house in SW London.  I work part-time for a literary agency, and my husband works in retail management.  We are fans of theatre, film, restaurants, art galleries, architecture and museums - everything that London is famous for - and can help our guests plan their stay in this wonderful city with tips on places to go, ideas that might not be in any guide book, and best ways to get around town.  My husband is a keen cyclist, so bike enthusiasts are particularly welcome and we have space to safely store your bicycle.We love to travel and visit other cities - our style is to make a plan and then to wander off from the plan and discover as we go along!  Our hosting style is similar - we are relaxed and have lots going on in our family but will always have time to chat and help guests plan their visit and discover some fun thing to do that they might not have thought of. If you have any questions about us or about what we can do to help your visit to London run smoothly, please get in touch any time.

neighborhood_overview: *Green Croydon -The Royal Horticultural Society voted Coombe Wood London's best park in 2009. -In the same year, Croydon was also voted the Royal Horticultural Society's 'Greenest large city' in the UK. *Music -Croydon has been at the centre of the development of the dubstep genre, a relatively recent musical development that traces its roots from Jamaican dub music, UK Garage and drum and bass. Artists such as Benga and Skream, who honed their production and DJing skills whilst working at the now defunct Big Apple Records on Surrey Street, along with Norwood's Digital Mystikz, DJ Chef, Timi Korus and Thornton Heath's Plastician, form the core roster of dubstep DJs and producers. Moreover, UK rappers and grime artists Stormzy, Krept and Konan and Section Boyz all hail from or can trace their roots to the London Borough of Croydon. -The town centre was for 30 years home to Europe's largest second-hand record store, Beano's, offering rare vinyl, CDs and books. transit: 3 min. walk to East Croydon Station.  *Rail Fast trains to central London have journey times of 13 minutes to London Bridge and 15 minutes to London Victoria from East Croydon station, the largest and busiest station in Croydon and the tenth busiest in Greater London. Services from East Croydon run both north and south on the Brighton Main Line railway. To the south, trains run to the counties of Sussex, Surrey and Kent with services including through-train to Hastings, Southampton, Brighton, Portsmouth and Gatwick Airport. To the north, through-trains run to Central London stations including Victoria, London Bridge as well as Thameslink services to St Pancras International, Bedford, St Albans and Luton. West Croydon station is used by routes to the north and west. The East London Line operated by London Overground was extended to West Croydon in May 2010, establishing connections to Surrey Quays, Shoreditch, Dalston and Highbury & Islington. There are also several local rail stations

We live on a quiet, residential road, within easy reach of public transport links to central London and local amenities, including shops and restaurants. Double room with fitted wardrobe and drawers. On quiet cul-de-sac road so very peaceful Open-plan kitchen-diner, living room with wood burning stove and garden with decked area. South Norwood is still a mainly residential area but has some lovely places to have coffee or an evening meal. We are also very close to Crystal Palace (2km)  where there are lots of cafes, restaurants and bars to visit as well as a beautiful park with stunning views over London. name: XL Double. 15mins to City & LGW
summary: Stay in our large sunny double room overlooking a beautiful mature garden in a 3 bed terraced house with plenty of space. Enjoy a bright kitchen or dine al fresco (in summer!) Excellent transport nearby with easy access to London Bridge, Victoria & Gatwick!
space: It's a very comfy real double bed with fresh, crisp linen in a large double room of a 3 bed town house located just a 7 min walk from East Croydon station. It has a wardrobe and dressing table/desk with chair and plenty of power sockets. Room is supplied with bed linen, towels and hairdryer. We can offer you tea, coffee and a light self-serve breakfast. Laundry facilities are available for a small charge of å£4 per load.
description: Stay in our large sunny double room overlooking a beautiful mature garden in a 3 bed terraced house with plenty of space. Enjoy a bright kitchen or dine al fresco (in summer!) Excellent transport nearby with easy access to London Bridge, Victoria & Gatwick! It's a very comfy real double bed with fresh, crisp linen in a large double room of a 3 bed town house located just a 7 min walk from East Croydon station. It has a wardrobe and dressing table/desk with chair and plenty of power sockets. Room is supplied with bed linen, towels and hairdryer. We can offer you tea, coffee and a light self-serve breakfast. Laundry facilities are available for a small charge of å£4 per load. You will have free WiFi. The kitchen and dining area is available to use at your leisure, including use of tea, coffee and condiments for cooking as well as kitchen appliances and utensils. The bathroom has a double shower with free use of shampoo and shower gel. The living room has a TV with freeview, stereo & DVD p
neighborhood_overview: The local area offers everything you need; shops, pubs and parks. We are conveniently sandwiched between the lovely Addiscombe which hosts trendyp cafÌ©s, restaurants, (highly recommend 'Thanhs' BYO Vietnamese :)) and the busy shopping district of East Croydon.  A five minute trip on the 410 bus to South Norwood will bring you to where Sir Arthur Conan Doyle (creator of Sherlock Holmes) used to live and William Stanley (inventor, manufacturer and founder of the UK's first technical college) made his home. Parkland: South Norwood Country Park which covers 125 acres (50.59 hectares) of wild flower meadows, pitch and putt, playground, picnic tables and a visitors centre.
notes: We can offer you tea, coffee and a light self-serve breakfast. In addition there is a Co-Op grocery store just a 2 min walk away to get anything you need.
transit: We are just a 7 min walk or 4 min bus ride from East Croydon station and tramlink offering you an excellent transport hub to everywhere.  East Croydon Rail station:  - fast train to London Bridge or Victoria station in just 15 minutes! - Clapham Junction in 10 mins. - Gatwick Airport in 15 mins. Tramlink: - tramlink serving Wimbledon Buses: - X26 bus to Heathrow Airport (from stop E8 next to East Croydon station). - 410 bus to Crystal Palace - triangular town centre that hosts a variety of independent shops, cafÌ©s and restaurants or in the opposite direction let the bus take you to all the shopping and amenities of East Croydon.
access: You will have free WiFi. The kitchen and dining area is available to use at your leisure, including use of tea, coffee and condiments for cooking as well as kitchen appliances and utensils. The bathroom has a double shower with free use of shampoo and shower gel. The living room has a TV with freeview, stereo & DVD player. You will also have use of the garden with decked patio and a swing chair to enjoy in summer.
interaction: We will always welcome our guests and show you around. It's our home, so we are in and about much of the time, we work different hours so we may cross paths morning, noon or night. We are happy to let you settle in and leave you to it or come and join us for a chat - we're very easy-going :)
house_rules: Please take off shoes - we provide slippers.  Switch off all electrical devices, lights and lock windows & doors when leaving for the day.  Smokers can use the back garden. Be respectful of the neighbours when coming and going ... and that's it!
host_about: I am from Dublin and have been living in London for just over 5 years. I manage medical students in training. I enjoy singing and performing in gigs at London's Westfield Shopping Centres and the Royal Festival Hall in Southbank, languages (I speak French and teach English), jazz (will most likely have music playing in the house - but not blasting), pub gigs, coffee, dark chocolate, pastel pencil art, cycle touring (when I can) and an avid interest in nutrition and health but still enjoy my glass of wine on my swing chair in the garden. Bliss!Shaun, my other half, is an Aussie and loves his work (how many people can say that?) ... he is a Sports Therapist! He can't live without his classical guitar (called 'Lucia' - hmmmm!), his bike, Nexus, jazz, scotch bonnets, asparagus, the Back to the Future trilogy and me ... he adds wryly!!We love to meet people of different cultures and backgrounds. We enjoy finding out more about your language, food and culture if that's something you like to share. Equally, if you just want quiet time that's okay too. We also collect postcards from our guest's home town if you get a chance to send one on your return.We look forward to welcoming you to our home.Celine & Shaun
street: A  Alexandra Rd, Croydon, Greater London CR0 6EU, United Kingdom

interaction: #NAME?
house_rules: This home has been created with love over time--the expectation is that guests respect that this is a suburban home, hence, less noise past 10pm and please keep the space tidy. - As well, this is a home that is used so although it is professionally cleaned there is normal wear and tear to the property. - there is also an electricity and gas monitor hence excessive use of included utilities will result in a deduction from the deposit No pets  No smoking
host_about: Hello future guests,    I originally grew up in Canada and have lived in the UK for 10 years.  I love to travel, learn new things, to eat and, to work off the mounds of food with exercise!  I have spent a few months in Spain, France and Ghana so speak Spanish, French and a bit of Twi...hence, would love to practice my languages or help someone trying to learn english!  In my spare time you can find me at the gym at spin class or doing kettlebell training.  I also love hot power yoga and jogging...but as I said...I like to eat so I try and balance both my eating and exercise ;)!So why South London?  Although the centre of London offers amazing activities, I think the south provides some great options too!  My favourite views of London - the top of Forest Hill or Crystal Palace at night to see the London skyline.  For a relaxing day out travel to Richmond Park for cycling and deer watching and then head to Wimbledon common for afternoon tea!  Finally, for a day out in the countryside head out to Box Hill for stunning views and some fresh air.As a host - I am quite relaxed --I work from home so do have some supplies in my home.  I hope to make your stay as fun and memorable as possible so if you have any questions please feel free to ask!

name: 12b Delightful Contemporary Studio
summary: Small but perfectly formed! Currently being totally refurbished this wonderful light and airy studio, professionally designed and full of creature comforts but competitively priced to meet your budget. Home to Central London in just 35 minutes!
space: Currently being refurbished and available from mid June 2016....just 12 minutes walk from the busy East Croydon mainline station whisking you into Central London in just 14 minutes. Situated on the second floor a delightful professionally designed boutique style semi-contained studio apartment in a period residence.  This newly refurbished apartment has been completely re-modelled but manages to retain many of its period features and charm, from the high ceilings to the generous Victorian windows all married with concessions for modern living which make any length of stay a pleasure.  This studio has been designed around a one person stay so has a comfortable single bed which doubles up as a sofa and allows space for a table and chairs for studying or dining in the kitchen area. The kitchen is well equipped and has a sink/drainer, induction hob and an over hob extractor unit that ensures all cooking smells are vented out of the studio as well as a combination microwave/fan oven suitabl

neighborhood_overview: Within a few minutes walk there are several supermarkets and Croydon town center is a fifteen minute walk or short bus hop away and the area is very well served by public transport.  The iconic Whitgift shopping center has 140 retailers under one roof, is open seven days a week and central Croydon has an abundance of restaurants and bars.  There are convenience stores and super-markets within a few minutes walk.  Croydon has the largest population of all the Boroughs in London, and with Croydon Town acting as the heart of the borough; it could almost be a city in itself.  The area has always been a leader in financial, business and cultural sectors and is considered to be very well balanced with great living and working opportunities mixed with a bustling town centre and many green open areas. It also has a great alternative/arts scene, making living or staying in Croydon an increasingly attractive choice for anyone not wanting to pay higher London prices. The Borough of Croydon formed
notes: Please note that as of June 2016 this apartment was totally renovated and re-modeled. Both Iain and I are very keen travelers and have experienced all sorts of levels of accommodation in other countries, with that in mind our goal here is to try and provide quality, self contained accommodation with a high level of privacy and independence.   If you have any concerns or difficulties whilst at the apartment please contact us immediately so we can assist or rectify.  And please if you have enjoyed your time staying at our apartment, leave a nice review :-))
transit: There is a bus route directly outside the property and East Croydon Station is just a 12 minute walk away. It is a major transport hub for trains buses and trams.   East Croydon Station is your gateway to London and the South East, use your Oyster or Travel card for convenient, frequent and speedy travel Directly into Central London.  London Victoria in 15 mins and London Bridge in 20 mins. Once in Central London you can access all of London's transport network, Underground, trains, trams and buses and see all that the one of the worlds leading cities has to offer.    Direct non stop and frequent 24 hour service to London Gatwick Airport normally in just 14 mins makes travelling to the airport a breeze.  The excellent tram system serving Croydon can also take you directly to Wimbledon, home of the famous tennis tournament. It takes just 30 minutes and costs around å£4  East Croydon station is situated in zone 5
access: Your access is for your studio and the W/C on the landing and also the Laundry room which is at the rear of the building and which you can enter using your electronic key fob.
interaction: My self or my good friend and business partner Iain, are generally available at any time during the day.
house_rules: There are no restrictions other than to remember to respect other guests and keep your noise to a comfortable and considerate level. Please note that the building is a smoke free zone so no smoking is allowed inside.
host_about: Friendly and outgoing with a passion for travelling. Having traveled extensively myself I realize the value of hassle free, reasonably priced accommodation that is easily accessible and with a comfortable level of privacy.

name: COSY TWIN, EXCELLENT TRAVEL LINKS
summary: We offer a lovely, homely twin room, great to relax in after a tiring day of sightseeing.  It comfortably fits two and is located within easy reach of open spaces, outdoor sports and local shops and restaurants. We look forward to meeting you!
space: Our twin room comfortably accommodates two people with 2 single beds (new mattresses), wardrobe, drawers, desk and tv, and with added availability of free wifi, clean towels and bed linen.
