You are welcome to use the large kitchen/diner and will have shared access to the bathroom, lounge, dining room and garden. interaction: #NAME?
house_rules: This home has been created with love over time--the expectation is that guests respect that this is a suburban home, hence, less noise past 10pm and please keep the space tidy. Owner works from home so I am flexible about check-in and check out times No pets  No smoking
host_about: Hello future guests,    I originally grew up in Canada and have lived in the UK for 10 years.  I love to travel, learn new things, to eat and, to work off the mounds of food with exercise!  I have spent a few months in Spain, France and Ghana so speak Spanish, French and a bit of Twi...hence, would love to practice my languages or help someone trying to learn english!  In my spare time you can find me at the gym at spin class or doing kettlebell training.  I also love hot power yoga and jogging...but as I said...I like to eat so I try and balance both my eating and exercise ;)!So why South London?  Although the centre of London offers amazing activities, I think the south provides some great options too!  My favourite views of London - the top of Forest Hill or Crystal Palace at night to see the London skyline.  For a relaxing day out travel to Richmond Park for cycling and deer watching and then head to Wimbledon common for afternoon tea!  Finally, for a day out in the countryside head out to Box Hill for stunning views and some fresh air.As a host - I am quite relaxed --I work from home so do have some supplies in my home.  I hope to make your stay as fun and memorable as possible so if you have any questions please feel free to ask!

name: Super attic room in leafy SW London
summary: A light and airy self-contained room with ensuite shower and wash facilities, comfortable double + folding single/travel cot for families. The room has unlimited free wi-fi, cable TV, DVD and stereo, and works as self-contained studio. Shared WC.
space: A lovely room on the top floor of a large suburban house within half an hour's travel time of Central London and all its attractions. Bed arrangements comprise a super comfortable double  sofa bed, which would easily accommodate two adults, plus a separate fold-out single bed and / or travel cot for the kids. The room has an en-suite washbasin and a walk-in shower, but no toilet, which is in the family bathroom downstairs. The room has a TV, cable service, free WiFI, a DVD player and a stereo. It's warm in winter, cool in summer, and the door to the room is lockable from inside and out. There is built-in wardrobe space and extra under-roof storage for bags and cases. We're ideally situated for travellers arriving or departing via Gatwick airport. The rest of house is occupied by a very welcoming family of three.  Thanks for looking, and happy travelling.

neighborhood_overview: Croydon town center is a fifteen minute walk or short bus hop away and the area is very well served by public transport.  The iconic Whitgift shopping center has 140 retailers under one roof, is open seven days a week and central Croydon has an abundance of restaurants and bars.  There are convenience stores and super-markets within a few minutes walk.  Croydon has the largest population of all the Boroughs in London, and with Croydon Town acting as the heart of the borough; it could almost be a city in itself.  The area has always been a leader in financial, business and cultural sectors and is considered to be very well balanced with great living and working opportunities mixed with a bustling town center and many green open areas. It also has a great alternative/arts scene, making living or staying in Croydon an increasingly attractive choice for anyone not wanting to pay higher London prices. The Borough of Croydon formed in 1965 and the name derives from Saxon times, meaning ÛÏvall
notes: Please note that as of June 2015 this apartment was totally renovated and re-modeled. Both Iain and I are very keen travelers and have experienced all sorts of levels of accommodation in other countries, with that in mind our goal here is to try and provide quality, self contained accommodation with a high level of privacy and independence.   If you have any concerns or difficulties whilst at the apartment please contact us immediately so we can assist or rectify.  And please if you have enjoyed your time staying at our apartment, leave a nice review :-))
transit: There is a bus route directly outside the property and East Croydon Station is just a 12 minute walk away. It is a major transport hub for trains buses and trams.   East Croydon Station is your gateway to London and the South East, use your Oyster or Travel card for convenient, frequent and speedy travel Directly into Central London.  London Victoria in 16 mins and London Bridge in 20 mins. Once in Central London you can access all of London's transport network, Underground, trains, trams and buses and see all that the one of the worlds leading cities has to offer.    Direct non stop and frequent 24 hour service to London Gatwick Airport normally in just 14 mins makes travelling to the airport a breeze.  The excellent tram system serving Croydon can also take you directly to Wimbledon, home of the famous tennis tournament. It takes just 30 minutes and costs around å£4  East Croydon station is situated in zone 5

description: We have a lovely double bedroom to rent in South Norwood. The end of terrace house is located equidistant between Norwood Junction and Selhurst station which both have great transport links to central London. It's a two bedroom house with a living room, dining room, kitchen, upstairs bathroom and back garden. You can access all over the house apart from our bedroom. You can roam free. We have busy work schedules but always like to cook and socialise when possible. It's great for Crystal Palace FC fans, we're literally a stone throws away from the stadium. Crystal Palace is a great place to go out in with great pubs and restaurants and the local market. Norwood Junction is vibrant and up-and-coming with great transport links. Transport is great. Selhurst Station is a 6 minute walk away as well as Norwood Junction station. Both these stations go straight to London Bridge and also to Victoria. There's also the overground with links to central London and East London.

summary: Peace & calm within easy reach of Central London. Let our double room with private bathroom be your base for exploring, and get to know trendy Crystal Palace while you're here. WiFi is available to plan your trips, or we can help point the way!
space: We have a sunny double room available in our terraced home in Crystal Palace, with private bathroom across the hall, and continental breakfast available. The bathroom has a bath, with shower over, and sink. The toilet is separate and just next door. The bathroom will  only be used by you for the duration of the stay, as we have another shower room downstairs.  My partner and I live here with our two bengal cats. They aren't allowed in your room, but they are very friendly, and will enjoy welcoming you as much as we will. They are very much part of the family, so do bear this in mind if you are not used to cats. The street we live on is quiet and calm, away from traffic noise, but only a five minute walk from the high street, which has a variety of shops, restaurants and pubs. Many people have lived in this road for over ten years, so you're really getting a flavour of residential London life and a chance to blend in with the locals. Parking on the street is free, but space is limited a

The bathroom has a bath, with shower over, and sink. The toilet is separate and just next door. The bathroom will  only be used by you for the duration of the stay, as we have another shower room downstairs.  My partner and I live here with our two bengal cats. They aren't allowed in your room, but they are very friendly, and will enjoy welcoming you as much as we will. They are very much part of the family, so do bear this in mind if you are not used to cats. The street we live on is quiet and calm, away from traffic noise, but only a five minute walk from the high street, which has a variety
neighborhood_overview: Locally, the Crystal Palace Triangle has a huge choice of restaurants, cafes, pubs and bars and independent shops. We'd be happy to give you recommendations for where to eat in the evenings locally -  there is a huge range of cuisine on offer in the Triangle, so whatever you're in the mood for the chances are you won't be disappointed.  For those interested in markets, there is a weekly organic farmers market held on Saturdays, less than five minutes walk, and there are also various shops specialising in antique and vintage furniture, design, clothing, crockery and records. It's a great place for vintage and retro finds! Crystal Palace Park is home to the dinosaurs once displayed at the 1851 exhibition as well as sphinxes and original maze, is great for a stroll with your camera. On a clear day you'll get some great views.
notes: The area is fairly hilly, and our street is quite steep towards one end. The front drive is sloping and does have uneven paving, so it may not be a suitable place to stay if you are unsteady on your feet.
transit: Gipsy Hill is the nearest station, with direct lines into London Victoria and London Bridge, taking between 25 and 35 minutes. Crystal Palace Station is five minutes further away on foot, and although it is on the same suburban line as Gipsy Hill, has the added benefit of being on the "orange" Overground tube line. This makes it even easier to get directly to East London, and easily links in with the Jubilee Line, or the DLR for visits to Greenwich, or to get to City Airport. From Gipsy Hill You can also get to Embankment in 35 minutes, via Balham, and you can get to Kings Cross St Pancras on the Thameslink line, via Tulse Hill in around 50 minutes. This is a much easier route if you have heavy bags as you can avoid the stairs on the tube, but the line is very crowded in rush hour. This line also stops at Blackfriars, which is ideal for visiting the South Bank, St Pauls and the Tate Modern Crystal Palace is also served by night buses, which terminate in the Crystal Palace Bus garage, s
access: Your bedroom has a double bed, chest of drawers and wardrobe. We provide towels and basic toiletries, such as soap, shower gel and shampoo. There is a TV in your room, books which you are welcome to borrow, and we can set you up with the WiFi code when you arrive. You're very welcome to use the kitchen to make hot drinks, and keep things in the fridge, but please ask if you would like to do any cooking.  We would be happy to provide dinner, as an alternative, by arrangement. Feel free to ask me more about this.
interaction: My partner and I live in the house, so just let us know if there's anything you need to help your trip go more smoothly, whether it's recommending a route to get somewhere, ideas on where to go, or any issues with your stay.
house_rules: We ask you to treat the room with the same respect you would treat your home. We are a non-smoking household and there is no smoking in the rooms.  We do have central heating and this is programmed to keep the house toasty in the morning and the late afternoon/evening when people come in from the day, but we do not heat the house to a high temperature in the middle of the day when you will most likely be off exploring the city.  I do work from home quite often, so don't be surprised to see me around the house if you pop back during the day.  You are most welcome to make use of our dining room and kitchen to make drinks etc, so please don't eat in the bedroom.  My partner Jon often has to get up early to travel around the country for work, so if you come home after midnight, please be mindful of this, and try to remember to switch off upstairs lights, keep noise to a minimum, and if at all possible save showering for the morning.  Our cats are friendly and curious; if you don't want the

neighborhood_overview: Croydon town center is a fifteen minute walk or short bus hop away and the area is very well served by public transport.  The iconic Whitgift shopping center has 140 retailers under one roof, is open seven days a week and central Croydon has an abundance of restaurants and bars.  There are convenience stores and super-markets within a few minutes walk.  Croydon has the largest population of all the Boroughs in London, and with Croydon Town acting as the heart of the borough; it could almost be a city in itself.  The area has always been a leader in financial, business and cultural sectors and is considered to be very well balanced with great living and working opportunities mixed with a bustling town centre and many green open areas. It also has a great alternative/arts scene, making living or staying in Croydon an increasingly attractive choice for anyone not wanting to pay higher London prices. The Borough of Croydon formed in 1965 and the name derives from Saxon times, meaning ÛÏvall
notes: Please note that as of June 2015 this apartment was totally renovated and re-modeled. Both Iain and I are very keen travelers and have experienced all sorts of levels of accommodation in other countries, with that in mind our goal here is to try and provide quality, self contained accommodation with a high level of privacy and independence.   If you have any concerns or difficulties whilst at the apartment please contact us immediately so we can assist or rectify.  And please if you have enjoyed your time staying at our apartment, leave a nice review :-))
transit: There is a bus route directly outside the property and East Croydon Station is just a 12 minute walk away. It is a major transport hub for trains buses and trams.   East Croydon Station is your gateway to London and the South East, use your Oyster or Travel card for convenient, frequent and speedy travel Directly into Central London.  London Victoria in 16 mins and London Bridge in 20 mins. Once in Central London you can access all of London's transport network, Underground, trains, trams and buses and see all that the one of the worlds leading cities has to offer.    Direct non stop and frequent 24 hour service to London Gatwick Airport normally in just 14 mins makes travelling to the airport a breeze.  The excellent tram system serving Croydon can also take you directly to Wimbledon, home of the famous tennis tournament. It takes just 30 minutes and costs around å£4  East Croydon station is situated in zone 5
access: Studio apartment with shower room and toilet, kitchen and convenient laundry room with washing machines and dryers. All locks are electronic and will open from the key fob supplied to you so you don't have to carry awkward keys.

house_rules: There are no restrictions other than to remember to respect other guests and keep your noise to a comfortable and considerate level.
host_about: Friendly and outgoing with a passion for travelling. Having traveled extensively myself I realize the value of hassle free, reasonably priced accommodation that is easily accessible and with a comfortable level of privacy.

transit: The local supermarket is only a few minutes walk away, and is open until 11pm. There are other shops, such as a chemist, off-licence and fast food takeaways along the same high street. The railway station is a five minute walk away; from there you can get to London Bridge in about ten minutes, where there are underground connections to pretty much everywhere else in London. There are also trams to Wimbledon, and buses to Croydon town centre, which has two very large shopping precincts. Free parking is available 20 metres away, parking outside the house is payable by a meter. Gatwick Airport is a 20 minute train journey to East Croydon, then one train stop, a five minute walk and you are at the studio. Heathrow Airport takes about 1h and 30minutes on public transport. Stansted is in Essex so takes about 1hr and 45minutes on public transport. All directions and advice will be sent to booking guests.

neighborhood_overview: The flat is situated on a quiet and tranquil road. The flat is a 2 minutes walk away from Crystal Palace football stadium. On match days when fans decent into the area the atmosphere is electrifying, it brings a sense of excitement into the area.  There are two train stations 8/10mins walk from the flat Norwood Junction and Thornton Heath railway stations.  Both stations have direct trains into central London, this takes 15mins.  There two major super markets not to far from the flat. Sainsburys is a 2 minute walk away, next to Crystal Palace football stadium.  Tescos is a 10mins walk away, next to Thornton Heath railway station.   There are plenty of take away shops within the area,take your pick.  Want to work out during your stay...there is a gym 8mins walk away for you to get your sweat on.  Croydon is a diverse town, which makes it a pleasant and vibrant place to live in.
notes: Just bring your unique self and enjoy your stay. My home is your home. Tea/coffee and toast provided for breakfast. The 468 bus stop is a 10seconds walk away from the flat.  468 Croydon - Elephant and Castle 198  Thornton Heath - Shrublands 50 Croydon - Stockwell X68 Croydon - Solane Square  130 Norwood Junction - Thornton Heath  There are a few cab stations within the area who are reliable and reasonably priced. host_about: I am a Design and Technology teacher who is into all things creative.  Electronics is my favourite subject. A regular at the gym, as I am a gluten for punishment. I love dessert wine, sweet cocktail and lots of ice cream.  Currently looking into studying mechanical engineering part time.  The teacher must always go back to being a student to better understand the struggles amongst students in their care.  Design and making is what I live and breathe for.   Life is beautiful when I am soldering a circuit or making a product.  A lover of good literature even though I do get to read as much as I would like to. Travelling is my mission in my spare time.  Learning about other people's travels keeps me motivated to see the world beyond my own.

house_rules: This home has been created with love over time--the expectation is that guests respect that this is a suburban home, hence, less noise past 10pm. All guests are expected to keep common spaces clean and tidy. Owner works from home so I am flexible about check-in and check out times No pets  No smoking No overnight guests unless otherwise agreed
host_about: Hello future guests,    I originally grew up in Canada and have lived in the UK for 10 years.  I love to travel, learn new things, to eat and, to work off the mounds of food with exercise!  I have spent a few months in Spain, France and Ghana so speak Spanish, French and a bit of Twi...hence, would love to practice my languages or help someone trying to learn english!  In my spare time you can find me at the gym at spin class or doing kettlebell training.  I also love hot power yoga and jogging...but as I said...I like to eat so I try and balance both my eating and exercise ;)!So why South London?  Although the centre of London offers amazing activities, I think the south provides some great options too!  My favourite views of London - the top of Forest Hill or Crystal Palace at night to see the London skyline.  For a relaxing day out travel to Richmond Park for cycling and deer watching and then head to Wimbledon common for afternoon tea!  Finally, for a day out in the countryside head out to Box Hill for stunning views and some fresh air.As a host - I am quite relaxed --I work from home so do have some supplies in my home.  I hope to make your stay as fun and memorable as possible so if you have any questions please feel free to ask!

name: Double room +more in modern house
summary: Bright room in a lovely, modern house with garden bordering park. In easy reach of the restaurants and bars of Crystal Palace, and the football stadium.  Ideal for work or play.  If you have kids, there's an extra room for them too (please ask).
space: This is a double room in a 5 bedroom house, with storage and space to work.   This quiet road next to a park is Ideal for a break, as a stop off on your way through London, or as a place to work, or crash while you're in the city. The room is bright and airy.  There's a bathroom right outside, and full wireless Internet connection.   I'm happy for you to use the kitchen, garden and the open-plan living area.  If you're travelling with children, there's a separate single room available (just drop me a line and I'll let you know all about it).   If you've got any questions, please drop me a line right now.
description: Bright room in a lovely, modern house with garden bordering park. In easy reach of the restaurants and bars of Crystal Palace, and the football stadium.  Ideal for work or play. There's a bathroom right outside, and full wireless Internet connection.   I'm happy for you to use the kitchen, garden and the open-plan living area.  If you're travelling with children, there's a separate single room available (just drop me a line and I'll let you know all about it).   If you've got any questions, please drop me a line right now. You'll have full access to the open plan communal areas - the dining room, and living room.  You can use the kitchen when you like, and I'm ge
neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace is a great area of London.  The pubs, bars and restaurants of "the triangle" are just a few minutes walk away, and cater for all tastes.  We're on the top of one of the biggest hills in London here, so there's a spectacular view of the city, or the surrounding area around every corner.  In addition, there are more local parks and green areas than almost anywhere in London.  The biggest of these is Crystal Palace park - which features a national sports centre, the ruins of the Crystal Palace itself, a community farm, a maze, a boating lake, and the famous victorian dinosaur sculptures. Just down the hill from us (7 minutes on the bus or a 20 minute walk) is the Crystal Palace football stadium, and a little further afield you'll find Dulwich (site of the world's oldest private art gallery), Croydon, Bromley, Sydenham, and Penge.
transit: Bus stops (100 yards from the house) take you straight to Crystal Palace station (7 mins),  Croydon, Brixton (20 mins), and Elephant And Castle (close to London Bridge). Crystal Palace station is on the brand new Overground line into central London, and also has links to London Bridge and Victoria stations.   Norwood Junction station is near the Crystal Palace football stadium, and offers fast trains to London Bridge (17 mins) There's also the Number 3 bus which takes a route through Brixton, past Big Ben, Downing Street, Trafalgar Square and up to Oxford Street - a fairly long journey (an hour or so) but one which takes in some of the sights of London.  The bus leaves every 6 mins or so.
access: You'll have full access to the open plan communal areas - the dining room, and living room.  You can use the kitchen when you like, and I'm generally cooking something most nights! I have a wall-sized cinema projector TV, so if you fancy a night in, come with ideas for a film night, and I'll see if I can get your request on lovefilm!  The garden and patio are open to guests and make a great place for a BBQ or a glass of wine (and for those with children, there's a small playground within sight of the house).  The garden backs onto a local woodland park, so it's regularly visited by squirrels, foxes, woodpeckers and surprisingly, even London's local parrots!   Come and relax.
interaction: I'm a writer and animator, and I work from an office in the garden.  This means I'm usually around to help with anything you need.   I've got two young children, who are sometimes around, and I'm usually cooking something interesting most nights.   I've lived in South East London for over 20 years, so I know my way around the city pretty well, and I'd be happy to answer any questions you've got, and help in any way I can during your stay.
house_rules: Please do not leave dead bodies in the cupboard.
host_about: I'm an animator and writer of children's books, so I work from an office in the garden, and I'm around most of the time.  I've been living in South East London for 20 years now, and have a fairly good idea of my way around the city.  I'm fairly sociable, and I have two children so I'm aware of what's needed if you are travelling with kids.  I look forward to meeting you.

A short walk from the centre of vibrant Croydon and short train journey to the heart of London, each apartment offers an open plan kitchen/dining room/lounge, separate shower room, double bedroom, Wifi, a welcome continental breakfast  pack, secure 24-hour keyless entry, and much more.

WiFi is provided free of charge but we cannot be held responsible for any interruption of service due to problems with the service provider.
host_about: Hi, IÛªm Michael. IÛªm a driving instructor, property developer and keen paraglider (or, I will be when my broken leg recovers from my last outing!). ItÛªs not all about me though: there are four of us (aged 22-54) running the apartments as a small family business. Admittedly, IÛªm not to best with languages, but between us we also speak Bulgarian fluently (two-and-a-half of us), some Russian (one-and-half of us), and some very limited French and German (one of us - but heÛªs happy to give it a go!).

space: A newly renovated, ground floor apartment, having oak flooring throughout and its own private garden with large decked areas for outdoor living. There are two sets of French Doors leading on to the decks. A barbecue and outdoor seating is provided for summer use. The apartment is the whole ground floor of a Victorian house. Great effort was made to keep the lovely original feel during the renovation with high ceilings in the hallway and bedrooms. neighborhood_overview: In a friendly residential area with local supermarkets just a few minutes walk.
transit: The local supermarket is only a few minutes walk away, and is open until 11pm. There are other shops, such as a chemist, off-licence and fast food takeaways along the same high street. The railway station is a five minute walk away; from there you can get to London Bridge in about ten minutes, where there are underground connections to pretty much everywhere else in London. There are also trams to Wimbledon, and buses to Croydon town centre, which has two very large shopping precincts. Free parking is available 20 metres away, parking outside the house is payable by a meter, å£2.50 covers the whole day. Gatwick Airport is a 20 minute train journey to East Croydon, then one train stop, a five minute walk and you are at the studio. Heathrow Airport takes about 1h and 30minutes on public transport. Stansted Airport is in Essex so takes about 1hr and 45minutes on public transport. All directions and advice will be sent to booking guests.

name: Private room in modern house.
summary: Bright room in a lovely, modern house with garden bordering park. In easy reach of the restaurants and bars of Crystal Palace, and the football stadium. There's a small double bed (see my other listing for a larger room).
space: This is a single/small double room in a 5 bedroom house - The bed is a "small double" - which is perfectly fine for 2, but if you want a bigger room, take a look at my other listing. This quiet road next to a park is Ideal for a break, as a stop off on your way through London, or as a place to work, or crash while you're in the city. The room is bright and airy.  There's a bathroom right outside, and full wireless Internet connection.   I'm happy for you to use the kitchen, garden and the open-plan living area.   If you've got any questions, please drop me a line right now.

You can use the kitchen when you like, and I'm generally cooking something most nights! I have a wall-si
neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace is a great area of London.  The pubs, bars and restaurants of "the triangle" are just a few minutes walk away, and cater for all tastes.  We're on the top of one of the biggest hills in London here, so there's a spectacular view of the city, or the surrounding area around every corner.  In addition, there are more local parks and green areas than almost anywhere in London.  The biggest of these is Crystal Palace park - which features a national sports centre, the ruins of the Crystal Palace itself, a community farm, a maze, a boating lake, and the famous victorian dinosaur sculptures. Just down the hill from us (7 minutes on the bus or a 20 minute walk) is the Crystal Palace football stadium, and a little further afield you'll find Dulwich (site of the world's oldest private art gallery), Croydon, Bromley, Sydenham, and Penge.
transit: Bus stops (100 yards from the house) take you straight to Crystal Palace station (7 mins),  Croydon, Brixton (20 mins), and Elephant And Castle (close to London Bridge). Crystal Palace station is on the brand new Overground line into central London, and also has links to London Bridge and Victoria stations.   Norwood Junction station is near the Crystal Palace football stadium, and offers fast trains to London Bridge (17 mins) There's also the Number 3 bus which takes a route through Brixton, past Big Ben, Downing Street, Trafalgar Square and up to Oxford Street - a fairly long journey (an hour or so) but one which takes in some of the sights of London.  The bus leaves every 6 mins or so.
access: You'll have full access to the open plan communal areas - the dining room, and living room.  You can use the kitchen when you like, and I'm generally cooking something most nights! I have a wall-sized cinema projector TV, so if you fancy a night in, come with ideas for a film night, and I'll see if I can get your request on lovefilm!  The garden and patio are open to guests and make a great place for a BBQ or a glass of wine (and for those with children, there's a small playground within sight of the house).  The garden backs onto a local woodland park, so it's regularly visited by squirrels, foxes, woodpeckers and surprisingly, even London's local parrots!   Come and relax.
interaction: I'm a writer and animator, and I work from an office in the garden.  This means I'm usually around to help with anything you need.   I've got two young children, who are sometimes around, and I'm usually cooking something interesting most nights.   I've lived in South East London for over 20 years, so I know my way around the city pretty well, and I'd be happy to answer any questions you've got, and help in any way I can during your stay.
house_rules: Please do not leave dead bodies in the cupboard.
host_about: I'm an animator and writer of children's books, so I work from an office in the garden, and I'm around most of the time.  I've been living in South East London for 20 years now, and have a fairly good idea of my way around the city.  I'm fairly sociable, and I have two children so I'm aware of what's needed if you are travelling with kids.  I look forward to meeting you.

summary: Spacious double bedroom with your own tea & coffee making facilities. Separate WC, shared bathroom.  Beautiful secluded back garden. Located 200metres to Sanderstead train station, half an hour to central London. Off road parking.
space: Our house is very conveniently located, being just 200metres from Sanderstead train station, with London Victoria station reachable in as little as 24 minutes. We are a mile from the well known South Croydon restaurant quarter. This can be walked to, as well as being served by a prompt and regular bus service. If you are travelling via Gatwick airport, this is accessible by train from around 30 minutes (allowing for one change). We are not far from the M25 motorway, which is about 15 minutes away by car.

The spacious double bedroom is offered with tea and coffee making facilities in the room. An extendable table can serve as a desk with 2 chairs. Guests will have use of the modern family bathroom, and separate WC (newly updated with brand new installation). W
neighborhood_overview: Our home is set in a green and leafy area set right on the border of Greater London. Transportation links are really good by car, train, or bus. Central London is just half an hour away, but if you want to try out the local restaurant quarter which is about a mile away, there is plenty of choice to suit all tastes and budgets.
notes: Continental breakfast can be added with  prior notice at å£7 per person per day.  We also have a cat, so therefore we unfortunately cannot receive other pets.
transit: Getting around is easy by public transport, and if you have a car there are attractions to explore all over the South East area.
access: The spacious double bedroom is offered with tea and coffee making facilities in the room. An extendable table can serve as a desk with 2 chairs. Guests will have use of the modern family bathroom, and separate WC (newly updated with brand new installation). We can supply guests with WiFi internet access too, free subject to a reasonable use policy.
interaction: We can give advice about places to visit, travel arrangements, in London or further afield. Should you need information on local amenities and services, we have prepared that for you too.
house_rules: No smoking is allowed in the house.
host_about: Married, love almost all sports, keen on photography, the open air and landscapes especially. I admire a lot of architecture (so London is great to have on the doorstep), and wish I had more time for music, concerts, museums, and so much more. My wife and I travel to Austria more than anywhere else, as it is so full of wonderful countryside, great cuisine in all the regions, and chock full of culture too. When you come and stay, we can share that passion as much or as little as you want!I could not be without my wife, Eva-Maria, and our cat which is just an ultimate cat (see the photos). I need a good strong coffee to start the day well. Our favourite cuisines are Italian, Austrian, and Thai, but we love most food to be honest. The most important thing is that the ingredients are fresh, top quality, and that it is all prepared with love,  care, and respect.My motto would be either "if it's worth doing, it's worth doing properly", or "treat everyone like you would like to be treated yourself"?We are new to hosting with AirBnB, so we shall do our best to make it as easy on everyone as possible, and everything should work out fine.

No smoking No pets No guests No profanity or swearing  Prompt departure  Signed Internet usage form required (to protect ourselves from any illegal sites you are visiting) Finally - to have fun!  We maybe Muslim but we love music, playing guitar and reading.  We are easy and relaxed but having had many house guests, the above house rules are there to ensure we the booking goes easily, and fairly.

I also run a niche charity AMCARIZA Foundation - just search for it on the internet.Please read my reviews to find out more as that'll give you a better feel of who I am when I meet others. Thanks for reading.

The iconic Whitgift shopping center has 140 retailers under one roof, is open seven days a week and central Croydon has an abundance of restaurants and bars.  There are convenience stores and super-markets within a few minutes walk.  Croydon has the largest population of all the Boroughs in London, and with Croydon Town acting as the heart of the borough; it could almost be a city in itself.  The area has always been a leader in financial, business and cultural sectors and is considered to be very well balanced with great living and working opportunities mixed with a bustling town center and many green open areas. It also has a great alternative/arts scene, making living or staying in Croydon an increasingly attractive choice for anyone not wanting to pay higher London prices. name: Room with a view in Crystal Palace
summary: Come stay in our 2-bed flat right on the Crystal Palace triangle. You are welcome to use our kitchen/living room, bathroom, tea and coffee, join us at the pub, or just hang out and enjoy the view of the spectacular skyline in the distance. Welcome to London!
space: We have a really nice, bright and airy flat, with a big bathtub (the perfect place to relax after you've been travelling for a while!), fully-stocked kitchen, TV with lots of channels, washing machine... and you are welcome to use it all.

Only 20 minutes away from central London by public transport, it is exactly the type of neighbourhood you want to come home to a
neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace is such a hidden gem in London, and the perfect place to experience this magnificent city like a local. Only 20 minutes away from central London by public transport, it is exactly the type of neighbourhood you want to come home to after a busy day sightseeing in the big city. Full of pubs, cafes, independent boutiques, vintage and farmers markets, antique shops and gardens. You won't find a Starbucks or Pret a Manger here; instead you'll find Portuguese bakeries, Thai and Nepalese cuisine, organic barbecues, and 2 Italian restaurants right below our flat! Crystal Palace is a real celebration of the diversity for which London is famous. Plus, it is the highest point in the city so the views are incredible. Every day when we walk to the train station we are flabbergasted... The Shard, the Gherkin, St. Paul's... All there in front of you! (We are big fans of Crystal Palace, if you hadn't noticed) :)
transit: It is super easy to reach the very centre of London from our flat. We are ten minutes walk to Gipsy Hill or Crystal Palace station, with regular services to Victoria (25 minutes), London Bridge (25 minutes), and Clapham Junction, Highbury and Islington, Dalston, Brighton and beyond.
access: Kitchen facilities, coffee and tea, TV, bathroom, washing machine ... Make yourself at home!
interaction: We travel a lot for work and pleasure so we might or might not be here during your stay. But we're always just a email, call or (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) away.
host_about: My name is Andrea and I'm a 34-year old Canadian. Travel is my greatest passion; I am a published travel writer, and have spent five years working as a tour guide around Europe. In the off-season I like to travel with my husband, Edu (a proud Spaniard); we recently returned from a month-long trip to Southern Africa, where we got up close with elephants and cobras, had Victoria Falls all to ourselves, and I even got to hold a meerkat!As for hobbies, I love yoga, Zumba classes, scrapbooking, photography, good movies, bike-riding and animals. Edu and I are very sociable, we love traveling, and meeting people around the world.

There is a mixture of mostly large detached properties. Purley town centre, Coulsdon and Wallington are nearby for shops/restaurants.
notes: Price is å£30 per person per night, discounted for weekly/monthly. Sleeps up to 6 people. Two per room, although a child under 10 can share parents room if preferred. If booking for 1 or 2 people then please note there may be other guests sharing facilities. House is uphill walk from Purley station so recommend taxi on arrival with luggage.
transit: Trains from Purley go direct to London Bridge, Victoria, St Pancras International and Gatwick. 127 bus is nearest route. Several other bus routes from Purley Town Centre. M25 is 15 min drive. A23 London/Gatwick/Brighton goes through Purley.
access: The space is self-contained, adjacent to the main house, linked by internal archway with door. Guests have sole use of sitting room/kitchen area and shower/toilet, in addition to bedroom(s). Main house is not included in rental. Use of garden/swimming pool/hot tub by arrangement, and at own risk. Children must be supervised at all times.
interaction: Owners live in main house and are happy to share information and assist where appropriate. Willing to provide occasional meal, if required and can order welcome pack of essential groceries on request. Cleaner will do laundry if required. There is washing machine for guest use.
house_rules: Please respect our privacy, and keep noise to minimum, particularly after 11pm. Children to be supervised at all times outside the house as there is an open fish pond and unfenced swimming pool. There is a lawned play area at the end of the garden, so please keep children/ball games off flower beds/vegetable area. No extra visitors except by special agreement.

name: Beautiful flat in South London
summary: Our flat is very bright, clean and airy. It is located in a Victorian house built in early 1900s. It is a spacious & quirky London flat located over 3 floors, only 20 minutes by public transport from London Bridge and 30 minutes from Gatwick Airport.
space: The flat has recently been refurbished to a high standard and is very comfortable. It is located over 3 floors and is rather spacious (over 70 sq m). On the 1st floor there is a very cosy living room with oak furniture, a large Victorian bay window and a small sofa bed. There is also a bathroom. On the 2nd floor there is a large kitchen with a dining table for 6 people. On the 3rd floor, which is a loft conversion, there is a large double bedroom. The flat has steps, so may not be ideal for very young children and old and disabled people. We have two good bicycles that you can borrow during your stay. We have no television, but we do have a large TV screen and access to the internet.

neighborhood_overview: The flat is located in the area called South Norwood.  We have good transport links to central London, with London Bridge only 20 minutes away and Gatwick Airport about 30 minutes away by public transport. A rather large Sainsbury's supermarket is located 5-7 minute walk from us.
transit: The flat is located 8-minute walk to Norwood Junction Station (Zone 4), from where you can get by direct trains to London Bridge in 12 minutes, Victoria (via Clapham Junction) in 30 minutes and Shoreditch (by London Overground - orange line) in 30 minutes. You can also catch a train to East Croydon, which is less than 5 minutes away. From East Croydon there are 24-hour direct fast trains to Gatwick Airport.
access: Guests will have access to the entire flat, including everything in the kitchen, such as fridge, washing machine, electric kettle, toaster, blender, microwave, cooker, oven, plates, glasses, pots and pans, etc.
host_about: I live in London with my husband and our baby daughter. I am a journalist and my husband works in procurement. We use Airbnb to offer our flat to people visiting London, when we are away. We also use it when we go travelling. It is a fantastic service!

house_rules: Rubbish - make sure that any bins go outside ready for TUESDAY collection. Neighbours - No noise after 10.30pm, and absolutely no parties please  Shoes -  no shoes inside the house please  Phone chargers - Please unplug phone chargers when not in use to prevent fire.  Smoking - please only smoke in the back garden Dishwasher - please clean the filter after use Shower - leaks slightly at hinge end, please dry floor after use Cleaning - the house is cleansed only after you leave, please leave all communal areas as you would expect to find them. Cleaning materials are under the stairs, mop is in the back garden. Front door - please lock font internal door if you are the last person to leave the cottage.  Damage/breakages - please inform me immediately if anything gets broken or damaged. Many guests forget to do this unfortunately.  Keys - please leave front door keys on the dining table when you leave.  Many thanks, Sue

From the main train station, you can catch the train to London Victoria which will take about 15 minutes ( 2 stops ) to arrive there. Trains come regularly every 3-4 mins. during rush hours and every 5-10 mins at other times. There are 3 buses from East Croydon that come to our house which are the 119,198 and 194. There are also; - West Wickham station which is a 15 minutes walk from the house, with trains going to London Bridge or Charing Cross. - West Croydon overground station and bus no 198 that comes to our house.

name: Elegant serviced apartments, central Croydon. Apt2
summary: The 160-year old Victorian house is divided to three apartments refurbished to a high standard. The apartments offer a luxury hotel-like elegance and feel, with the comfort, security and convenience of home. A short walk from the centre of vibrant Croydon and short train journey to the heart of London, each apartment offers an open plan kitchen/dining room/lounge, separate shower room, double bedroom, Wifi, a welcome continental breakfast  pack, secure 24-hour keyless entry, and much more.
space: Open plan kitchen/dining room/lounge with fridge/ freezer, dishwasher, hob, microwave/oven, toaster, kettle, designer glass dining table, flat screen TV, leather sofabed, etc Quiet, good size bedroom, with double bed, Egyptian cotton bedding, a high quality 1500 pocket sprung mattress, wardrobe and dressing table/desk. Small but elegant shower room including shower cubicle, washbasin, WC, full range of toiletries, luxury cotton towels, and white cotton bath robes (deposit required).
description: The 160-year old Victorian house is divided to three apartments refurbished to a high standard. The apartments offer a luxury hotel-like elegance and feel, with the comfort, security and convenience of home. A short walk from the centre of vibrant Croydon and short train journey to the heart of London, each apartment offers an open plan kitchen/dining room/lounge, separate shower room, double bedroom, Wifi, a welcome continental breakfast  pack, secure 24-hour keyless entry, and much more. Open plan kitchen/dining room/lounge with fridge/ freezer, dishwasher, hob, microwave/oven, toaster, kettle, designer glass dining table, flat screen TV, leather sofabed, etc Quiet, good size bedroom, with double bed, Egyptian cotton bedding, a high quality 1500 pocket sprung mattress, wardrobe and dressing table/desk. Small but elegant shower room including shower cubicle, washbasin, WC, full range of toiletries, luxury cotton towels, and white cotton bath robes (deposit required). We will always ai
notes: Guests can also enjoy complimentary wifi, complimentary slippers, and guest utility room (including washing machine, drier and ironing facilities).  This is a serviced apartment and will be cleaned twice weekly throughout your stay at no extra charge - along with towel and bedding changes, of course!
transit: The apartment is within a residential area and yet just 5 minutesÛª walk from the heart of Croydon with its many shops, restaurants, bars and so forth. It is also a 12 minute walk (or 5 minute tram ride) from East Croydon mainline railway station making it readily accessible from Gatwick airport, and an excellent base from which to explore central London, Wimbledon (20 mins by tram), Brighton or the beautiful surrounding countryside of Surrey, Sussex and Kent .
interaction: We will always aim to be there to welcome you to your new home. Nevertheless, prior to your arrival, we will provide you with your unique access code so that you can always let yourself in.  Upon your arrival, you will also find tea, coffee, hot chocolate and continental breakfast items within your welcome pack. Otherwise, please look upon me as your resident concierge (apartment 1).
house_rules: Maximum occupancy is for two adults. However, up to two children (15 years and under) can be accommodated using the sofa bed. Please be considerate to our neighbours and other guests.  WiFi is provided free of charge but we cannot be held responsible for any interruption of service due to problems with the service provider.
host_about: Hi, IÛªm Michael. IÛªm a driving instructor, property developer and keen paraglider (or, I will be when my broken leg recovers from my last outing!). ItÛªs not all about me though: there are four of us (aged 22-54) running the apartments as a small family business. Admittedly, IÛªm not to best with languages, but between us we also speak Bulgarian fluently (two-and-a-half of us), some Russian (one-and-half of us), and some very limited French and German (one of us - but heÛªs happy to give it a go!).

name: Beautiful double room
summary: Cozy bedroom double bedroom for one guest located on a quiet street and is 12 mins train journey to London Bridge
space: The room is spacious and is equipped with all the essentials: a real bed with metal frame and mattress, a built-in wardrobe, chest of drawers (4), mirror and wireless WI-FI.
description: Cozy bedroom double bedroom for one guest located on a quiet street and is 12 mins train journey to London Bridge The room is spacious and is equipped with all the essentials: a real bed with metal frame and mattress, a built-in wardrobe, chest of drawers (4), mirror and wireless WI-FI. Guests will have access to the kitchen,  to the lounge if they want to watch TV or just to relax, to the garden and of course to the bathroom. I love to make my guests welcome  but I do respect their privacy.  I work full-time but I'm happy to provide information and advise on getting around London if needed. South Norwood is a lovely area.  It is peaceful and quiet.  My house is a few minutes walk to the main road where there are also two express supermarkets (Sainsbury and Tesco) as well as a gym and swimming pool nearby.   There are also several restaurants close by including Chineese, Thai, Caribbean, Indian etc. as well as Cafes. It is only a short walk to the Crystal Palace football stadium. There
neighborhood_overview: South Norwood is a lovely area.  It is peaceful and quiet.  My house is a few minutes walk to the main road where there are also two express supermarkets (Sainsbury and Tesco) as well as a gym and swimming pool nearby.   There are also several restaurants close by including Chineese, Thai, Caribbean, Indian etc. as well as Cafes. It is only a short walk to the Crystal Palace football stadium. There are several parks in the area such the South Norwood Lake and South Norwood Country Park.
notes: If travelling from Heathrow Airport - take the X26 from Heathrow Central Bus station straight to Croydon.
transit: Bus stops 2-3 mins walk from my front door.  Norwood Junction train station is 6-10 mins walk (depending on your pace of walking). Fast train from Norwood Junction takes 12 mins to London bridge, 20 mins to Victoria and Charing Cross,  25 mins to Gatwick Airport.   There's also the Number 3 bus which takes a route through Brixton, past Big Ben, Downing Street, Trafalgar Square and up to Oxford Street - a fairly long journey (an hour or so) but one which takes in some of the sights of London. There is a small fee for parking on immediate street but other nearby  streets are free for parking. Croydon Town Centre/shopping centre is about 12 mins by bus or 1 stop on the train.
access: Guests will have access to the kitchen,  to the lounge if they want to watch TV or just to relax, to the garden and of course to the bathroom.
interaction: I love to make my guests welcome  but I do respect their privacy.  I work full-time but I'm happy to provide information and advise on getting around London if needed.
house_rules: 1.  No smoking (only in the garden). 2.  No food in the room. 3.  Treat my home with respect. 4.  Please leave the bathroom and kitchen as clean as you find it. 5.  No shoes inside the house (slippers are available if needed). 6.  No overnight guest.
host_about: I am a friendly, positive person with a good sense of humour.  I enjoy cooking, traveling, reading and exercising.  I actively practice my Christian  faith and love to help others.  I'm new to airbnb but have hosted international students for over a year and  have gained lots of hosting experience. I enjoy  meeting people from different cultures and helping to enhance their experience of London.  I also enjoy having people around to exchange different traditions and cultures, making them feeling at home with a friendly atmosphere.

neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace at 380 feet is one of the highest and most charming London suburbs, only 7 miles from central London, with a village atmosphere and excellent transport links, with great views of London and the Kent and Surrey countryside.  Û¢Take a stroll around Crystal Palace 200 acre park - with a maze, animal farm, the Victorian full-size dinosaur sculptures created in 1854 for the Great Exhibition + the Crystal Palace National Sports Centre with Olympic size swimming pool, squash & tennis courts, and other amenities. Û¢Enjoy the Crystal Palace triangle (consisting of 3 main streets), with its Saturday outdoor food market and the adjacent Haynes Lane indoor collectibles market. (There is also easy access from Crystal Palace to other interesting markets in other parts of London e.g Bermondsey Market, Borough Market, Brixton Market, Columbia Road Flower Market, and Spitalfields Market. Û¢ Take a walk to the nearby Sydenham Woods, where you will momentarily forget that you're in a city and
notes: Perfect place to stay for: Û¢London city-break weekends and holidays ÛÒ for couples/families/friends. Û¢Combination holidays to explore London, and the Kent and Surrey countryside. Û¢Business visitors to the City of London, Silicon Roundabout, and London's west end - who want good value, quiet accommodation, free parking, and easy access by train to the city, in a comfortable environment. Û¢ Visitors attending local events or visiting friends. Û¢ Crystal Palace is on a hill,  so it's a short uphill walk to our house from the railway station, but there are many buses that you can catch up the hill  (one stop)  if you have a heavy bag; or you can take a quick 5 minute taxi to the house from the station.
transit: Û¢7 miles into central London - a short journey by London Overground or train, from Crystal Palace railway station (which is only 7 minutes walk from the house); or by direct buses from Crystal Palace bus station (5 minutes walk from the house). Û¢Direct trains from Crystal Palace : - to London Bridge (about 20 minutes) for St Paul's Cathedral, the Tower of London, Tower Bridge, Shakespeare's Globe Theatre, and the Thames river path. - to London Victoria (26 minutes) for Buckingham Palace, St James' Park, Westminster, and London's famous West End. - to the City of London business district (15 -20 minutes). - to arty Hoxton and cool Shoreditch (25 minutes) & and East Dulwich. - to The Silicon Roundabout / Old Street Roundabout (25 minutes direct train journey). Direct buses to Oxford Street (for shopping), and night buses directly back to Crystal Palace from the theatres and London's late-night scene. Û¢Within easy reach are interesting, fun nearby places to visit - e.g. the Dulwich Pictur
access: Guests will have their own key to the house. Access is through the front door of the house and stairs leading directly up to the top floor. Guests will have exclusive use of the whole top floor of our house and the roof terrace.
interaction: Guests can use their own key and are therefore free to come and go as convenient for them. We live on the ground floor of the house and we will respect your privacy at all times, but it will be our pleasure to assist you with any queries or tips and advice.
house_rules: Smoking is only permitted outside - on the roof terrace. Please remove shoes on the carpeted areas. Please leave the place as clean and tidy as possible. (No cleaning fee charged.)
host_about: I  love travelling  and staying in an airbnb, rather than in a hotel, as I find it more interesting and rewarding. I like to experience life in a city's neighbourhoods and imagine what life would be like as a resident there, and of course I like to be a regular tourist as well.My motto in life is :  Try to enjoy each day  to its fullest, as life is short ! My family and friends matter the most to me, and I love good food. I am fascinated by different cultures, people, dress, music, and the geography of the country. Travel broadens the mind for sure !I have been very lucky to have had the opportunity to travel to many amazing places like Borneo , idyllic islands in the Pacific , game reserves in Africa, and trekking in the Himalayas. I also experienced working abroad when I was younger. Having stayed in so many lovely places, more recently in Airbnb's, it's now my turn to be an Airbnb host !

name: Home away from home
summary: My modern, comfortable and clean one bed terrace house is a perfect "getaway" in London. Quiet with off-road parking, close to parks, buses and a 20 minute stroll from the cafes and bars of the Crystal Palace triangle.
space: My place is a really comfortable cosy little home in a wonderful neighbourhood. I love it and I'm pretty certain you will too. It has everything you need to make your stay a good one, and within easy reach of local shops, cafes and restaurants for everything else.
description: My modern, comfortable and clean one bed terrace house is a perfect "getaway" in London. Quiet with off-road parking, close to parks, buses and a 20 minute stroll from the cafes and bars of the Crystal Palace triangle. My place is a really comfortable cosy little home in a wonderful neighbourhood. I love it and I'm pretty certain you will too. It has everything you need to make your stay a good one, and within easy reach of local shops, cafes and restaurants for everything else. You will likely only see me briefly at the beginning of your stay. You will have my number though so you can get in touch with me at any time! Crystal Palace (and South East London) is full of great and undiscovered parks for quiet strolls, but  also very lively in places and the area has an excellent selection of great cafes, bars and restaurants. The "Triangle" in Crystal Palace (made up of the triangle formed by Westow Hill, Church Road, and Westow Street) is a must-go destination with its varied night life,
neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace (and South East London) is full of great and undiscovered parks for quiet strolls, but  also very lively in places and the area has an excellent selection of great cafes, bars and restaurants. The "Triangle" in Crystal Palace (made up of the triangle formed by Westow Hill, Church Road, and Westow Street) is a must-go destination with its varied night life, antique stores, artisan food and friendly feel. The area around my house is quiet, safe and rather leafy!
notes: I'm very relaxed and want you to feel that my home is your home while you are staying. No pets and no smoking inside though :)
transit: Car: The house has off-road parking. Bus: You can catch regular buses (every five-ten minutes) at the end of the road into Croydon in one direction (with its direct and fast access to Gatwick Airport) and Central London via West Norwood (15min) and Brixton (40min) in the other. Train: 15-20 minutes walk to/from Norwood Junction station (15 minutes train to London Bridge) or Thornton Heath station (15 minutes to Clapham Junction or 20 minutes to London Victoria). 25 minutes walk to/from Crystal Palace station with its London overground/underground links. Uber: Good local coverage and å£5 fares to/from any of the above stations. Check (website hidden) for the full public transport options.
interaction: You will likely only see me briefly at the beginning of your stay. You will have my number though so you can get in touch with me at any time!
house_rules: I'm very relaxed and want you to think of my home as yours while you stay. Please enjoy yourself! No pets and no smoking inside though :)
host_about: Hi!I grew up in New Zealand, though have lived in London for the past 15 years.  I currently work for an international development and humanitarian organisation, and my role focuses on child rights policy including on issues like child labour and child/early marriage.  As such, I travel regularly with my work, but I also enjoy travelling for pleasure when I get the time.In my spare time I am fairly deft with a BBQ and a frisbee - though not at the same time - and I take an interest in international politics, current affairs, literature, cooking, sport (less playing, more watching these days) and being spontaneous when I can. :)I also have a wide range of increasingly international friends and enjoy meeting new people!

neighborhood_overview: Listed in Lonely Planet's 'Greatest, Little-known neighbourhoods', Crystal Palace is a leafy oasis with panoramic views over London, cozy cafes and great eateries.  Here's what Lonely Planet have to say! Crystal Palace, London, England Navigate here by the Eiffel-like radio mast: this lofty southeast spot is worth finding. The namesake palace burned down in 1936 but its legacy park still hosts a maze, a stage and the world's first dinosaur models, controversial in the 1850s and now good to picnic near. Outside the park the area is more contemporary, with gloriously cosy cafes, a world of restaurants and some independent oddments including a jungly reptile shop and sell-everything vintage market. But best is the view: stand atop Westow Hill and the whole city spreads out below. Go by train from Victoria or London Bridge directly to Crystal Palace Station; or join the Green Chain crew and walk from the Thames. Read more: (URL HIDDEN)
transit: The apartment is 15 minutes' walk from the nearest train stations, which will take you to London Bridge or Victoria within 30 minutes. The overground network also offers easy access to East London, and the trendy neighbourhoods of Shoreditch and Hoxton.  Local buses also operate to the station if you don't fancy the walk!
house_rules: No smoking inside the house, but is OK outside on the patio.

neighborhood_overview: *Green Croydon -The Royal Horticultural Society voted Coombe Wood London's best park in 2009. -In the same year, Croydon was also voted the Royal Horticultural Society's 'Greenest large city' in the UK. *Music -Croydon has been at the centre of the development of the dubstep genre, a relatively recent musical development that traces its roots from Jamaican dub music, UK Garage and drum and bass. Artists such as Benga and Skream, who honed their production and DJing skills whilst working at the now defunct Big Apple Records on Surrey Street, along with Norwood's Digital Mystikz, DJ Chef, Timi Korus and Thornton Heath's Plastician, form the core roster of dubstep DJs and producers. Moreover, UK rappers and grime artists Stormzy, Krept and Konan and Section Boyz all hail from or can trace their roots to the London Borough of Croydon. -The town centre was for 30 years home to Europe's largest second-hand record store, Beano's, offering rare vinyl, CDs and books. My husband and niece are wonderful persons who will take good care of you and I am constantly in contact with my guests to see that they have settled in nicely. My husband is a retired mental health nurse. We have 2 daughters who  are both married. I enjoy musicals, concerts, dancing and cooking. I also love travelling and meeting people from different countries. I am patient, understanding and calm. We will make your stay very pleasant and you will have a great time with us.My motto is that I take good care of my guest as I expect the same for me when I am an AIRBNB GUEST.

neighborhood_overview: Croydon is one of the greenest boroughs in London it is also a major shopping destination with two adjacent shopping centres both a very short bus ride from my apartment. South Croydon is a distinct residential suburb of London and Croydon. It is well known for its greenery and tranquillity. There are many parks and woods for walks, cycling or just relaxing with nature. The Coombe Wood is over 5 hectares of woodland about 5 minutes walk away from the flat. It has a great variety of Rhododendrons and Azaleas, a lovely pond, terrace garden, stables and cafe. Two streams, flow into the pond, one of which tumbles over a waterfall. The water contains many interesting water plants and also ornamental fish. If you love plants, there are mixed borders around the Broad Walk, they are at their best from July to September. There are other seasonal plantings around in the terrace garden and there is a winter garden with colorful display of Heaths and Heathers, it also has a rose garden. A variety
notes: AND FINALLY ... I am happy to help you with any information you need to make your visit enjoyable. If you are interested then please let me have some information about who you are, where you are travelling from and the purpose of your visit. All the best, enjoy London!
transit: TRANSPORT South Croydon station is just 7 minutes walk away from my apartment, maybe less - depending on how fast you walk! London Bridge is 17 mins away on the fast train and so is London Victoria. There are two bus stops at the junction of the flat for East and Central Croydon if you fancy a spot of retail therapy. Bars and restaurants are also 10 mins walk away in Croydon's recently zoned restaurant quarter.  For those travelling from abroad Gatwick airport is 15 minutes away by train.
access: GUEST ACCESS As my guest, you have the full privacy of your room, if you are staying long term I will periodically replace your bed linen and make sure your room is clean. You will have access to the living room, bathroom and kitchen. Don't worry, I give full instruction on how to navigate your way through the [maze that is someone else's] kitchen!
interaction: INTERACTION WITH GUESTS I work full time and have other commitments outside of work so I am usually in and out a bit but that does not stop us having some great (albeit short) time of interacting with each other. You will have the time to ask for directions to your desired London destination and ideas of things to do.
house_rules: I do ask guests to help maintain the cleanliness of the apartment by cleaning and tidying up after themselves. There is no smoking policy in the whole apartment block Please do respect my home  No shoes inside, slippers are welcome  Please do not use my address as a correspondence address or for any of your official purposes.  Please don't bring extra overnight guests with you unless agreed during your booking  Thanks in advance for compliance
host_about: I'm a professional myself. I work in real estate in the City and travel to work on the train everyday. I love it in this leafy and picturesque part of Croydon because it provides me with a peaceful and beautiful living while I get quick and easy travel to Central London via the good transport connection in Croydon. It takes the stress out of living in London for me. However, I do like to take full advantage of the buzz of Central London with all the fun and interesting things it has to offer, I enjoy being able to return to my 'South Croydon retreat' after a lovely evening out.If you are interested then please let me have some information about who you are, where you are travelling from and the purpose of your visit.All the best and enjoy London!

neighborhood_overview: Croydon is amazing. You can get away with purchasing a weekly / monthly Travelcard zone 1 to 3 with some top up for return journey on the tram if you trvael through wimbledon - West London. Yes, TRAM. It's the only place in London you get to go on a tram. They are frequent even on sundays and bank holidays.  The high street is bustling with shops like House of fraser, Debenhams, Next, H&M and lots of restaurants and beauty parlors. Acupunture etc. Mitcham golf course is nearby. host_about: We love Airbnb, but we know that it can be very time consuming for property owners to organise, so we do all the hard work for them by managing their place whilst they are awayThis means that for guests staying in one of our Airbnb properties, they will get very professional, local service from genuine Londoners. We have a roster of reliable cleaners, we'll personally meet you at the property and we'll be on call for any local advice or help. We also only accept properties into our portfolio which hit a certain standard, so I'm sure you'll be happy with your stay!Francis and Mark both love travelling and understand the importance of a nice property and welcoming smile when visiting, so we'll do everything possible to make sure you enjoy the property and our city.We can even organise airport transfers, football match or theatre tickets and city tours if you want.We only take bookings through Airbnb, so get in touch and book into one of our fantastic London properties!

summary: A comfortable room in an apartment which has a new bathroom and free wifi. There are excellent transport links to central London and to shopping in Croydon.  It is also a short bus ride away from the cool area of Crystal Palace.
space: Snug double room in purpose-built two-bedroomed flat. Share with  easy-going owner. While the room is for one person, I am happy to consider requests for two people (sharing the bed) who wish to book a short stay, for example over a weekend.  I would ask for an extra å£10 per night (cash) for this. There is a big lounge a big fridge, a modern bathroom with double-head shower and free WiFi.   Parking is available on site. You will have your own cupboard to store food. I will provide you with two sets of bed linen and towels, please feel free to use the washer and the tumble dryer for those and for your clothes. The room comes with a small television with Freeview. The apartment is very near two railway stations: 1. Selhurst (2 minutes walk) 22 minutes to London Victoria  Change at Croydon for services to Brighton and Gatwick Airport. 2. neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is quiet and has a relaxed vibe.  You are away from the hustle and bustle of central London, yet are able to jump on a train and be in the city within minutes.
notes: Please be aware that I am deaf although I can speak and hear well with lipreading skills and hearing aids. For guests arriving at weekdays, I would prefer it if you could arrive after 6pm. However I am happy to be flexible on this but please let me know.
transit: It is VERY easy to get to Central London from our apartment. Croydon (shops and bars) is three minutes on the train, seven minutes on the bus and approx 20 minutes walk. Gatwick airport is the easiest to reach from our place but any London airport is fine.
access: You can use all items in the kitchen (except for the expensive dinner service which is stowed away). There is a cupboard and two shelves in the fridge set aside for your use. The washing machine and tumble dryer are there for you to use, but please bear in mind it is far cheaper to use these after 6pm. Guests can help themselves to tea, instant coffee, sugar and seasonings.  I do not drink milk so please let me know if you would like me to arrange some (no charge) for your arrival. The lounge is large and you are free to share it.  WIFI is absolutely free.
interaction: You are free to do your own thing.  I would be happy to show you around the local area (shops, bus journeys, bars and restaurants) but only if you wish. On some weekends, I will be away from the home but a friend who lives nearby will be available if you need any help.
house_rules: Updated: July 2015 * Make sure that the front door is securely locked when you leave the apartment - please follow my demonstration which I will give when you arrive. * lock all doors and windows when you are away from the property (flat is on ground floor) * always lock the front door when you are in the apartment *  turn the sign on your door to the appropriate position - 'I am in' or 'I am out' (as I do not easily hear if you are in the apartment) * leave a note or contact me if you are going to be away overnight (e.g. at a friend's house in London) * let me know if you need the cleaner (on Wednesdays on alternate weeks) to tidy your room or not * spray the shower with the 'daily shower cleaner' after use - you do not need to wipe the shower. * use the tumble dryer only after 6pm on weekdays.
host_about: I consider myself an easy-going chap and a typical Briton in that I like football, films, comedy and a nice pint of beer.You should note that I am hearing impaired. I can communicate very well with  hearing aids and lip reading.  However, it is difficult for me to hear on the telephone so please send me a text message or email if you need to contact me regarding your arrival time.As a host, I try to make my guests feel almost at home, and I am happy to help with travel or local advice.  On the first day, I am willing to show the guest around the essentials (supermarket, station, late-night store).Household stuff is available for the guest to share - washing powder, tumble dryer, WiFi, etc).I provide all cutlery and crockery and you will have full use of the kitchen. To save you buying your own, you are free to use the salt, pepper, spices etc to help you with your cooking.I go out socially at least once a week and most mornings I will go to the gym before work.  Sometimes friends or family, will visit and they will sleep on a camp bed in the lounge and will not affect the AirBnB guest's arrangements.  If you would like a friend to visit you for a night or two, then that is fine - please see the details page for the small extra cost.I have lived in London since 2000 and would be happy to give you any tips for places to visit. I have travelled across the USA, have visited many destinations in Europe and in 2015 I spent time working in Australia and Hong Kong.

name: Your own detached summer house!
summary: Large private out-building with full access to garden and stylish modern kitchen/living room in the main house.  Close to Crystal Palace's shops and resturants, and in a lovely, quiet area within reach of central London.  What more could you want?
space: Large, Bright, private room in a separate building with access to a lovely, modern house with garden bordering park. In easy reach of the restaurants and bars of Crystal Palace, and the football stadium.
description: Large private out-building with full access to garden and stylish modern kitchen/living room in the main house.  Close to Crystal Palace's shops and resturants, and in a lovely, quiet area within reach of central London.  What more could you want? Large, Bright, private room in a separate building with access to a lovely, modern house with garden bordering park. In easy reach of the restaurants and bars of Crystal Palace, and the football stadium. You'll have full access to the open plan communal areas - the dining room, and living room.  You can use the kitchen when you like, and I'm generally cooking something most nights! I have a wall-sized cinema projector TV, so if you fancy a night in, come with ideas for a film night, and I'll see if I can get your request on lovefilm!  The garden and patio are open to guests and make a great place for a BBQ or a glass of wine (and for those with children, there's a small playground within sight of the house).  The garden backs onto a local woo
neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace is a great area of London.  The pubs, bars and restaurants of "the triangle" are just a few minutes walk away, and cater for all tastes.  We're on the top of one of the biggest hills in London here, so there's a spectacular view of the city, or the surrounding area around every corner.  In addition, there are more local parks and green areas than almost anywhere in London.  The biggest of these is Crystal Palace park - which features a national sports centre, the ruins of the Crystal Palace itself, a community farm, a maze, a boating lake, and the famous victorian dinosaur sculptures. Just down the hill from us (7 minutes on the bus or a 20 minute walk) is the Crystal Palace football stadium, and a little further afield you'll find Dulwich (site of the world's oldest private art gallery), Croydon, Bromley, Sydenham, and Penge.
transit: Bus stops (100 yards from the house) take you straight to Crystal Palace station (7 mins),  Croydon, Brixton (20 mins), and Elephant And Castle (close to London Bridge). Crystal Palace station is on the brand new Overground line into central London, and also has links to London Bridge and Victoria stations.   Norwood Junction station is near the Crystal Palace football stadium, and offers fast trains to London Bridge (17 mins) There's also the Number 3 bus which takes a route through Brixton, past Big Ben, Downing Street, Trafalgar Square and up to Oxford Street - a fairly long journey (an hour or so) but one which takes in some of the sights of London.  The bus leaves every 6 mins or so.
access: You'll have full access to the open plan communal areas - the dining room, and living room.  You can use the kitchen when you like, and I'm generally cooking something most nights! I have a wall-sized cinema projector TV, so if you fancy a night in, come with ideas for a film night, and I'll see if I can get your request on lovefilm!  The garden and patio are open to guests and make a great place for a BBQ or a glass of wine (and for those with children, there's a small playground within sight of the house).  The garden backs onto a local woodland park, so it's regularly visited by squirrels, foxes, woodpeckers and surprisingly, even London's local parrots!   Come and relax.
interaction: I'm a writer and animator, and I work from an office in the garden.  This means I'm usually around to help with anything you need.   I've got two young children, who are sometimes around, and I'm usually cooking something interesting most nights.   I've lived in South East London for over 20 years, so I know my way around the city pretty well, and I'd be happy to answer any questions you've got, and help in any way I can during your stay.
house_rules: Please do not leave dead bodies in the cupboard.
host_about: I'm an animator and writer of children's books, so I work from an office in the garden, and I'm around most of the time.  I've been living in South East London for 20 years now, and have a fairly good idea of my way around the city.  I'm fairly sociable, and I have two children so I'm aware of what's needed if you are travelling with kids.  I look forward to meeting you.

neighborhood_overview: The residential neighborhood is very quiet and well located in terms of getting into London and the South East with access to  good running and walking routes. The hustle and bustle of Croydon and London are not far away. There are some local shops 200m away - mini supermarket, post office/newsagents, off license, pharmacy and dry cleaners. Restaurants, pubs and bars can be found within 1 mile at either South Croydon or Selsdon. At the end of the road there are 33 hectares/83 acres of the Croham Hurst woodlands to explore - it is a site of special scientific interest (SSSI)
transit: We are located 15 minutes walk from the nearest railway station, Sanderstead, with direct trains to Central London in 25 minutes. Brighton and Gatwick are easily reached by train. Wimbledon can be accessed by tram - the nearest tram stop is about 1.5 miles away.There is a bus service at the end of the road - 3 minutes walk away. For drivers we are about 7 miles/15 minutes from the M25 London orbital motorway with easy access to the Kent and Surrey countryside and the south coast of England.
