neighborhood_overview: Tulsi is within walking distance to local convenience stores and shopping centres as well as a wide range of restaurants.  Croydon itself has something for everyone: from a range of big-name and bespoke shops, entertainment complexes, restaurants, pubs and nightclubs to parks, open spaces and various heritage sites. CroydonÛªs Whitgift and Centrale shopping centres are two of the largest outside of Central London.
transit: East Croydon station is 10 minutes walking distance from the property. By train, both London Bridge and London Victoria can be reached in less than 17 minutes from East Croydon Rail Station. Canary Wharf is only a 45 minute journey and Brighton Seaside can be reached in just under an hour. Trains are exceptionally frequent and run 24 hours a day. Wimbledon Central station takes just 20 minutes by tram and has excellent Train and Underground links and provides easy access to the Wimbledon lawn tennis club. There is also a direct train between East Croydon and Gatwick airport which takes only 20 minutes.
access: Private double studio with en-suite bathroom and mini Kitchen. Free Wi-Fi. Daily and weekly cleaning service. Communal washing maching and drying facilities.

name: Wow! London Bridge in 12 minutes!
summary: Enjoy excellent transport to London Bridge from Norwood Junction station, railway trains mostly take 12 minutes! Also on the London Overground, on any subway map. Gatwick's our closest airport: 20 min train, 10 min bus and 2 min walk from the bus!
space: LOCATION Our house is based in the suburbs of London, in South Norwood, which is in the London Borough of Croydon, 16km / 10 miles by road from London Bridge in the centre. We enjoy excellent day-time transport links to central London from Norwood Junction Station (zone 4), which is 0.8km / 0.5 miles away. Most of the railway trains to London Bridge from here take 12 minutes - you can use them with an Oyster card or Travelcard along with all other kinds of London transport for just å£8.90 all day. These are very frequent express trains (5 to 7 trains per hour) from the south of England which make a last stop here before their final destination at London Bridge. Our local station is also on the London Overground network - similar to the tube (4 trains per hour) and appears on all London Underground maps (for more details on transport, see below). Gatwick is our closest airport 22 miles away (c.20 minutes by train from East Croydon, then 10 minutes bus or tram ride here, or 4 minutes on a

neighborhood_overview: LOCAL AREA We live on a very quiet road which is ideal for getting a good night's sleep! The house is only 2 mins walk from the local swimming pool and gym, a local Tesco supermarket and other shops, GP surgeries and the beautiful ÛÏCountry ParkÛ nature reserve. A list of local restaurants is in the guest folder - we can help you find them. There are also many local take-away hot cooked food vendors within 2 to 3 minutes walk (see my guidebook).
notes: FREE PARKING! Plenty of free, non-restricted street parking is available right outside the house. Parking is therefore free 24 hours a day, 7 days a week! You will not find this in the majority of London. (Please do not park in the disabled bay further down the road, which is for a disabled neighbour).  SECURITY All areas of the house have smoke / fire detectors and extinguishers. Each one can turn on all the others, making a massive loud noise everywhere, so you will be very safe! The keys use EVVA high security locks which are copy-protected and the house can be alarmed at night. We are fully insured for public liability up to å£2 million. Beware of other listings that do not offer the same level of (or any) security and insurance.
transit: TRANSPORT We enjoy excellent day-time transport links to central London from Norwood Junction within c.10 minutes walk. A zone 1 to 6, one day Travelcard or Oyster costs just å£(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) before 9:30am Mon-Fri; children aged 11 - 15 are å£3.60 with an adult, under 11s are free with an adult) and can be used unlimited on the London Underground (tubes), National Rail trains, the London Overground (like tubes), buses and trams, all day. At Norwood Junction, choose from:  *National Rail:  Most trains go to London Bridge. Fast / express trains take 12 minutes. Day times there are between 5 to 7 fast trains per hour + 2 slow trains per hour (last train back 00:36 Mon-Sat).  (NB. Between 20th December 2014 to 4 January 2015 there will be no 12 minute train services from Norwood Junction to London Bridge due to engineering works, but you can still take the London Overground to Canada Water or get to London Victoria (near Buckingham Palace) via East Croydon.)  There are also trains fro
access: PRIVATE BATHROOM You will have access to your own, large, adjacent bathroom on the first floor, with shower over bath, where a washing machine is also available for use for a small fee. This private bathroom is reserved just for our guests and is on the same floor as your bedroom. We also have our own second bathroom with shower, so you don't need to share with us. We only have a child who needs a bath. We will make sure our child has a bath when you are out, so this will not affect your stay.  BREAKFAST Breakfast is optional and is charged at only å£2 each for adults (å£1 for children under 10 year old), which is payable when you check-out. It includes cereals with milk (cornflakes, muesli or coco pops), toast (on brown bread), a selection of spreads including four kinds of jam (strawberry, raspberry, apricot, orange marmalade), lemon curd, butter and margarine, peanut butter and chocolate spread, English breakfast tea, fresh and instant coffee, hot chocolate, orange juice and fruit (us
interaction: ABOUT US We are husband and wife, both professionals; we live in the house and keep the place clean and tidy. We have two children and also a cat, Ronnie, who is confined to the ground floor and is not able to get upstairs. There are no other B&B guests staying in the house to share with, although we may have other members of our family staying with us sometimes (using our bathroom, not yours). This is a friendly and homely household. We're looking for guests that are non-smoking (or smoke outside), equally tidy, easy going and considerate. We are happy to help you on your travels and able to give you lots of advice about visiting London and how to get around. We often help people over breakfast - an ideal time to chat!
house_rules: Û¢ I will need to take a photo (or you can give me a photocopy) of your identification (passport or EU driver's licence), especially if you havenÛªt confirmed your identity on Airbnb and you want a key.  Û¢ When a key is provided, there is a key deposit payable upon arrival of å£50 GBP (65 Euros; or $85 US Dollars), which will be refunded to you upon return of the key. The keys and lock are an expensive, high security type by EVVA (copy-protected) and my household needs 5 keys. If you lose it, I have to replace it all. This deposit is separate to Airbnb's deposit which is for any damages (e.g. broken cup, ruined towel, etc).  Û¢ When a key has been provided, there is no curfew - you may come and go whenever you want. If a key is not provided, we would ask you to be back here by midnight.  Û¢ You must lock the front door when arriving late at night or if you are the last to leave in the morning. I will show you how to do this. You must also lock your windows whenever you leave the property. L
host_about: I'm Philip, a married man with a teenage son and baby daughter. I play the violin and love to sing with my wife Shannon, in the BBC Symphony Chorus where we met. I also love to watch films and TV shows, especially documentaries and science fiction. My wife is into American soaps, romantic comedies and cooking programmes. We both love to watch Dallas, Game of Thrones, Mad Men and Dragons Den. My wife works in a professional services company; I am a supply teacher and work part-time. We both love to travel, my wife is Australian, so we have been there. Also, New York, Hong Kong, Langkawi and Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia), Paris, Italy, Czech Republic are amongst our favourite places. In New York we saw the show "Chicago", which we loved; we also went to the Met Opera to see Otello. I'm a pleasant, friendly sort of person who will greet you with a smile, as is my wife. My favourite quotes: "Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards." Johann Wolfgang von Goethe"Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." Albert Einstein

neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace occupies a privileged position in the topography of London ÛÒ one of the highest points in the city. The views, consequently, are amazing and the streets steep. The hub of the community is the central triangle, lined with pubs, restaurants like Joanna's and Exhibitions Rooms, and independent shops. Vintage is big here and the area is best on a Sunday morning, when junk shops and stalls spill out on to the pavements of Church Road. The glass palace that gave the area its name burnt down back in 1936 but the accompanying park is still a local asset with its famous dinosaurs, National Sports Centre and if football is your thing, we are walking distance to Selhurst Park, home to premiership team Crystal Palace

neighborhood_overview: Croydon has a major advantage in its location. It is exactly in the middle between Gatwick Airport and Central areas of London. The Property can be found only a short walk from both East Croydon (0.5miles) and West Croydon (0.3miles) station. The house is located in the heart of central Croydon, right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the town, moments from all the trendy pubs, bars and restaurants as well as the large shopping district Croydon has to offer. Croydon has a great nightlife, including the popular 'Tiger Tiger' Club. There is a daily street market selling local fresh produce only a stones throw away. Mentioned in the Doomsday Book of 1085, Croydon is a historical town with attractions such as Grade II listed buildings like Addington Palace, as well as the museum of Croydon, Fairfield Halls, Croydon Clock Tower, Ashcroft Theatre, Lloyd Park. Nearby are great leisure facilities for the whole family to enjoy, such as 'KidSpace'  a huge indoor play area, plus a swimmin

Continuous service 24 hours a day, running to and from Gatwick station through East Croydon into London!! There are also connections to Blackfriars, St Pancras, Farringdon, Clapham Junction as well as Kensington Olympia, running at regular intervals throughout the day. transit: Croydon has superb transport links. East Croydon station is one of the UKÛªs busiest rail interchanges, where the journey time to London Bridge can be as little as 13 minutes. To London Victoria 15 minutes. There are also services from East Croydon to Clapham Junction, Brighton, St Pancras International, Luton, Gatwick Airport, Bedford, Eastbourne, Southampton and Portsmouth. The Croydon Tramlink reaches destinations as far afield as Wimbledon and Beckenham.  The main town centre is within walking distance. West Croydon Station is only 7-9 minutes walk, from there you can go directly to London Victoria or London Bridge, alternatively you can use the tram to get to East Croydon (only 3-5 minutes tram journey) for more transport options. Brighton on the south coast is around 30 minutes by (website hidden) Gatwick airport is only 15 minutes! Excellent bus network just outside the building. A day travel card will cover all transportation cost. All little details will be provided on arrival.
access: The entire flat will be yours. So two double bedrooms and one single bedroom.  Master bedroom has its own en suite bathroom shower. Cleaning appliances, toilet rolls & towels will be provided and clean bedding.Please note that there will be two bath towels and two face towels and one spare towel if you need more then you will need to bring your own.   There will be wardrobe space available in each room to hang your clothes up. Also there will be access to secure underground parking for one car.
interaction: Home manual of the apartment will be sent before arrival  for familiarity.  I am only a short 10 minute drive away should you have any problems and I am always accessible by phone, texts and e-mails.

Provided towels is for personal body use only, and not to be used to clean or mop flooring/surfaces or be left on floor of bathroom.

name: CENTRAL, HOMELY..CRYSTAL PALACE
summary: Just a few minutes walk from the bustling Crystal Palace triangle, where there are a plethora of lovely bars, cafes and restaurants, this one bedroom flat is central, spacious, bright and homely.
space: This is a lovely quiet yet well located flat, close to the heart of Crystal Palace. The flat itself is airy and safe with a stunning outlook of big trees, mowed lawns and huge Victorian mansions across the road! It's a spacious one bedroom flat and would be very comfortable for a couple. The kitchen is brand new. My neighbours are very nice and this is a very well maintained private apartment block. Overal it's a very homely, centrally located, yet quiet, place to stay with excellent links into London.
description: Just a few minutes walk from the bustling Crystal Palace triangle, where there are a plethora of lovely bars, cafes and restaurants, this one bedroom flat is central, spacious, bright and homely.  This is a lovely quiet yet well located flat, close to the heart of Crystal Palace. The flat itself is airy and safe with a stunning outlook of big trees, mowed lawns and huge Victorian mansions across the road! It's a spacious one bedroom flat and would be very comfortable for a couple. The kitchen is brand new. My neighbours are very nice and this is a very well maintained private apartment block. Overal it's a very homely, centrally located, yet quiet, place to stay with excellent links into London. All usual kitchen facilities, double glazing and excellent new electric heaters for colder nights, although the flat is usually a very comfortable temperature because of great insulation. I would love to meet and greet the guests and give tips about the area, along with recommendations on best
neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace has a lovely sense of community, it's a London village with fabulous creative undertones. There are many lovely antique/vintages places to look around, gorgeous cafes, every cuisine eatery you could hope for. Even Crystal Palace station is even a historical marvel! The park, complete with lakes, a maze, a national sports centre, is also a lovely place to walk around.
notes: You are welcome to park in the visitors area behind the flat.
transit: Crystal Palace has very good links to many Central London entry points. Trains from Crystal Palace go to London Victoria in 25 mins, London Bridge in 20 mins, Shoreditch on the east london line in 25 mins. Buses take 15 minutes to bustling Brixton (pick up Victoria line from) and there are many buses taking you into London. There is a bus called the 249 which stops outside the flat and takes you into Clapham and to and from Crystal Palace station, (The walk is only 15 mins though and is really nice!)
access: All usual kitchen facilities, double glazing and excellent new electric heaters for colder nights, although the flat is usually a very comfortable temperature because of great insulation.
interaction: I would love to meet and greet the guests and give tips about the area, along with recommendations on best places to eat etc. If I am not around, will ensure someone else will do the same on my behalf.
house_rules: The only thing I ask is that guests consider my neighbours. It's a quiet block which I really like - and everyone is asked not to make noise after 11pm :-). Also this is a no smoking flat.
host_about: Hi there, I'm an easy going, music loving, sociable person with a lust for travel and meeting new people. Pleased to meet you!

name: Addington Palace Benson Retreat
summary: Set within Surrey Countryside and nestling beside a Historic Grade II *listed Addington Palace with Spa, Gym and Golf on site is this 1 bedroom Bungalow.
space: This charming bungalow, perfect for 2-4 guests sits in the shadow of Addington Palace, the historic grade II* listed Mansion that proudly rests in 163 acres of golf course and parklands. The Palace, upon which lies the site that Henry VIII had a hunted lodge for reputed clandestine meetings with Anne Boleyn was also home to no fewer than six Archbishops of Canterbury who used this opulent retreat as their somewhat grandiose summer residence between 1805 and 1896. In more recent times the Palace now offers luxurious facilities for weddings and private events and also offers an exclusive Country Club. Being affiliated within the Addington Palace Estate, residents are welcome to use the health and fitness facilities in this historic Palladian Mansion as well as booking pamper days along with spa and beauty treatmentsÛ_for more active pursuits, being set within two golf courses, you are treated to two stunning courses literally on your doorstep! This listed Lodge, neighbours Sumner Cottage

Easy going and laid back, it has been great to meet new people through Airbnb. Think I am more of city boy at heart but one of the most memorable holidays was in Tenerife and visiting the top of Mt Teide there - so desolate and above the clouds.Look forward to meeting you soon!

transit: It's quite easy to commute our place as there are London busses plying right near the house. There are 2 train stations in town, (a short walk/drive/bus ride from our house) where there are regular, direct trains to the main terminals of London Victoria station and London Bridge. Journey time is usually 30 minutes. Also conveniently, we're fairly close to Gatwick airport and you can get a direct train from the airport to our station, Coulsdon South. Journey time is just about 20 mins.

host_about: Positive, passionate, people-friendly, open-minded, spiritual, musical. As a host: My brother, Andy, and I co-own our house. We're both working professionals, love music, running and have active social lives. We like to keep a clean n tidy house and count ourselves blessed to be home owners at our age, (with the way things are these days). As a guest:My style of travel is to enjoy the people, the culture, arts and the history of a place more than the just the 'party spots'. I'm more the immersion type than the 'tourist' type. Favorite travel destinations include Spain, Ireland, Canada, India, Amsterdam & Scotland! It's amazing to connect with fellow travellers on the road of life who you never imagined you'd meet!Finalmente: Estoy muy feliz de decir que estoy aprendiendo EspaÌ±ol, para 1 aÌ±o y me gusta mucho!! Si tu habla espaÌ±ol entonces estarÌ© muy feliz de practicar hablar contigo.Me gusta toque la guitarra y cantare con mis amigos. :)Having friends from all over the world is always great fun, especially when we use the most universal language in the world: music!

name: Modern, Fresh 4 BD incl Loft room
summary: Our house is perfectly located for ALL!  For families, we are within 5 mins walk of 2 great parks with playgrounds.  For friends who want bars & restaurants, Crystal Palace is just 10 mins walk away.  And easy transport connections into London!
space: Charming double bedroom situated in the loft, with en-suite double shower with sink & WC.  2 x single rooms on floor below with newly fitted bathroom with large bath and overhead shower.  Downstairs is open-plan and offers great social living space.  Very bright, light spaces throughout.
description: Our house is perfectly located for ALL!  For families, we are within 5 mins walk of 2 great parks with playgrounds.  For friends who want bars & restaurants, Crystal Palace is just 10 mins walk away.  And easy transport connections into London! Charming double bedroom situated in the loft, with en-suite double shower with sink & WC.  2 x single rooms on floor below with newly fitted bathroom with large bath and overhead shower.  Downstairs is open-plan and offers great social living space.  Very bright, light spaces throughout. You will have access to everything in the house except the office and the garage.   We won't be present at the time of your stay so you can treat the house as if it is your own.  We will be around beforehand to give you any advice you need prior to your stay. I LOVE this area because it's so GREEEEEN! There are so many places where you can take a walk - on the common, Norwood Park, Crystal Palace park, Dulwich Park, Dulwich Woods, and all within easy reach.  So
neighborhood_overview: I LOVE this area because it's so GREEEEEN! There are so many places where you can take a walk - on the common, Norwood Park, Crystal Palace park, Dulwich Park, Dulwich Woods, and all within easy reach.  So for picnics and for enjoying outdoors, it's the perfect area.  Also, if you want to enjoy good food, Crystal Palace has that too!  In fact within a 2 mile radius there are too many places to try out in a fortnight's holiday.  And if you just need a comfortable base to enjoy London, the transport connections are easy.
notes: We will ensure that there's room in the wardrobes so that you can hang up your clothes.
transit: The 450 bus is situated just round the corner and can take you to great shopping in Croydon (just 20 mins away) - every shop you could want!  This bus also can take you into Crystal Palace if you don't feel like walking.  Crystal Palace has a Sainsbury's and offers unique bars, pubs and restaurants for everyone's taste.  The park is massive and offers playground, dinosaurs (!), events, and great views.  The nearby Gipsy Hill train station takes you to London Bridge (20 mins) with the infamous Shard and great Borough market, and also takes you to central Victoria train station.
access: You will have access to everything in the house except the office and the garage.
interaction: We won't be present at the time of your stay so you can treat the house as if it is your own.  We will be around beforehand to give you any advice you need prior to your stay.
house_rules: Please treat the home as it is your own.  Everything is freshly decorated so I'd appreciate it if you could keep sticky young fingers clean! We have a cat, and although she's quite aloof it would be great if you could feed her whilst we're away.  She has one strange habit....she likes to drink water out of the kitchen tap! No smoking please.
host_about: I'm a busy Mum of two!  Love to eat good food.  Not the greatest cook, but try my best to produce lots of varied meals.  A favourite evening out would start with simple but tasty food, in a gastro-pub type place, with several close friends around me.  Something that I can easily get, close to where I live.  Very into keeping fit, so have done many runs round my local common, on my own and with my daughter.  Part-time chauffeur for my son who is heavily into his tennis.

summary: Stunning Victorian cottage on very quiet lane, in the heart of Crystal Palace! Perfect for family get away.Very close to all amenities including supermarket, bars, pubs, shops, restaurants, park and train station. Make yourself at home, we look forward to welcoming you!
space: Beautiful Victorian terraced house with a country cottage feel including open log fire, courtyard garden and a cat called Oscar! Will comfortably fit 4-6 guests - 2 double bedrooms (one in the loft - access via a ladder) and a large nursery. The nursery can either be used as a babies room or a double mattress can be set up on the floor to accommodate 2 extra people - there is an extra charge per person for this.
description: Stunning Victorian cottage on very quiet lane, in the heart of Crystal Palace! Perfect for family get away.Very close to all amenities including supermarket, bars, pubs, shops, restaurants, park and train station. Make yourself at home, we look forward to welcoming you! The nursery can either be used as a babies room or a double mattress can be set up on the floor to accommodate 2 extra people - there is an extra charge per person for this. Guests have access to the entire house and can make themselves at home. We will meet to give you keys to the house but we will not be present. Our cat Oscar will be there and will need Breakfast and dinner but he is very low maintenance as he is outside a lot of the time. Crystal Palace has a village-like feel t
neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace has a village-like feel to it, with a number of antique shops, boutiques and quirky markets to wander around. We are seconds from the main Triangle of amenities -supermarket etc...  There is a lot to explore and there is an abundance of history, as it used to be home to The Great Exhibition, so the park is fun to visit with a maze, farm and great walks. The national sport centre is also based here within the park where you can gym, swim, play tennis and participate in a number of other sports.  There are some great cafes and pubs on offer in Crystal Palace too- everything is right on your doorstep. We can provide you with more information on places to visit when you arrive.
notes: This is our home and so the wardrobes, drawers and cupboards will have our belongings in them- please respect our privacy and treat the house like you would your own home. You are more than welcome to use anything in the kitchen and dining room cupboards - cooking equipment, crockery, etc.  Please note - bathroom is downstairs which is typical of houses of this age. Our cat Oscar will be here - we would very much appreciate it if you could feed him whilst you are staying in our home.
transit: It is a 10 minute walk from two train stations (Gipsy Hill and Crystal Palace) with direct trains to Victoria and London Bridge Approx 22mins and The East London Line which will take you to Shoreditch and other places to see in North London.  Only a 45 minute drive to Gatwick Airport.
access: Guests have access to the entire house and can make themselves at home.
interaction: We will meet to give you keys to the house but we will not be present. Our cat Oscar will be there and will need Breakfast and dinner but he is very low maintenance as he is outside a lot of the time.
house_rules: No smoking indoors but you are welcome to smoke in the garden. Please respect our home and leave the house as you found it. Any breakages must be paid for.
host_about: My name is Katie, I am 30 years old, originally from the countryside in Essex and have been living in London for 7 years.I live in Crystal Palace with my husband, James and our cat Oscar.I work for a music company organising events and enjoy walking, running and yoga. James is a fitness fanatic and often competes in triathlons and Ironman competitions (crazy!).We will do our very best to make your stay as comfortable and as enjoyable as possible.

neighborhood_overview: Croydon town center is a fifteen minute walk or short bus hop away and the area is very well served by public transport.  The iconic Whitgift shopping center has 140 retailers under one roof, is open seven days a week and central Croydon has an abundance of restaurants and bars.  There are convenience stores and super-markets within a few minutes walk.  Croydon has the largest population of all the Boroughs in London, and with Croydon Town acting as the heart of the borough; it could almost be a city in itself.  The area has always been a leader in financial, business and cultural sectors and is considered to be very well balanced with great living and working opportunities mixed with a bustling town center and many green open areas. It also has a great alternative/arts scene, making living or staying in Croydon an increasingly attractive choice for anyone not wanting to pay higher London prices. The Borough of Croydon formed in 1965 and the name derives from Saxon times, meaning ÛÏvall
notes: Please note that as of June 2015 this apartment was totally renovated and re-modeled. Both Iain and I are very keen travelers and have experienced all sorts of levels of accommodation in other countries, with that in mind our goal here is to try and provide quality, self contained accommodation with a high level of privacy and independence.   If you have any concerns or difficulties whilst at the apartment please contact us immediately so we can assist or rectify.  And please if you have enjoyed your time staying at our apartment, leave a nice review :-))
transit: East Croydon Station is just a 5 minute walk away. It is a major transport hub for trains buses and trams. neighborhood_overview: In a friendly residential area with local supermarkets just a few minutes walk. There are also country parks nearby for those who like walking.
notes: The owners have house cats that you may meet in the hallways. We just like to mention this in case potential guests are allergic.
transit: The local supermarket is only a few minutes walk away, and is open until 11pm. There are other shops, such as a chemist, off-licence and fast food takeaways along the same high street. The railway station is a five minute walk away; from there you can get to London Bridge in about ten minutes, where there are underground connections to pretty much everywhere else in London. There are also trams to Wimbledon, and buses to Croydon town centre, which has two very large shopping precincts. Free parking is available 20 metres away, parking outside the house is payable by a meter. Gatwick Airport is a 20 minute train journey to East Croydon, then one train stop, a five minute walk and you are at the studio. Heathrow Airport takes about 1h and 30minutes on public transport. Stansted Airport is in Essex so takes about 1hr and 45minutes on public transport. All directions and advice will be sent to booking guests.

There are two bathrooms just outside the studios; they are cleaned daily. One has a shower cubicle, toilet and sink. The second has a combined bath and shower, toilet and sink.
interaction: The owners are friendly and accommodating. They live in their own self-contained section of the house, but are always there if you need anything.

It's only a quick train journey to trendy Shoreditch, Dalston and Hoxton - which is currently the trendiest part of London - well club-goers and after-work drinkers seem to think so.
notes: Free Parking: Plenty of free, non-restricted street parking is available right outside the apartment 24/7. You will not find this in the majority of London. For late check-in after 10PM, a å£30 fee must be in cash upon arrival.
transit: The apartment is located in the beautiful suburbs of south London.  Norwood Junction rail and London overground Station is just a 8 minute walk away with regular connections to central London. High speed transport links into London Bridge & London Victoria from Norwood Junction station (zone 4), a 12 minute train journey to be exact. The station is also located on the London Overground line (orange line on the Tube map), taking you into the heart of trendy Shoreditch, Dalston and Highbury. You can use a contactless payment card, Oyster card or Travelcard to get around London from Norwood Junction or our other neighbouring train station; Crystal Palace.  The station is also serviced by National rail and London Overground. Gatwick's our closest airport; only 20 minutes by train. We can also be reached by public transport from all other UK and London airports.

name: Little Venice - Garden Studio
summary: Our studio is close to Crystal Palace, West Norwood, Streatham and Gipsy Hill. You'll love it because of the quiet location yet within easy access of London and the fact that it is fully independent from the main house with private entrance. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (2 plus child under 12 yrs old). Lovely bright and beautifully presented studio 'summer' house with private entrance and use of patio area with tables, chairs and chiminea.
space: Guests will have access to the whole 18 sq metre (198 sq ft) studio room. There is a well-appointed kitchen with kettle, microwave and 2 hob Baby Belling with oven. There is also a fridge and plenty of cooking implements and utensils. We can also provide you with an iron, ironing board and hair dryer. There is a separate bathroom with shower, sink and toilet. There is a Day bed which has a pull out (on wheels) section to convert it to a double bed. We have a single camp bed for a child under 12 yrs and a cot available for a smaller child. We can also provide a high chair. On sunny days, you can wake up and walk straight out to the top of the steps, to be met with a surprisingly peaceful vista, all the way out to the South Downs. You also have use of a paved patio area with table, chairs and chiminea.

neighborhood_overview: Croydon is a mixture of old and new. Back in the 60's it was dubbed the City of the Future, fortunately people's ideas in what their city should look like have since changed.  As such Croydon has seen a huge revival in the last couple of years with many of the 60's built concrete towers being pulled down and replaced by shiny new glass skyscrapers and ultra modern buildings. Croydon town centre consists of 2 large shopping centres/malls and an impressive array of shops, restaurants, bars and clubs. Everything you need is within walking distance and you will find there is a great choice on offer. Opening in Summer 2016, Croydon will be the home of the largest Boxpark in London (see Shoreditch Boxpark) with hundreds of local establishments offering food, drink and entertainment, this is just the first phase of a huge redevelopment taking place next to East Croydon Station. Speaking of Shoreditch, which is now a hugely popular area of London and to give you a better idea, Croydon is where
notes: Please remember to bring your own toiletries. While we try to provide power adaptors for all guests these are rarely returned. Please try to bring your own in case we do not have any more left during your stay.
transit: We are located very close to the Croydon Town Centre (5-10 minutes on foot) so everything you may need is all within walking distance. To get into Central London couldn't be easier from East Croydon Station (just 5 minutes away). Trains to London Victoria, Waterloo, London Bridge and more are available as often as every 5-7 minutes. You can always get back to East Croydon as there is a night time service of 1 train/hour from London Victoria and London Bridge. East Croydon also connect to the South East for Gatwick Airport, Brighton & Hove, Portsmouth and many more.
access: You will have access to the entire property, we do not operate shared accommodation.
interaction: We are always available and happy to help, please do not hesitate to get in touch at any point before, during and after your stay. We mean it!
house_rules: Please be respectful of other guests and neighbours by keep noise to a minimum. Please do not smoke inside the property. No overnight visitors or undeclared guests. No parties. No abusive behaviour or language towards our staff members, guests or neighbours.  No filming without our permission and no soliciting.
host_about: Hello, I am Darie Nani and I am the managing director of The Hotel Alternative Ltd. Besides my business which I have built from the ground up with my brother, Michael,  my main interests are food, films, music and travelling. I also have 2 dogs, both Dobermans which both my girlfriend and I consider our kids!All our properties are maintained by our team, we have dedicated cleaners, professionally cleaned linen and towels and the same level of service you would expect from a hotel. While we are unable to provide food we do provide everything you need to cook yourself. Our moto is to provide Your Home Away From Home!Our portfolio of properties includes Studios, 1 and 2 bedroom apartments as well as a collection of town houses with either 3 or 6 bedrooms each. We are excited to join Airbnb and have added a small selection of properties to see how they are received on this community centric platform. We hope you like what we have to offer and that we can welcome you to London very soon!Besides renting we are also happy to help with all aspects of your trip, whether you need help with airport transfers, restaurant or show bookings or just want some tips on what to do while in London we are always on hand to assist.

summary: A stunning two double bedroom apartment located moments from East Croydon station. This apartment features:-  spacious open plan lounge/kitchen, 2 bathrooms, wooden floor throughout, underfloor heating concierge service & security entry call system.
space: This landmark development was completed in 2009, and features striking modern design utilising large glass areas to provide an abundance of natural light within each apartment. These contemporary serviced apartments are located in the centre of Croydon. A short walk from Croydon`s exceptional transport links into central London. The apartments were planned to provide larger than average living areas, with high ceilings, and floor to ceiling windows, giving a feeling of light and space in each room. Each apartment comprises two great size double bedrooms, two fully tiled bathrooms (one en-suite to the master), a fully fitted open plan kitchen, with all appliances discretely hidden behind modern fitted units, and a roomy lounge with separate dining area, allowing you ample space to live and relax in complete privacy. Each apartment is fully furnished to the highest executive standard.

neighborhood_overview: The block itself is very popular with local professionals, international guests who are here for short stay and ex-pat workers. The apartments is situated next to Croydon Park Hotel with its leisure facilities (gym, swimming etc), in a safer neighborhood, opposite a park (jogging, tennis court and kids play area) and close to Southend (the food street) with English, Indian, Mediterranean (Spanish, Italian and Greek),  Lebanese, Persian and numerous fast food joints. Well served by mini supermarkets within walking distance (Sainsburys: 3 minutes, Waitrose: 5 mins, Tesco 10 minutes, St Clara Pharmacy: 6 minutes), Croydon Library (one of the largest in South London: 5 minutes) and Fairfield Halls (theatre, musicals) within 3 mins walk.  The area is fairly popular with professionals who work in the City of London (Finance, Banking, Insurance) and out of town occupiers that require a 'hop' into London.
notes: Weekly cleaning service to common parts (usually Tuesdays), lifts may be out for 5 mins for the duration of cleaning.

interaction: Interaction is really led by the guest. Some guests like to hang out in the room and do their own thing. Other guests like to chat and a have a cup of tea together. I've lived in the area for 5 years and am happy to give advice abut the local area and London.
house_rules: House rules Breakfast is from 7am to 9am Guests will be given a key to their room, but not to the front door. Guests are asked to return by 11pm unless a later time is arranged in advance. Guests are asked to keep their rooms tidy and to take off their shoes in the  entrance hall. There is no smoking.alcohol and ham/pork meat allowed in the house. Guests are asked to keep any noise to a minimum after 10.30pm and switch off the television before going to sleep. The room must be left neat and tidy on leaving.

neighborhood_overview: Croydon is a mixture of old and new. Back in the 60's it was dubbed the City of the Future, fortunately people's ideas in what their city should look like have since changed.  As such Croydon has seen a huge revival in the last couple of years with many of the 60's built concrete towers being pulled down and replaced by shiny new glass skyscrapers and ultra modern buildings. Croydon town centre consists of 2 large shopping centres/malls and an impressive array of shops, restaurants, bars and clubs. Everything you need is within walking distance and you will find there is a great choice on offer. Opening in Summer 2016, Croydon will be the home of the largest Boxpark in London (see Shoreditch Boxpark) with hundreds of local establishments offering food, drink and entertainment, this is just the first phase of a huge redevelopment taking place next to East Croydon Station. Speaking of Shoreditch, which is now a hugely popular area of London and to give you a better idea, Croydon is where
notes: Please remember to bring your own toiletries. While we try to provide power adaptors for all guests these are rarely returned. Please try to bring your own in case we do not have any more left during your stay.
transit: We are located very close to the Croydon Town Centre (5-10 minutes on foot) so everything you may need is all within walking distance. To get into Central London couldn't be easier from East Croydon Station (just 5 minutes away). Trains to London Victoria, Waterloo, London Bridge and more are available as often as every 5-7 minutes. You can always get back to East Croydon as there is a night time service of 1 train/hour from London Victoria and London Bridge. East Croydon also connect to the South East for Gatwick Airport, Brighton & Hove, Portsmouth and many more. While we have some limited parking, this is offered on a first come first serve basis only, please be aware that rental of the property does not mean you are guaranteed a free parking space. If its available you are welcome to use it free of charge, if it isn't then a large 24hour NCP car park is just 1 minute's walk away, priced at å£12/day.
access: You will have access to the entire property, we do not operate shared accommodation.
interaction: We are always available and happy to help, please do not hesitate to get in touch at any point before, during and after your stay. We mean it!
house_rules: Please be respectful of other guests and neighbours by keep noise to a minimum. Please do not smoke inside the property. No overnight visitors or undeclared guests. No parties. No abusive behaviour or language towards our staff members, guests or neighbours.  No filming without our permission and no soliciting.
host_about: Hello, I am Darie Nani and I am the managing director of The Hotel Alternative Ltd. Besides my business which I have built from the ground up with my brother, Michael,  my main interests are food, films, music and travelling. I also have 2 dogs, both Dobermans which both my girlfriend and I consider our kids!All our properties are maintained by our team, we have dedicated cleaners, professionally cleaned linen and towels and the same level of service you would expect from a hotel. While we are unable to provide food we do provide everything you need to cook yourself. Our moto is to provide Your Home Away From Home!Our portfolio of properties includes Studios, 1 and 2 bedroom apartments as well as a collection of town houses with either 3 or 6 bedrooms each. We are excited to join Airbnb and have added a small selection of properties to see how they are received on this community centric platform. We hope you like what we have to offer and that we can welcome you to London very soon!Besides renting we are also happy to help with all aspects of your trip, whether you need help with airport transfers, restaurant or show bookings or just want some tips on what to do while in London we are always on hand to assist.

summary: My second-floor modern flat is in a small, gated development with communal gardens and enjoys attractive views front and rear through trees to the hills and wooded areas beyond. Just 15 min bus to Croydon and fast trains to central London
space: The flat comprises two bedrooms; a double that has an en suite bathroom with walk-in shower and fitted wardrobe, and a single room with private use of separate bathroom.  The living room has a flat screen tv with large range of Sky digital programmes, a Bose sound system, books, DVD's, etc. The kitchen is smallish but very well equipped with double oven, ceramic hob, microwave and dishwasher; the washing machine/dryer is built into the en suite bathroom.
description: My second-floor modern flat is in a small, gated development with communal gardens and enjoys attractive views front and rear through trees to the hills and wooded areas beyond. Just 15 min bus to Croydon and fast trains to central London       The flat comprises two bedrooms; a double that has an en suite bathroom with walk-in shower and fitted wardrobe, and a single room with private use of separate bathroom.  The living room has a flat screen tv with large range of Sky digital programmes, a Bose sound system, books, DVD's, etc. The kitchen is smallish but very well equipped with double oven, ceramic hob, microwave and dishwasher; the washing machine/dryer is built into the en suite bathroom.  Depending if solo or two guests, either room is available (though not both together) with different charges applying; single room å£37 p.n.;å£200 p.w. - double room å£50 p.n.;å£270 p.w. The double room has a fitted carpet, exclusive use of en suite bathroom and contains an HD tv. The single roo
neighborhood_overview: Croydon is a conveniently situated multi-cultural South London borough with theatres, live music venues, large library, art cinema, clubs and bars - South Croydon boasting its own "restaurant quarter" with almost every national cuisine represented. There are a number of parks and gardens nearby  and guests could have access to two local authority gymn/pool centres for a small charge. They would also be welcome to join me for a game of tennis at my club.
notes: Guests are welcome to make use of my golf clubs with electric caddy, a hybrid on/off road bicycle and tennis rackets. I also have a car so can provide town centre shuttles, if available.
transit: There is a bus stop right outside the flat with two routes taking about fifteen minutes to central Croydon. From there frequent fast trains go to central London (15-20 mins), Gatwick airport (20 mins) and trendy Brighton on the south coast (45 mins). Further afield, and accessible by train, are the North and South Downs, Windsor Castle and Hampton Court Palace on the River Thames, Guildford with its cobbled High Street, and fashionable Richmond with the famous park adjacent. There is also an express bus that travels between Heathrow airport and Croydon (approx. 90 mins, but cheaper than a taxi!)
access: Depending if solo or two guests, either room is available (though not both together) with different charges applying; single room å£37 p.n.;å£200 p.w. - double room å£50 p.n.;å£270 p.w. The double room has a fitted carpet, exclusive use of en suite bathroom and contains an HD tv. The single room with wardrobe includes use of an i-Mac computer with internet connection and printer.
interaction: I very much enjoy meeting new people, especially with different life experiences, but my interaction with guests will be very much determined by them and their wishes. It is my only home so expect to usually be maintaining a discreet presence.
house_rules: I live in a shared apartment block with four other flats, so the usual neighbourly considerations apply. If using the double bedroom, in order to protect the carpet I would ask that no drinks other than water are taken in there. Smokers are requested to do so outside and pets are prohibited under rules of the lease. Otherwise the whole flat is available during your stay, save for whichever room I shall be using.
host_about: I have been retired since 2011, but am still a young-minded grandfather, who has worked variously as a civil engineer, probation officer, independent tour operator in southern Spain and adviser to family courts in parental conflict issues.I keep involved in my community as primary school governor, and helping with reading support, and as caseworker for a military charity. Other interests include photography, travel, theatre, reading, tennis, walking, cooking and socialising.I have made use of airbnb on a number of occasions; in New York, Salvador in Brazil and latterly in Sydney and Darwin, Australia. These have have always been fun and enhancing experiences, such that I now wish to share and make my own comfortable home available to travellers from wherever.I look forward to meeting you.

Public Transport links at your door step - 15 minutes direct to Wimbledon or 20 Minutes direct to Victoria, Kings Cross or London Bridge. Large shopping centre in Croydon with all big retailers, IKEA, Curry's/PC World, John Lewis Home on Purley Way as well as Surrey Street fruit and veg market and a large Sainsburys minutes away. Wandle Park has just had a å£1million redevelopment and is ideal for morning walks, picnics and an incredible play ground for the kids.
notes: A beautiful area with terrific transport links. This is ideal for Wimbledon tennis fans, Crystal Palace fans and those looking for  access to the south coast or to visit central London.
transit: Parking is available on site, on a visitor basis, via the concierge. - Tram to Wimbledon = 20 minutes - Tram to East Croydon = 5-10minutes - Train to Victoria, Kings Cross and London Bridge from East Croydon = 20 minutes  - Train to Gatwick Airport = 15 minutes - Train to Brighton = 40minutes
access: Make the flat your home! Our main bedroom has an en suite so you will have access to the main bathroom. Apart from our room there are no restrictions!
interaction: We will be in the flat and keep ourselves busy playing football and netball in the week or just chilling out with a BBQ on our terrace. We're happy for you to do your own thing or join in with us!
house_rules: This is a brand new apartment and hope that our guests will be respectful, tidy and keep loud noise to a minimum to respect the community and neighbours.
host_about: We are a young couple from Australia and Cornwall. We recently bought our first home and love it! Having the park nearby is great for jogging and we are both keen on sports especially football, netball and golf which we play in and around Croydon. We've also got membership at Crystal Palace. We like to camp and be by the seaside, so we often take the car at weekends to explore the coast. We also like to travel and last year we were lucky enough to get to Venice, Rome, Berlin and to Australia.

neighborhood_overview: Croydon is a mixture of old and new. Back in the 60's it was dubbed the City of the Future, fortunately people's ideas in what their city should look like have since changed.  As such Croydon has seen a huge revival in the last couple of years with many of the 60's built concrete towers being pulled down and replaced by shiny new glass skyscrapers and ultra modern buildings. Croydon town centre consists of 2 large shopping centres/malls and an impressive array of shops, restaurants, bars and clubs. Everything you need is within walking distance and you will find there is a great choice on offer. Opening in Summer 2016, Croydon will be the home of the largest Boxpark in London (see Shoreditch Boxpark) with hundreds of local establishments offering food, drink and entertainment, this is just the first phase of a huge redevelopment taking place next to East Croydon Station. Speaking of Shoreditch, which is now a hugely popular area of London and to give you a better idea, Croydon is where
notes: Please remember to bring your own toiletries. While we try to provide power adaptors for all guests these are rarely returned. Please try to bring your own in case we do not have any more left during your stay.
transit: We are located very close to the Croydon Town Centre (5-10 minutes on foot) so everything you may need is all within walking distance. To get into Central London couldn't be easier from East Croydon Station (just 5 minutes away). Trains to London Victoria, Waterloo, London Bridge and more are available as often as every 5-7 minutes. You can always get back to East Croydon as there is a night time service of 1 train/hour from London Victoria and London Bridge. East Croydon also connect to the South East for Gatwick Airport, Brighton & Hove, Portsmouth and many more.
access: You will have access to the entire property, we do not operate shared accommodation.
interaction: We are always available and happy to help, please do not hesitate to get in touch at any point before, during and after your stay. We mean it!
house_rules: Please be respectful of other guests and neighbours by keep noise to a minimum. Please do not smoke inside the property. No overnight visitors or undeclared guests. No parties. No abusive behaviour or language towards our staff members, guests or neighbours.  No filming without our permission and no soliciting.
host_about: Hello, I am Darie Nani and I am the managing director of The Hotel Alternative Ltd. Besides my business which I have built from the ground up with my brother, Michael,  my main interests are food, films, music and travelling. I also have 2 dogs, both Dobermans which both my girlfriend and I consider our kids!All our properties are maintained by our team, we have dedicated cleaners, professionally cleaned linen and towels and the same level of service you would expect from a hotel. While we are unable to provide food we do provide everything you need to cook yourself. Our moto is to provide Your Home Away From Home!Our portfolio of properties includes Studios, 1 and 2 bedroom apartments as well as a collection of town houses with either 3 or 6 bedrooms each. We are excited to join Airbnb and have added a small selection of properties to see how they are received on this community centric platform. We hope you like what we have to offer and that we can welcome you to London very soon!Besides renting we are also happy to help with all aspects of your trip, whether you need help with airport transfers, restaurant or show bookings or just want some tips on what to do while in London we are always on hand to assist.

neighborhood_overview: Croydon town center is a fifteen minute walk or short bus hop away and the area is very well served by public transport.  The iconic Whitgift shopping center has 140 retailers under one roof, is open seven days a week and central Croydon has an abundance of restaurants and bars.  There are convenience stores and super-markets within a few minutes walk.  Croydon has the largest population of all the Boroughs in London, and with Croydon Town acting as the heart of the borough; it could almost be a city in itself.  The area has always been a leader in financial, business and cultural sectors and is considered to be very well balanced with great living and working opportunities mixed with a bustling town centre and many green open areas. It also has a great alternative/arts scene, making living or staying in Croydon an increasingly attractive choice for anyone not wanting to pay higher London prices. The Borough of Croydon formed in 1965 and the name derives from Saxon times, meaning ÛÏvall
notes: Both Iain and I are very keen travelers and have experienced all sorts of levels of accommodation in other countries, with that in mind our goal here is to try and provide quality, self contained accommodation with a high level of privacy and independence.   If you have any concerns or difficulties whilst at the apartment please contact us immediately so we can assist or rectify.  And please if you have enjoyed your time staying at our apartment, leave a nice review :-))
transit: There is a bus route directly outside the property and East Croydon Station is just a 12 minute walk away. It is a major transport hub for trains buses and trams.   East Croydon Station is your gateway to London and the South East, use your Oyster or Travel card for convenient, frequent and speedy travel Directly into Central London.  London Victoria in 16 mins and London Bridge in 20 mins. Once in Central London you can access all of London's transport network, Underground, trains, trams and buses and see all that the one of the worlds leading cities has to offer.    Direct non stop and frequent 24 hour service to London Gatwick Airport normally in just 14 mins makes travelling to the airport a breeze.  The excellent tram system serving Croydon can also take you directly to Wimbledon, home of the famous tennis tournament. It takes just 30 minutes and costs around å£4  East Croydon station is situated in zone 5

name: Double bedroom in pleasant location
space: Our home is relaxed and comfortable with a large garden to enjoy during the summer evenings. The double room available is spacious and adjacent to bathroom. We are an 8/10 min walk to Mottingham main line station with trains going into London every 15min and trains going out to the Kent country side.  There is horse riding nearby, crazy golf, circus, boot fair and 2 large parks. Eltham is also within walking distance which is host to numerous retail outlets. The Glades Shopping Mall located in Bromley is a 20 minute bus drive away. The Olympic stadium is a 20 minute drive away or 40 minutes by public transport. Our nearest bus stop is less then a 2 minute walk away and allows easy access to Woolwich, Charlton and Greenwich (Olympic Areas). As well as popular destinations; Bromley, Catford and Lewisham.  I have daughter of 25 years who is a professional dancer and therefore works frequently (absent a lot), and a daughter who is away at University. We also have a small very friendly dog.

name: Cosy Single room in creative home
summary: We love our home, because is cosy and full of character at the same time.  Every space in the house is been put together with special thought and the area of Crystal Place is a fun and trendy place to be, with great connections to Central London.
space: We have lovely cosy single room, that would accommodate 1 guest comfortably. The room and flat are decorated with a mixture of retro/vintage and modern, making this a place full of character.  We have a very spacious lounge with LCD tv, a modern kitchen with everything you need for your stay and modern toilet with a shower and bath.  Things to notice: - We are a home of relaxed and easy going professionals that live with their best friend, a very well behaved and well trained medium size dog ( Collie ), so our guests will have to be people that like animals or can be around them without a problem and are respectful of the house and our rules.  - The flat is on a second floor with 3 flights of stairs to go up ( we don't have a lift, as this is a Victorian building ). - Our flat is less than 2 min from the train station, therefore we are on a main street with typical traffic noise. We would love our guest to be:  Non smokers, be respectful of the house and our personal items, be consider

We have a very spacious lounge with LCD tv, a modern kitchen with everything you need for your stay and modern toilet with a shower and bath.  Things to notice: - We are a home of relaxed and easy going professionals that live with their best friend, a very well behaved and well trained medium size dog ( Collie ), so our guests will have to be people that like animals or can be around them without a problem and are respectful of the house and our rules.  - The flat is on a second floor with 3 flights of stairs to go up ( we don't have a lift, as this is
neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace is a trendy / up and coming area, full of nice places to eat, drink and do some vintage shopping, only 5-10 min from our door.  We have cafÌ©s and restaurants for all taste, anything from Brazilian, Venezuelan, Italian, Thai, British, Indian cuisine and many more nice little cafÌ©s, bakeries. As well as many gastro  pubs, with late night music and drinks. Our house is next door, only 30 seconds away from the famous Crystal Palace Park, where you can walk and enjoy the view, visit the animals at the Park Farm or you can check out the Dinosaurs near the park lake. We are also next door to the Sport Centre, who have a gym and all the facilities you can ever imagine, even a swimming pool.  If you want any specific suggestions of places to visit, feel free to ask, we are more than happy to help
notes: We would love our guest to be:  Non smokers, be respectful of the house and our personal items, be considerate of any noise at late hours, as we are professionals that work a lot and need our beauty sleep and the same goes for our neighbors.  To be friendly with animals as we have a dog pet ( we don't accommodate any other pets )   To be clean and tidy and leave things as you found them as much as possible, when your visit ends.
transit: If what you are looking is to venture into central London and see all the landmarks, you can get around very easily:  By Train and Overground: We have the Crystal Palace train station less than 1 min walk. The station has direct trains to London Bridge, London Victoria and an overground train with direct links to the underground Jubilee line, this train can also take you directly to any of the trendy and creative areas of Shoreditch, Highbury & Islington and anything in between. ( all of this journeys will take around 30 min ) By Bus:  We have a bus station only 5 min walk from the house with day time and night time buses gong directly to central london. Buses direct to Oxford Circus: 410, 157 and 358 Night bus direct to Oxford Circus : N3 Airpot transport:  From Heathrow Airport: you can take  underground connection from the airport all the way from London Victoria train station and from there, take the next train via Crystal a Palace   From Gatwick Airport: you can take regular train
access: On your visit to our house, you can feel at home. You will have full access to the kitchen and lounge. If you need to cook anything, clean your clothes, make some tea. if you need hair dryer or towels, that can be available, you just need to ask. house_rules: - Check in: can be at any reasonable time, all I need is good notice to make sure I can be here to welcome you and give you the keys.  - Check out: Any time in the morning or afternoon, as long as you give me notice.  - We would prefer only ladies as guest in our house or we can also have couples as guests.   - Any communal areas of the house: please keep clean and tidy while you visit.  - Pet: The dog is very well trained, so please don't try to teach any new tricks. name: Characterful Southeast London Home
summary: Our beautiful house and garden have been lovingly restored over the last 2 years and comfortably sleep 4 adults. Situated in London's Zone 4, there are quick train links into London Victoria, London Bridge, London Charing Cross and East Croydon stations.
space: Enter the house through the entrance hall which leads into the open plan ground floor. A sitting room area contains two large comfy sofas and a smaller armchair with large TV and cable services. The dining area on the same floor has a large table with 6 chairs with the newly installed, very well equipped kitchen at the back of the house, looking onto the garden. Upstairs are two bedrooms (one king size, one double) and a spacious bathroom.

neighborhood_overview: YouÛªll feel like royalty in this amazing location, which has the perfect blend of architecture, culture and nature and that makes South London so unique. The property is located extremely close to Crystal Palace Park, which is a beautiful natural area. Locally, you will find sights such as the Crystal Palace Transmitter at 219åÊmetres tall. The apartment is also well located to visit Royal Greenwich for the world famous Cutty Sark tea clipper and the Royal Observatory, where you can stand on the Meridian Line which divides the worldÛªs eastern and western hemispheres. The Horniman Museum and its beautiful gardens are also just 20 minute away by public transport. Crystal Palace train station is less than a 10 minute walk away from the apartment, providing direct access to the heart of London. This means that some of the worldÛªs most famous landmarks are accessible in less than an hour. You can also easily access both Heathrow and Gatwick airports from Central London.
notes: No small children please.  Minimum age 12 years old only with guardian.
transit: Head into Central London and the world is your oyster. From here you will find world famous landmarks such as Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey and St PaulÛªs Cathedral. Take a guided tour around the Tower of London and visit Tower Bridge, or see the city on an open top bus and soak in the sights.  London has it all, from museums to theatre and outstanding entertainment at the South Bank Centre. Shop to your heartÛªs content on Oxford Street and Regent Street, home to some of the worldÛªs most famous brands. Whether it a family getaway, business trip or a visit to the capital with some friends, London is the perfect place to be. This classic, exclusive and spacious apartment is exceptional and is situated in a suburban and well connected location. So why not start planning your London adventure now and book this superb apartment today!

host_about: We are an award winning family run business specialising in short term and holiday rental property management in London. We have been involved in holiday lettings management since 2008. We are passionate about providing a first class hosting experience to our guests, and a top quality marketing and property management service to our hosts. We love AirBnB, as many people do. However we understand that managing a short term rental or holiday let in London can be demanding and time consuming, especially if you have a busy job or family to look after. That's where we come in. Our highly qualified and experienced team provides a full service from holiday property marketing, answering enquiries and bookings, check in service, check out, professional cleaning, laundry and property management. We love our guests, and nothing makes us happier than happy guests! We are continually working to ensure that we deliver the best possible service to our guests. We pride ourselves in offering clean and comfortable accommodation, superb communication, and a team that are always helpful and friendly.Please see our website Somewhere Like Home to find out more about us and our team. We would love to help you.

neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace has a vibrant community - in addition to the annual music festival in June - there's a film festival in November - and the annual Guy Fawkes firework display - artist open studies and, of course, a huge sports centre where you can swim, play squash or volley ball, amongst other activities.
transit: Trains run to London Bridge (for the financial centre) and Victoria (for the West End) every 15 minutes - Monday to Friday.  Timetables change at the weekend but you can check times via the Trainline app (or website). Transport of London operate an overground tube service that goes to Canada Water (change here to get underground trains).  The service goes direct to super trendy White Chapel and Shoreditch Highstreet where an array of galleries, shops and very cool bars are located - and plenty of Vietnamese restaurants.  Brick Lane is also in the area - famous for its Indian cuisine.

neighborhood_overview: Beckenham is a delightful town on the outskirts of london, perfect for a family on holiday or an older group of visitors. There's great outside space like Kelsey Park. Hang out atÛ_ Fee & Brown for fancy coffee. The centre has a smashing selection of independent cafes, bars and restaurants; some good Turkish grillhouses such as Lalezar and Kemer, and the Italian old faithful, Zi'Teresa as well as all the major chains. David Bowie, Bob Monkhouse and Enid Blyton all lived in Beckenham!

description: Lovely garden view double bedroom in our home, with shared bathroom, unrestricted on-street parking and complimentary breakfast provided. Just a 5 minute walk to Elmers End station (zone 4) with direct trains to London Bridge, Lewisham, Charing Cross and Cannon Street, or the tram to Croydon and Wimbledon. With a comfy double bed, desk/dressing table and plenty of storage, this quiet bedroom, with fantastic garden-view, is the ideal space to relax after a busy day of enjoying all that London has to offer. Although the room comfortably sleeps 2 adults, we can arrange for an extra fold out mattress to accommodate 1 young child. With unlimited access to our fibre broadband you can stream videos to watch in your room, (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) family and friends or just lie back and enjoy a good book. Fresh towels, tea and coffee making facilities, iron and ironing board, wardrobe and drawer space and hairdryer are provided for your use in the room. Guests have access to the private doub
neighborhood_overview: One of the highlights of the local area is that we are on the doorstep of South Norwood Country Park, which offers great walks and lots of wildlife to spot. There are wild flower meadows, a lake, children's playground and cycle paths. There is a large 24hr Tesco with petrol station next to Elmers End Station, as well as a small selection of restaurants and a pub within a 10 minute walk. A 25 minute walk or short bus ride will take you into Beckenham, which offers a variety of restaurants, bars, shops, parks, swimming pool, gym and Odeon cinema.
notes: We share our home with our fluffy cat, Jaffa, but he won't be allowed in your room during your stay. We are both classically trained musicians and use our downstairs living area for private music lessons a couple of times during the week (usually on a Monday). Noise will be kept to a minimum, and the lessons will always be finished by 7.30pm at the very latest.
transit: We are only a 5 minute walk to Elmers End station (zone 4) where you can catch a train to destinations including... Lewisham - 15mins Waterloo East - 25mins London Bridge - 27mins Charing Cross (Trafalgar Square) - 29mins Cannon Street - 31mins From Elmers End you can also take the tram to destinations including... Croydon - 12mins Wimbledon - 40mins Gatwick Airport can be reached from Elmers End station within 40 minutes using the train and tram.
access: Guests have access to the private double bedroom and shared bathroom (with bath and separate shower). A simple breakfast will be available downstairs in our dining area in the morning, but we would like to keep this area private after 10am.  Tea and coffee making facilities are provided in the bedroom, but guests will have access to the fridge in our kitchen for milk or to store food. Other kitchen facilities are not available for short term stays. Guests are more than welcome to use our large garden.
interaction: As we both work from home, one of us will usually be in most of the time. After making sure you have everything you need for a comfortable stay, we will leave you to enjoy your room in privacy. We will always be happy to help with advice or any problems.
house_rules: No smoking or pets please.
host_about: Hello! We are both professional musicians (violin and viola) and moved to London in June 2015. We have been together for 9 years, married for 1, and live with our extra fluffy cat, Jaffa.

We will be able to provide you with any good spots around us and some guides on areas to visit and getting there.
notes: As said before myself and girlfriend live in the other bedroom to the flat, we will be out most of the day or away travelling so will not be in your way. neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace is fab.  There are lots of new bars and restaurants opening.  There is also lots of greenery and wide open spaces.  You have the amazing views across London too.  I am sure you will love it. One of the joys of Crystal Palace is that there's no need to venture far to eat, drink and shop. There's plenty of choice on the Triangle: Domali is a relaxed all-day cafÌ©; the Sparrowhawk is a recently renovated pub with a gutsy, European-influenced menu; Mediterranean is a welcoming Sardinian restaurant; and Edo does great sushi.  Joanna's restaurant is great.  A favourite bar is Numidie. Grape and Grain have live jazz on a Sunday evening and people go and jive the afternoon away. The Paxton Arms in Gipsy Hill has great pies.  Green and Brown's at Crystal Palace station is good for coffee and breakfast. Shops include vintage furniture emporia and much-loved bookshop The Bookseller Crow. For edible treats, there's a Saturday food market, and deli Good Taste specialises in cheese and
transit: A regular service to Highbury & Islington supplements those to Victoria and London Bridge, making it easy to get right across London. Crystal Palace is in Zone 2.  There are 6 stations that are a walking distance or a short bus ride away. From Crystal Palace train station:- It's 16 mins to London Bridge Train Station It's 26 mins to London Victoria Train Station  It's 41 mins to Oxford Circus tube station To Gatwick Airport:- It's 58 mins in a taxi It's 42 mins on the train (every 30 mins) The 157 bus is at the end of the road.  The buses run every 10 mins and take you to Crystal Palace station in 6 mins.

I love Design, Culture, cycling, swimming, yoga and live music.  Looking forward to meeting you and sharing insights on London- I have lived here for 15 years and can't imagine living anywhere else right now!

summary: Beautiful double bedroom in a cosy and peaceful home. Located in the vibrant area of Crystal Palace, the flat is only 5 - 10min walk from bars, restaurants and vintage shops and is only a 2 min walk to the  station with direct trains or buses to central London
space: We have a very spacious double room with a king size bed, that would accommodate 2 guest comfortably. The room and flat are decorated with a mixture of retro/vintage and modern, making this a place full of character.  We have a very spacious lounge with LCD tv, a modern kitchen with everything you need for your stay and modern toilet with a shower and bath.  Things to notice: - We are a home of relaxed and easy going professionals that live with their best friend, a very well behaved and well trained medium size dog ( Collie ), so our guests will have to be people that like animals or can be around them without a problem and are respectful of the house and our rules.  - The flat is on a second floor with 3 flights of stairs to go up ( we don't have a lift, as this is a Victorian building ). - Our flat is less than 2 min from the train station, therefore we are on a main street with typical traffic noise. We would love our guest to be:  Non smokers, be respectful of the house and our pe

We have a very spacious lounge with LCD tv, a modern kitchen with everything you need for your stay and modern toilet with a shower and bath.  Things to notice: - We are a home of relaxed and easy going professionals that live with their best friend, a very well behaved and well trained medium size dog ( Collie ), so our guests will have to be people that like animals or can be around them without a problem and are respectful of the house and our rules.  - The flat is on a second floor with 3 flights of stairs to go up ( we don't have a lift, as this is a Victorian building ). - Our flat is less than 2 min from the train station, therefore we are on a main street with typical traffic noise. We would love our guest to be:  Non smokers, be respectful of the house and our pe
neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace is a trendy / up and coming area, full of nice places to eat, drink and do some vintage shopping, only 5-10 min from our door.  We have cafÌ©s and restaurants for all taste, anything from Brazilian, Venezuelan, Italian, Thai, British, Indian cuisine and many more nice little cafÌ©s, bakeries. As well as many gastro  pubs, with late night music and drinks. Our house is next door, only 30 seconds away from the famous Crystal Palace Park, where you can walk and enjoy the view, visit the animals at the Park Farm or you can check out the Dinosaurs near the park lake. We are also next door to the Sport Centre, who have a gym and all the facilities you can ever imagine, even a swimming pool.  If you want any specific suggestions of places to visit, feel free to ask, we are more than happy to help
notes: We would love our guest to be:  Non smokers, be respectful of the house and our personal items, be considerate of any noise at late hours, as we are professionals that work a lot and need our beauty sleep and the same goes for our neighbors.  To be friendly with animals as we have a dog pet ( we don't accommodate any other pets )   To be clean and tidy and leave things as you found them as much as possible, when your visit ends.
transit: If what you are looking is to venture into central London and see all the landmarks, you can get around very easily:  By Train and Overground: We have the Crystal Palace train station less than 1 min walk. The station has direct trains to London Bridge, London Victoria and an overground train with direct links to the underground Jubilee line, this train can also take you directly to any of the trendy and creative areas of Shoreditch, Highbury & Islington and anything in between. ( all of this journeys will take around 30 min ) By Bus:  We have a bus station only 5 min walk from the house with day time and night time buses gong directly to central london. Buses direct to Oxford Circus: 410, 157 and 358 Night bus direct to Oxford Circus : N3 Airpot transport:  From Heathrow Airport: you can take  underground connection from the airport all the way from London Victoria train station and from there, take the next train via Crystal a Palace   From Gatwick Airport: you can take regular train
access: On your visit to our house, you can feel at home. You will have full access to the kitchen and lounge. If you need to cook anything, clean your clothes, make some tea. if you need hair dryer or towels, that can be available, you just need to ask.  We also have cable TV with many channels that you're welcome to enjoy and internet access is available from our super fast wifi connection.
interaction: We are a very friendly couple, that would be happy to make you feel at home enjoying a glass of wine while watching tv, give you direction on how to get around London or recommend places you must visit if you need help. But if all you're looking is to have a quiet and relaxing time, we are more than happy to give you your personal space. And the dog only eats her own food, so please don't feed from your own plate.
