name: A Home Between Town & Country
summary: A welcoming family home in Orpington, South East London. On the cusp of both worlds. One side we have the thriving metropolis that is London only a 12 minute train ride to London Bridge and on the other we have the garden of England, which is Kent.
space: You'll have a private ensuite bedroom for privacy and plenty of wardrobe space. The room is comfortably furnished and very welcoming.
description: A welcoming family home in Orpington, South East London. On the cusp of both worlds. One side we have the thriving metropolis that is London only a 12 minute train ride to London Bridge and on the other we have the garden of England, which is Kent. You'll have a private ensuite bedroom for privacy and plenty of wardrobe space. The room is comfortably furnished and very welcoming. We'll give you a key to use while with us so you can come and go as you like. You'll be free to use the front lounge with it's wood burner, (for colder months) sun room, kitchen and garden. We love talking with and hosting guests from around the world. We are usually on hand for advice and guidance on places to see and visit. Your hardest challenge will be deciding on where to go. Orpington is a vibrant community going through many positive changes. There are plenty of restaurants and even a zip car for registered users. There are plenty of options for getting around with the station being just a 4 minute walk
neighborhood_overview: Orpington is a vibrant community going through many positive changes. There are plenty of restaurants and even a zip car for registered users.
notes: We are a non smoking home. We are located just a 4 minute walk from Orpington station and a 2 minute walk to the nearest bus stop with access to a wide variety of local places. We have been undergoing some renovation works which are almost complete. Just the outside of the house to finish but don't let that put you off.
transit: There are plenty of options for getting around with the station being just a 4 minute walk away and the bus stop just 2 minutes. There is also a hire car company just near the station along with a taxi firm. We would recommend getting an oyster card if you are going to be using public transport into central london. For day trips into Kent then your options are to either hire a car or use the away day options on the train system.
access: We'll give you a key to use while with us so you can come and go as you like. You'll be free to use the front lounge with it's wood burner, (for colder months) sun room, kitchen and garden.

It is fitted on three sides and cannot be moved away from the wall. We would expect guests to be respectful and treat our home with the same care as they would care for their own. notes: Guests have full access to the whole flat, including full use of kitchen and the spacious living room. We will provide coffee/tea, breakfast cereal, bread, butter and jam for breakfast. Last trains  if your out in London always check the last trains to New Eltham or Chislehurst on the national rail website for Southeastern trains times. Night buses can get you around otherwise, taxis from central cost around å£30-å£35 at night time. Check Transport For London (TFL) website for more details on all London transport National rail will also give you train journey times If you are travelling from a particular airport let us know and we can explain best routes to travel to where we live.

host_about: We are an award winning family run business specialising in short term and holiday rental property management in London. We have been involved in holiday lettings management since 2008. We are passionate about providing a first class hosting experience to our guests, and a top quality marketing and property management service to our hosts. We love AirBnB, as many people do. However we understand that managing a short term rental or holiday let in London can be demanding and time consuming, especially if you have a busy job or family to look after. That's where we come in. Our highly qualified and experienced team provides a full service from holiday property marketing, answering enquiries and bookings, check in service, check out, professional cleaning, laundry and property management. We love our guests, and nothing makes us happier than happy guests! We are continually working to ensure that we deliver the best possible service to our guests. We pride ourselves in offering clean and comfortable accommodation, superb communication, and a team that are always helpful and friendly.Please see our website Somewhere Like Home to find out more about us and our team. We would love to help you.

neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace is a lovely part of south London, with an arty, community feel, and amazing views across the Kent countryside and into central London. The high street has lots of independent shops, cafes, pubs and restaurants. There is a big park and a sports centre for people who like being active. Everything is a 5-10 minute walk from the flat. It's a safe area, particularly as the flat is so central.
transit: The train station is five minutes walk from the flat, with trains to central London in 30-40 minutes (to Victoria or London Bridge) and the overground line to Canada Water, Shoreditch and Islington. The bus station is also five minutes away with lots of buses to south and central London.
access: I live in the flat, but I'm more than happy to share the kitchen, sitting room, bathroom and balcony (and stay out of your way when you want to use them). neighborhood_overview: West Wickham in the borough of Bromley is a lovely area of London and still relatively undiscovered by tourists. Guests over the years have described it as 'exactly what they imagined' of a traditional English town, yet it it so convenient for the Centre of London. It's peaceful, the supermarkets and shops are nice and there are plenty of cafe's, restaurants, pubs and parks. Most people say they 'took a chance' when booking a house in West Wickham but all have liked it and have been pleasantly surprised and many guests have visited again. A few guests even decided to move to the UK permanently and have ended up living in our area, they liked it so much.  In addition to being so close to London we are on the doorstep of Kent 'The Garden of England' with its many stately homes, castles and pretty towns and villages so if you have a car you will be able to visit lots of interesting places in the countryside. Surrey is also close, and you can get to the south coast seaside towns like Brigh
notes: Opposite our house there is a park with swings, and there is plenty of woodland and nature nearby. Not far away there are golf courses, swimming pool, gym, library and Gambado children's play centre should you get tired of visiting London. The house is also listed as individual rooms. Once a room has been booked the facility to book the whole house as a private accommodation will be marked reserved, but if you are happy to share you can also book multiple rooms on our other listings.
transit: West Wickham train station is 6 mins walk away. There are currently four trains an hour into central London but more during the rush hour. Trains go to London Bridge, Waterloo East and Charing Cross in 35 - 45 minutes. We are London zone 5. The last train home is around midnight but if you want to stay in London late into the night you can get a train to East Croydon all night long (15 mins journey) and then the 119 night bus (15 mins)  The nearest large town is Bromley which is at  most 10 mins by car. We have bus stops near our house. East Croydon is also a short bus ride away and has a very large important station from where you can get a train to Gatwick Airport and the South Coast seaside resorts.  There are fast trains (15mins) to all London stations from nearby Bromley
access: Guests will have private use of the main house and a large fenced off part of the garden. You can also use the drive at the front to park your car - if there is no room there is free parking on the road opposite.
interaction: We (the owners)  live in an annexe/separated part of the house and have our own private entrance  to the side. Airbnb guests enter via the main front door and are completely independent. Unless we are away or on holiday we are always available and happy to help out, answer questions, or sort out any potential problems.
house_rules: Please report any damage, and remember that people live nearby, so no parties or gathering of non-booked people please. After 10.00pm please be considerate of noise outside (drive and garden) and please advise at her guests of this too. No shouting or revving of engines on front drive after 9.00pm   Check in after 3.00pm and Check out by 10.30 please. Please leave the house as you found it. Please recycle your rubbish in the bins provided - plastic, glass and metal all go in together into the plastic containers by the bin on the drive. Please make sure you do your washing up before you leave!  Absolutely no smoking in the house. The cleaning charge added to the price at booking is for clean bedding and towels. Please ask if you need more than we have provided. Please be kind and leave the house tidy and clean and as found.  If you move furniture please replace as sometimes its too heavy for me to move alone. And also important - please tell the others in your group.
host_about: We are a couple with one child still living at home and two children at university. We have been offering homestays and holiday lets for several years but have just joined airbnb.To see reviews you can look at the following link which will give you some idea about who we are, the property and the location, although of course we no longer offer homestays and your accommodation will be independent and private. We live in a section of the house which has a separate entrance, so you won't see us much unless you would like to, or have a problem or need advice!(URL HIDDEN)Wendy and John x

summary: Perhaps, the most cost effective homestay in London. Prices are low because the host is not greedy. Consultancy is also given. The discerning guests, keen on arts, tourism and  world cuisine are welcome. Agreed expenses need to be shared though..
space: I have received more than 50 references as a good host on couchsurfing and hospitalityclub sites.  My large flat is in historical Crystal Palace area. It is about 25 minutes overground ride away from Central London and fashionable Chelsea areas.  This area inspired writers like Emile Zola and painters like Pissaro who lived and worked in the neighbourhood. In my large apartment, there are two bedrooms to let. Large kitchen is available for warming the food but not suitable for frying or slow cooking. Deep frying can activate smoke alarm and the neighbours get worried. Expenses need to be shared for extras such as warming the food, use of hair dryer, ironing etc. A large living room with natural light is also available whenever it is not used by the host. There are lots of greenery inside and outside the flat. There is a big collection of book, dvds and classical music cds which can be watched with mutual arrangements. This area inspired writers like Emile Zola and painters like Pissaro who lived and worked in the neighbourhood. In my large apartment, there are two bedrooms to let. Large kitchen is available for warming the food but not suitable for frying or slow cooking. Deep frying can activate smoke alarm and the neighbours get worried. Expenses need to be shared for extras such as warming the food, use of hair dryer, ironing etc. A large living room with natural light is also available whenever it is not used b
neighborhood_overview: It is very close to central London and my place gives a feeling of the countryside. It is relatively peaceful, without pollution, with late night shops and amenities. Sports centres, parks, lakes, free gym are all nearby.
notes: Please do not hesitate to discuss your needs. I have a long experience of London and can solve lots of problems. Consultancy is my business in any case.
transit: Yes, 24 hour public transport.
access: To be discussed and mutually agreed.
interaction: I attend lots of cultural events in London. Sometimes, the guests would be able to join me. Similarly, I get discounted tickets for theatre and concerts. I also host parties at home.
house_rules: Expect the same hospitality as you yourself would extend to your guest. For example courtesy, considerations, good manners, no foul language, conversations about travels, food, films, arts are expected and shared.
host_about: My guests tend to enjoy their stay at my place. They seem to remember not only my hospitality but also guidance about London. I have spent half of my life in this great city.  Please look at my pages (URL HIDDEN)I have two furnished guest rooms. I can also supply clean towels. There is a large kitchen for cooking. Plenty of food, coffee and teas (black, green, Indian, English) are there.Sometimes, time permitting, we can cook together. I can cook several French and Indian recipes, mostly vegetarian but sometimes with lamb and chicken.My place is only 25 minute train ride away from Central London. There are 24 hour buses which stop opposite the house. Everyone who stayed at my place wants to come back which is a good sign.My life motto is: I can give you what I need most: tlc.

host_about: We are Steven, Evi & and our little white dog Lumi. We live in a large peaceful house in a zone 6 suburb of London, perfect to return to after a long day sightseeing or travelling. We are professional musicians but have also worked in the City so are attune to the varying needs of travellers! We travel across Europe playing shows so like to take in new places, experiences and bring a bit of that home every time. Our passion apart from music is interior design, so slowly improving the house to industrial chic Berlin-esq style.We pride ourselves on being relaxed, friendly and helpful, whilst giving people as much space and peace as they need.The house (maybe rarely!)  is also 'band' friendly, in that we have had bands stay here to use the local recording/rehearsal Ascape studio in Bromley. We are professional musicians so understand the requirements and jargon needed to make it a comfortable relaxing stay away from the studio sessions.We are happy to welcome respectful travellers to our home.

neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace is lively, friendly and fun and has a big beautiful park, perfect for kids (there are dinosaurs in there from the Victorian era!) and leisurely walks. There's a big lake, a farm, cafe and ice cream vans etc and it's all across the road from the flat. The triangle area is full of plenty of great pubs, bars, restaurants, antique and vintage shops, boutiques and salons and there are all essential shops you might need just two minutes walk from the flat, plus great takeaways. And it's half an hour from your front room into central London.
transit: Crystal Palace station is two minutes walk away, with direct trains to London Bridge and Victoria, plus the Orange Line/overground. It's quick and easy to get anywhere and is zone 3. It is also on many bus routes, including night buses from central London. The park and triangle areas are just a couple of minutes walk, plus there is free parking right outside the flat.

neighborhood_overview: Brilliant location near the lovely town of Chislehurst and a short distance from St. Mary's Cray train station providing an easy trip to central London.  Situated in Kent, known as "the garden of England" you will find plenty of green space, parks and nature reserves here. Great for families, couples or solo travellers. Away from the hustle and bustle but a short hop into central London. We are in a safe suburban area where you can actually sleep at night! A perfect base to explore South East London.
notes: * You may be able to check in earlier (especially at weekends, please ask). * We provide towels and bed linen.  * There are no pets at the property. * We provide free fast WiFi. * For extra guest we have fold up bed with bed linen (stored in wardrobe) * The room in the main building, not summer house shown in the picture. * If you are buying a 7-day paper based weekly travel card (which allows for many 2 for 1 offers on London attractions) please be aware you will need a passport sized photograph for this.
transit: St. Mary's cray train station will take you to London Victoria in about 25 minutes, with just one (some services two) stops on the way. The station is located within London zone 6 and buses to the station run frequently taking about 5 minutes. The station is about 20 mins walk. Trains to London take the same time as trains that run from zone 3 since these trains usually stop at many stations London is a big city and to explore London you will need to use trains, buses and the underground system. The best way to do this is using the Oyster Card which will cap the cost of your travel so no matter how many more trips you make you will not pay more than the current rate from zone 6. Plenty of unrestricted free parking outside the house. On arrival we are happy to provide transport from St. Mary's Cray train station at no extra cost, please arrange this with us in advance.
access: Guests have access to the garden, kitchen and lounge. Guests are also free to use the shared upstairs bathroom and downstairs toilet facilities.
interaction: We are happy to give any advice and guidance during your stay and like to think we can help out when needed. We always try to welcome our guests on arrival.
house_rules: Smokers are welcome but please no smoking inside the house.
host_about: Hi Guys,Along with my partner Chantal we are your hosts!Chantal speaks fluent English, Spanish and French so we welcome guests from Europe.We are both friendly, easy going and here to make your stay in London completely awesome! Both of us love to travel and we have come to know what to expect as guests and hope that we can provide the same to you as hosts.Our house is in a perfect location, away from the hustle and bustle but well connected to travel into London within about 30 minutes. We are situated in Kent which is known as the garden of England. There are lovely parks and green space and our area is relaxing and chilled! We are a little further out (zone 6) but as we are a London borough, the transport links mean you'll have no problems getting to and from "the smoke". Trains are actually quicker than from zone 3,4 or 5 because they run direct to central London (making only one stop). We love to socialise with guests or happy to let you do your own thing.  Feel free to join us for a glass of wine in our beautiful garden or relax in your own space.London, just a stone's throw away!

Hang out atÛ_ Fee & Brown for fancy coffee. The centre has a smashing selection of independent cafes, bars and restaurants; some good Turkish grillhouses such as Lalezar and Kemer, and the Italian old faithful, Zi'Teresa as well as all the major chains. David Bowie, Bob Monkhouse and Enid Blyton all lived in Beckenham!

neighborhood_overview: The countryside is nearby and reached by local transport. Three rewarding days out are to the Royal Observatory and museums at Greenwich, Down House where Charles Darwin wrote the Origin of Species and a little further afield to Chartwell the family home of Winston Churchill.
notes: Free Wi-Fi is available throughout the house and there are the usual mod-cons. If you like playing tennis you can play in the park for free. Also thereÛªs a great swimming pool at Beckenham Spa and municipal golf course in the leafy Beckenham Place Park, both short walks away.

London Victoria is 20 minutes by train; Gatwick Airport is about one hour via the direct tram service to East Croydon. The house is on a quiet street with many local restaurants, cafes, pubs, cinema, shops and a picturesque church nearby. I have free time when you visit to help you make the most of your stay.
access: The single bedroom is on the first floor. It has its own wash basin and there is a family sized bathroom next door for your use. You are welcome to share everything on the ground floor with me ÛÒ the kitchen, through living room, conservatory and garden.
interaction: You really have the best of all worlds with all the attractions, hustle and bustle of London and the peace and quiet of the English countryside. I am happy to help any way I can, but equally you are welcome to come and go as you prefer. There may be off-street parking for a small car; perhaps I can drive you into the countryside, just ask. I've not included breakfast or packed lunches but if this will help let me know and we can sort something simple out.
house_rules: Sorry, smoking or pets are not allowed. A social drink is fine and you are welcome to try my home made country wine and beer if you wish, even to learn how to make it if you are interested!
host_about: Hello, I'm David and new to airbnb. I'm middle aged and married but often travel alone on short breaks. I like walking, cycling and city breaks. I welcome peace and quiet. I enjoy traditional pursuits like country dancing and wine-making.Quite often I'll stay in youth hostels to meet new people but I'd like to see what airbnb can offer and I'm now trying out hosting too. I'm having a career break so have more time to travel and host. I look forward to meeting you.

I'll then meet you at the end of your stay to say goodbye. If you are interested in city tours or Arsenal football tickets, I may also be able to help arrange these so just ask!

host_about: We love Airbnb, but we know that it can be very time consuming for property owners to organise, so we do all the hard work for them by managing their place whilst they are awayThis means that for guests staying in one of our Airbnb properties, they will get very professional, local service from genuine Londoners. We have a roster of reliable cleaners, we'll personally meet you at the property and we'll be on call for any local advice or help. We also only accept properties into our portfolio which hit a certain standard, so I'm sure you'll be happy with your stay!Francis and Mark both love travelling and understand the importance of a nice property and welcoming smile when visiting, so we'll do everything possible to make sure you enjoy the property and our city.We can even organise airport transfers, football match or theatre tickets and city tours if you want.We only take bookings through Airbnb, so get in touch and book into one of our fantastic London properties!

neighborhood_overview: Shortlands is a friendly village with small local shops .lovely parks and  woodland is a10 minute walk to the Charter Market town of Bromley with ,shopping mall .3 day street markets, restaurants ,cafes  ,cinema ,sports pavilion with indoor pool .The Churchill Theatre is at the heart of the town and is often host to pre West End runs of plays ,musical theatre ,Ballet and Opera .
transit: We are a  5 minute walk to a mainline station ,Shortlands to Victoria is approx. 23 mins .Access to Charing x and St Pancras is also possible .There is an excellent bus service to all areas ,town and country .Parking in Rd is possible.  To travel to Shortlands from Gatwick take the Gatwick express to East Croydon then the tram to Beckenham Junction where you can hop on the train to Shortlands ,only 1 stop . If arriving at Heathrow take the Piccadilly line to Victoria Station and the overground to Shortlands .If arriving at Stanstead you can get express coaches and trains into central London including Victoria Coach Station .

transit: The house is within easy reach of several transport links which all take you to different places in and around Central London. The good thing is that several stations are nearby, all taking you to different places in Central London. London Transport is based on a zone system. The zones range from 1-6. In some areas even further, but I wouldn't consider anything further than zone 6 to be London (website hidden) 1 would be Central London and zone 6 would be the furthest away from Central London. Most people who live and work in London would usually live in zone 3 or 4. The further the zone, the more expensive travel would be. London Transport is usually divided into North and South as well. Anything north of the river would usually be served by Tubes/Metro/Underground. Anything south of the river would normally be served by trains. Both have pro's and con's. Whilst trains are less frequent, they are faster than tubes and take you to places in a shorter amount of time. Tubes however would

name: Cozy Family Home in Kent, Room #2
summary: Our family home is in leafy Kent on a quiet street, with easy access to green fields and woodland. The village shops and station are within walking distance, central London is just a 40 minute train ride away, or Bromley shopping centre a short bus or car ride.
space: Our house is warm and friendly. Our guest bedroom is big enough for two, with a double bed. We have a separate listing for a room with two single beds. There is a wardrobe and a television and a big window looking out to the garden
description: Our family home is in leafy Kent on a quiet street, with easy access to green fields and woodland. The village shops and station are within walking distance, central London is just a 40 minute train ride away, or Bromley shopping centre a short bus or car ride. Our house is warm and friendly. Our guest bedroom is big enough for two, with a double bed. We have a separate listing for a room with two single beds. There is a wardrobe and a television and a big window looking out to the garden We have a shower room and toilet especially for guests, and share the use if the kitchen, dining room, living room and garden We will be present at the listing during guest's stay, but will be at work/school during the day, and out some evenings. There will always be someone available on the phone for any advice or problems and we are happy to chat when home. Our neighbourhood is suburban, friendly and quiet, away from the busy roads and hustle and bustle of town. We have some good pubs and restaurant
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is suburban, friendly and quiet, away from the busy roads and hustle and bustle of town. We have some good pubs and restaurants nearby and shops are easily reachable. If the lights of London are calling, we have a station in Hayes village to get you there and back in no time. There is a theatre in Bromley nearby, or you may want to go further into the countryside and feed the animals at Christmas Tree Farm. There are lots of day trips to take as trains from Bromley South will take you out to the Kent coast and all stops in between. Or you may just want to relax in our vintage style village tea shop and watch the world go by.
notes: As we are at work and school/uni during the week, we need to sleep at night! Therefor we have to have reasonable peace and quiet after 10pm. If you come home late and want to sleep in we will do the same for you and keep it down in the morning. We don't invite smokers as we don't smoke ourselves, and no pets please. We do have a little pug dog visit us occasionally, belonging to family member,  If you object to this happening during your stay let me know, it won't be a problem.
transit: We have two railway stations nearby, and lots of bus routes and there are no parking restrictions on our street. Gatwick is the nearest airport, but all London airports are reachable from the M25 motorway, about 30 minutes drive away. There is a fast train from Gatwick Airport to Victoria Station, and trains come from London Victoria to Bromley South, where there is a cab stand.
access: We have a shower room and toilet especially for guests, and share the use if the kitchen, dining room, living room and garden
interaction: We will be present at the listing during guest's stay, but will be at work/school during the day, and out some evenings. There will always be someone available on the phone for any advice or problems and we are happy to chat when home.
house_rules: We would expect the Kitchen to be kept clean and tidy as it is a shared area. We leave our shoes at the door, please bring indoor slippers to wear around the house. Drunken or shouty behaviour would not tolerated, we like to be nice! Please feel free to ask advice about any trips you might be planning, or just come and share an evening coffee with us This is a no smoking house.

I enjoy travelling and experiencing different cultures and  adventure excites me, I have joined a house-swapping site which has taken us to far off places, from San Francisco, Paris, LA, Amsterdam to Stockholm.

name: 25 mins to London & the countryside
summary: A quiet double bed, a few minutes walk from Beckenham Junction station. London Victoria 20 minutes by train; Gatwick Airport one hour via tram service to East Croydon; located in Kent, the "Garden of England", with glorious countryside nearby.
space: A little known fact of Beckenham is that David Bowie lived here and played some of his first gigs on the High Street and in a local park. The countryside is nearby and reached by local transport. Three rewarding days out are to the Royal Observatory and museums at Greenwich, Down House where Charles Darwin wrote the Origin of Species and a little further afield to Chartwell the family home of Winston Churchill.
description: A quiet double bed, a few minutes walk from Beckenham Junction station. neighborhood_overview: The house is on a quiet street with many local restaurants, cafes, pubs, a cinema, shops and a picturesque church nearby. If you like playing tennis you can play free in the local park. Also thereÛªs a great swimming pool at Beckenham Spa and municipal golf course in the leafy Beckenham Place Park, both short walks away.
notes: I would prefer only one or other of the two rooms to be taken at the same time but both can be booked if you are in one group.
transit: This good sized terraced house is a few minutes walk from Beckenham Junction station. London Victoria is 20 minutes by train; Gatwick Airport is about one hour via the direct tram service to East Croydon. The house is on a quiet street with many local restaurants, cafes, pubs, cinema, shops and a picturesque church nearby. I have some free time when you visit to help you make the most of your stay. I may be able to drive you into the countryside, for example.
access: This large double bedroom is in the loft with private shower room next door affording privacy. You are welcome to share everything on the ground floor with me ÛÒ the kitchen, through living room, conservatory and garden.
interaction: So you really have the best of all worlds with all the attractions, hustle and bustle of London and the peace and quiet of the English countryside. I am happy to help any way I can, but equally you are welcome to come and go as you prefer. There may be off-street parking for a small car; perhaps I can drive you into the countryside, just ask. I've not included breakfast or packed lunches but if this will help let me know and we can sort something simple out.
house_rules: Sorry, smoking or pets are not allowed. A social drink is fine and you are welcome to try my home made country wine and beer if you wish, even to learn how to make it if you are interested!
host_about: Hello, I'm David and new to airbnb. I'm middle aged and married but often travel alone on short breaks. I like walking, cycling and city breaks. I welcome peace and quiet. I enjoy traditional pursuits like country dancing and wine-making.Quite often I'll stay in youth hostels to meet new people but I'd like to see what airbnb can offer and I'm now trying out hosting too. I'm having a career break so have more time to travel and host. I look forward to meeting you.

name: Charming Eco-Lodge
summary: A short 10 minute walk from Ravensbourne Station (30 minutes to Central London), The Lodge is nestled in the trees off a private road. It features a bedroom (double bed), kitchen and shower plus two sofa beds in the open plan living area.
space: A short walk from nearby Ravensbourne Station, our eco-lodge offers peace and quiet on private unmade road, with all the bustling excitement of London in well under an hour from your door.  We get a great deal of wildlife here, as we are right next to the extensive woodlands of beckenham place park: come and spot the local parakeets and jays from your own private balcony.  The eco-lodge sits detached within the grounds of our house, built to the principles of visionary green architect Walter Segal. You will have your own private entrance, with a winding, hand-built staircase leading to your door. Behind the lodge are the extensive grounds of the Bromley Court Hotel. Being so detached makes for a special atmosphere, that is very hard to find in London properties - you can't hear any traffic at all from the lodge, though the parakeets can be noisy! People have commented that the lodge feels like a Scandinavian cabin, the atmosphere really if quite unique. Watching the wildlife in the ove
description: A short 10 minute walk from Ravensbourne Station (30 minutes to Central London), The Lodge is nestled in the trees off a private road. It features a bedroom (double bed), kitchen and shower plus two sofa beds in the open plan living area. A short walk from nearby Ravensbourne Station, our eco-lodge offers peace and quiet on private unmade road, with all the bustling excitement of London in well under an hour from your door.  We get a great deal of wildlife here, as we are right next to the extensive woodlands of beckenham place park: come and spot the local parakeets and jays from your own private balcony.  The eco-lodge sits detached within the grounds of our house, built to the principles of visionary green architect Walter Segal. You will have your own private entrance, with a winding, hand-built staircase leading to your door. Behind the lodge are the extensive grounds of the Bromley Court Hotel. Being so detached makes for a special atmosphere, that is very hard to find in London
neighborhood_overview: Elstree Hill is a private oasis, part of London's Green Chain Walk - you won't feel like you are in London, but you can be deep in the City well within an hour of leaving the front gate. Green trees, big local parks and Beckenham Place Park with its 18-hole public golf course are minutes away. Bromley Town Centre, recently pedestrianized, is a shopping oasis and features the Glades shopping centre plus a number of good shops and restaurants.  Beckenham village is also close by, with a Waitrose, and a number of up-market cafes and bars (we recommend 'Fee and Brown' for a great flat white and croissant!)
notes: Complimentary tea, 1/2 pint of milk, coffee and a welcome basket is provided on arrival.  The Lodge includes cutlery, glassware, crockery and cooking utensils, pots and pans, microwave, Dyson Hoover, memory foam mattress topper, DVDs, iron and ironing board. We provide towels and bedding for up to 4 guests. Pets are welcome, but we will ask guests who choose to bring pets to pay å£40 cleaning fee to cover the extensive clean we have to do after having animals to stay. Though we do like having animals around we do ask that dog owners keep dogs on the lead in the garden as we have young children. There are extensive woodlands (and a river) just around the corner in which dogs can have the freedom to run.
transit: Ravensbourne station is a ten-minute walk away, and runs a regular service of trains into central London terminals, with Blackfriars and St. Pancras International just 30 and 40 minutes away respectively. Slightly further down the road, Shortlands station offers quick access to Victoria, and in the other direction, trains run straight into the beautiful Kentish countryside, taking 35 minutes to Sevenoaks for Knole park and the 17ty century Knole house (see (URL HIDDEN) hidden)/knole/things-to-see-and-do/). The area has good local bus routes, 3 minutes into bromley town centre, which is a shopping oasis with high street shops as well as the newly renovated 'intu' shopping centre ((website hidden)) . Busses in the other direction take you into Beckenham for a bit more cafe culture (we recommend 'Fee and Browns'), Waitrose, an Art Deco Odeon cinema, and a range of shops and restaurants.
access: You will have private access to the whole eco-lodge, with your own front door and address. The lodge has a private balcony, and you are also welcome to share our garden, with its lawn and secluded, sunlit seating areas.
interaction: We are a friendly young family, living in our house opposite the lodge. We're happy to leave you to enjoy your stay in peace, but if you need anything, feel free to knock and we'll do our best to help!
house_rules: Our rule of thumb is check in after 2pm, and check out by 11am, but we are flexible. If this isn't convenient for you, just let us know and we'll agree another arrangement. Children are welcome at the lodge, but we ask parents to make sure that the space is treated with respect. We do expect people to replace or reimburse us for anything that is broken.  NO SMOKING in The Lodge - it is a wooden cabin and smoking would pose a fire risk. There is a covered porch and smoking there is OK. NO PARTIES in the lodge. This is a quiet area, and we do not want loud music, or big crowds of people. Your booking is only for the number of guests you have paid for, or informed us about and agreed with us in advance. (We have had a bad experience previously, with 30 very young, unagreed guests arriving for a party that we did not agree to. Trying to get rid of a large group like this, to protect our property and the neighbours, was not a good experience for us!) Elstree Hill is a peaceful, exclusive st
host_about: After completing my  Phd, I worked for a few years in higher education as a Junior Lecturer. After having my second baby, I decided to change jobs. I am currently  working part-time as a counsellor for children. My husband, Joe, works in communications. Over the past 10 years we have bought run down properties, done them up, and sold them on. This is our 5th property & we plan on staying here.

neighborhood_overview: Beckenham has ancient roots dating back to Roman camps and is found in the medieval Domesday Book of 1086. It exploded in growth during the 19th century creating the beautiful Victorian center brimming with restaurants, pubs and cafes. This house was the former gatehouse to the local manor,on its private estate. The manor still exists and is now a public park and golf course ( (website hidden) "Glendale Golf Beckenham") There are large parks behind our property. Easy access to central London. Wimbledon is accessed directly by tram..David Bowie(Ziggy Stardust) is from Beckenham.

name: Christmas in a London family home
summary: You can have a homely Christmas in our Victorian house in front of a roaring fire! Only 20 minutes from London. We have 2 young kids so are well set up for families, including equipment, toys and Christmas decorations! Off-street parking for 2 cars.
space: Downstairs We have a front lounge with two sofas, a TV, Xbox, wii and gas fire (in a traditional Victoria fireplace). This is a lovely warm room with an elegant 'grown up' feel.  The sofas are very deep so comfy for lounging on. We have a collection of dvds and recorded Disney films on the Talktalk box. At the back of the house we have another lounge which opens into a Shaker style kitchen and small conservatory where the dining table is.  This is a lovely sociable space. We have toy boxes, a toy kitchen, a piano and a wall mounted tv in the lounge which makes it easy to keep an eye on the kids as they play whilst cooking in the kitchen.  There is also a fire place where you are welcome to lay a real fire (if you know what you're doing and promise not to burn the house down!). The kitchen has a large fridge/freezer, a microwave, toaster, kettle, dishwasher and washing machine. It is an extra large oven which is perfect for fitting a large turkey and all the trimmings.  We also have all

neighborhood_overview: Our house is situated in a residential part of Beckenham. It is a quiet, safe neighbourhood with other established families and couples living on our road.  We are a 20 minute walk to Beckenham high street where there are lovely cafes, restaurants, shops and a cinema.   We are 10 minutes walk from the local leisure centre called The Spa (there is a pool, gym, classes and kids soft play).  We are also 10 minutes walk to Penge high street where there are more shops. There are several lovely parks in Beckenham including Kelsey Park and Cator Park. Crystal palace park has the famous 'monsters' and a maze and small farm.  Trips into central London are also very easy with public transport.
notes: We will have Christmas decorations up in the house. There will be a small Christmas tree too which will be out of reach of toddlers. The listing is for the whole Christmas week from Sunday 20 Dec, check out between Saturday 26-Monday 28th (before 11 please).
transit: We are within a 10 minute walk from three station. 1. The closest train station is Kent House which takes 13 minute to Brixton and 20 minutes to Victoria. 2. Clockhouse is 10 minutes away and goes to Waterloo East, Charing Cross (handy for theatre trips), Lewisham and London Bridge (about 25-30 mins on the train). 3. We are 5 minutes from Avenue Road tram stop which is handy for Croydon and Wimbledon. We are 2 minutes from a bus stop which goes to Crystal Palace, Sydenham and Bromley.
access: You can use the entire house during your stay. We only let it out when we are away.  We can leave instructions for how to use appliances etc.
interaction: We plan to meet and greet our Christmas guests on the morning or afternoon of Sunday the 20th December before we leave for our own xmas holidays. This way we can walk you around the house and show you how everything works.
house_rules: It is a non smoking house and we would appreciate it if you only smoked outside. We would also appreciate if you would take your shoes off before going upstairs to preserve the carpets. We are about 7-8 on the tidy scale so would ask you to please use the house as you would your own and leave it in a state that you would like to arrive home to.

name: Beautiful, modern 2 bedroom flat
summary: This flat is available in May 2016. It is a bright and spacious 2 bedroom flat; 5 minutes walk from the town centre, 5 minutes walk from transport into the Centre of London (we are zone 4). The area is surrounded by beautiful green spaces and parks.
space: This is our home and we love it! It is comfortable and spacious for the 3 (soon to be 4) of us. We have all of the toys that make modern day easy; washing machine, tumble driers, dishwasher, power shower etc. The whole flat is double glazed which means it is very warm and extremely quiet. All of the neighbors are very friendly and we often have street BBQ's to catch up. We have 2 double bedrooms, however because we have children, the second room will have a double-airbed, rather than a "proper" bed, but you will still have all the same bedding and sheets etc.
description: This flat is available in May 2016. It is a bright and spacious 2 bedroom flat; 5 minutes walk from the town centre, 5 minutes walk from transport into the Centre of London (we are zone 4). The area is surrounded by beautiful green spaces and parks. This is our home and we love it! It is comfortable and spacious for the 3 (soon to be 4) of us. We have all of the toys that make modern day easy; washing machine, tumble driers, dishwasher, power shower etc. The whole flat is double glazed which means it is very warm and extremely quiet. All of the neighbors are very friendly and we often have street BBQ's to catch up. We have 2 double bedrooms, however because we have children, the second room will have a double-airbed, rather than a "proper" bed, but you will still have all the same bedding and sheets etc. You will have access to the entire flat while you stay here - use the space as if it were your own home. We will make some space for you in the wardrobes for your clothes, and you will
neighborhood_overview: Our Close is very quiet - you will struggle to hear any cars, occasionally planes fly over, but they aren't loud by any means. There are a few local shops close-by if you need essentials, and there is Bromley town centre just 5 minutes walk away which is great for shopping, bars and restaurants.
notes: This flat is on the 1st floor on the block, so disabled access may need to be considered - there is a short run of stairs to reach our floor, and no lift. That said, being on the first floor means you are very secure, and the area itself is very safe and quiet (we have one of the lowest crime rates in the whole of Bromley!).
transit: We're in a great spot for transport; there are loads of buses within a 5 minute walk. 10 minutes away there is a small connecting station (Sundridge Park Zone 4) that can get you up to town within 25 minutes. 15-20 minutes walk away is Bromley South (Zone 5) which can get you into Victoria in 13 minutes! You won't struggle to get anywhere from here, but you still have all the peace and quiet of more rural parts.
access: You will have access to the entire flat while you stay here - use the space as if it were your own home. We will make some space for you in the wardrobes for your clothes, and you will have fresh towels to use in the bathroom and linen on the bed, so don't worry about a thing. There will be plenty of shampoo and conditioner, as well as hair straighteners and a hair drier! We have 2 TV's, a big one for movies with friends, and a slightly smaller one mounted in the bedroom for snuggling up and watching in bed - both are easy to use and we have Netflix on both so you shouldn't struggle to find something to watch. There is also a PS3 in the bedroom for those that like gaming.
interaction: We may be around when you first arrive, but are planning a big trip away, so it's likely that you will speak to a friend who can organise the keys and any help you might need. As this is our home, things do occasionally need fixing and we haven't got a formal management company; just let us know and we will come to an arrangement.
house_rules: Treat this as your own home, but no shoes on the carpets please - we try to keep them as clean as our 1 year old son will allow, so don't get hung up on a bit of dirt here and there, but please try to avoid stains and mud. We will email you with a detailed run-down of the flat and area; just bits that will make your experience (and ours) happier.
host_about: My wife and I love to travel - we have two young children who love meeting people and making new friends. We try to 'live like locals' when we visit somewhere new, experiencing life as we would if we lived there.
street: Harleyford, Bromley, Greater London BR1 3HW, United Kingdom

host_about: People and life lover with always positive state of mind, open mind and as my friends say, friendly and very outgoing. They would also admit, a bit too stubborn sometimes.I guess you can call me a Londoner now, as I live in London for over nine years now and absolutely loving it! I develop here the music entertainment production company, Iconique Performance. When I do not work, I dance latin jazz, salsa and bachata, I spend time with my friends over a drink or two, in one of many amazing London bars (often with live music in), or I travel. In life I try to treat people the way I would like to be treated. I do not regret anything I have done because everything is a lesson that helps me grow. Smile is my business card and the rest is a story...This is me, Aleksandra :)

host_about: I'm a friendly outgoing chap who nevertheless respects the privacy of others.  I'm a University lecturer in Arts (especially fashion and textiles) and languages with a young, liberal  and enquiring outlook on life.I love to travel and speak French, Italian (a bit rusty!) and Spanish (a bit rustic!!) as well a working as an English Language teacher from beginner  to Masters level students Currently learning Arabic (early days)I love living in London in general and Brockley in particular, it's so open and green and so good for transport. I would be happy to share my  pretty expert advice based on 25 years of living in the capital.I have great, quiet neigbours in the 2 flats below, so I only ask two houserules beyond keeping the place clean and being mutually respectful: please don't SLAM the doors and please don't stomp on the floors!!I do smoke the occasional cigarillo or cigarette - but only do so with the windows open or, in fact, often in the garden! I also burn aromatherapy oils to freshen the atmosphere! I look forward to welcoming you!!

summary: We live in a spacious, homely and welcoming house in Petts Wood, just a four minute walk from the station providing 30 minute direct links into the heart of central London. space: Our home is a spacious, homely and welcoming semi-detached house in Petts Wood, just a four minute walk from the station providing 30 minute direct links into the heart of central London, great for relaxing in after a busy day of sightseeing in London or visiting the wonderful nearby attractions and seaside towns along the Kent and Sussex coasts.   Downstairs is open and free flowing, with a lovely light filled playroom / conservatory filled with toys for children from birth - four years of age. Kids love it! The conservatory opens directly into the garden. The heart of our home is the spacious country-style kitchen diner, with an extendible 8 seater dining table with dishwasher, washing machine and tumble dryer. We will always welcome you with a selection of grocery essentials. For larger groups the dining table can be moved into the adjoining dining room (which links the living room and play area/conservatory).  At the front of the house is our cosy living room, with flat screen TV (

Downstairs is open and free flowing, with a lovely light filled playroom / conservatory filled with toys for children from birth - four years of age. Kids love it! T
neighborhood_overview: We live in a lovely little sub-urban area called Petts Wood Village, just a 5 min walk to the station platform. The village square is centred around an historic old pub (a listed building) and surrounded by local restaurant and cafÌ©s. The rest of Petts Wood is largely residential, and you have easy access to local supermarkets and playgrounds. We will provide details of our favourite places to eat in our home pack, with options for both adult and family friendly dining.  Within a few minutes walk you can access National Trust Woodlands, offering beautiful scenic walks to nearby Chislehurst - a great destination for a pub lunch.
transit: Petts Wood Station offers easy access to the heart of London, with direct links to London Bridge, London Cannon Street, London Waterloo East, London Victoria and London Charing Cross, all reachable in approx 30 mins. We advise checking your trains before travelling as sometimes as sometimes weekend works can disrupt the service and alternative routes may need to be found.  We are also within a ten minute drive of the M25, making the south-east and beyond very easily accessible by car. Historic Greenwich is a 20 min drive away, or 30 mins on the train and DLR.
access: You will have access to roam the whole house during your stay, excluding the garage where we will store any items that you won't want in the way.
interaction: We offer our home with the intention to use the opportunity to travel ourselves. Therefore we probably won't be available in person, except to welcome you, but we will be available on the phone for any questions.
house_rules: We are happy for everyone to enjoy our home as they please whilst being respectful and sensible. Our carpets are light coloured so no shoes inside please.  Smoking is allowed outside only (away from any open doors or windows please!) as long as all butts are placed in the designated bin. We ask of guests to be respectful of our neighbours, i.e. no excessive noise late at night and so on.
host_about: We are a family of four with two young children, 3 and 1, Weekends are spent getting out and about, whether it be into London to see the many sights or exploring the  local farms and attractions and the wider Kent countryside. We also love driving down to the coast for the day, with out favourite destinations being Whitstable, Beachy Head and Brighton. Travel is a huge part of our lives. Not only have we holidayed in Thailand, Sri Lanka, Turkey, Tanzania, New York and Italy, as well as many city breaks - our favourites being Berlin and Venice - but we go to Denmark a couple of times a year to visit family. Our jaunts abroad have certainly taken a turn for the Canaries since the children arrived, but some of our most exciting experiences have been on the less well planned trips. We are partial to a box set and can get caught up for hours in our favourite shows - currently Homeland and Breaking Bad. We love to entertain at home, and our house makes it a joy to have people over. We both work in boring jobs in London, but please don't let that out you off :)

notes: What the guests have to say: November 2013 One guest from Rome, Italy writes: Rakesh is a nice host, ready to meet your needs, to exchange chats and cultural opinions, travel and cooking experiences; probably, you should not even ask: he will be friendly helpful in everything. Thanks!  November 2013 One guest from India writes: Rakesh is the most wonderful host and an Encyclopaedia of knowledge about history, art & culture about things all over the world & specially London. I stayed in Rakesh's home with my, then girlfriend / Now wife. It was an extremely pleasant and comfortable stay. The house is very close to different means of transports (train & bus) and various Shops of daily needs. Central London is just a short train ride away. Rakesh even showed us around London, he arranged for us to see a wonderful play at a theatre and took us to some rather inaccessible parties since he gets exclusive invitations to them and he was far too kind to take us with him AND he cooked Fish & Chip
transit: 24 hour public transport. Night buses from Central London stop in front of the house.
access: There are two toilets, one bath, one shower and a large kitchen with a table for eating.  There are lovely parks and lakes at a walking distance.  The place is very central via the overground from Crystal Palace and/or Anerley which will lead you to CENTRAL in London within 30 minutes.
interaction: Sometimes, we host parties. We generally cook vegetarian food but sometimes good food and fine wine are shared.  I have lived in this area for many years and can provide you with information and guidance during your stay in London.  According to the guests, I am a great host, quiet and easy going and I am looking forward to meeting you.
house_rules: Behave in the same way you expect your guests to behave.
host_about: Self-praise is no recommendation. I shall quote words from some of the guests who wrote about me on cs site in various languages.Jay Kintana Paris, France Aug 14 , Surfed 3 days  PositiveRakesh is an amazing host. He gives the best to his guest, to make them feel confortable.He always has a joke or two about many subjects. Chatting with him is just a pleasure as he knows a lot about many subjects: you will share ideas and real conversation not only about the weather.Rakesh is an excellent cooker, I loved the indian food he made. And, as I am a vegetarian, he always took a good care my food did not touched meat. I thought it was sweet and kind from him as he did not has to think about it.Rakesh, Tim and I had a lovely time with you and hope you enjoy what we shared together.Thank you a lot.From lucila Masera Madrid, SpainRakesh es una de las personas mÌÁs generosas que conocÌ_ en mi vida. Nos preparÌ_ comida riquÌ_sima todos los dÌ_as y nos ayudÌ_ con todo lo que necesitabamos. Fue mi primera vez haciendo couchsurfing y realmente fue una muy linda experienciaMadeleine Turner La Verne, United States  PositiveRakesh was one of the most welcoming and altruistic people Megan and I have ever met. When we arrived at his home he provided us a delicious cooked meal, then proceeded to show us parts of London which are off the beaten track for the average tourist. It was a very comfortable stay.If he was ever in California, we would be happy to host him!Johannes Rau Saarbruecken, Germany Aug 1 4 days  PositiveObwohl noch AnfÌ_nger auf Couchsurfing, habe ich gleich mit meinem ersten Host viel GlÌ_ck gehabt. Pappu ist ein sehr hilfreicher und sorgender Gastgeber und ermÌ¦glichte so mir und meiner Tochter ein spannendes Wochenende in London (mit Kindern ist die Hostsuche eh schon viel schwieriger). Gab uns viele gute Tipps und wir hatten interessante GesprÌ_che Ì_ber Reisen, Frankreich und Wein (inkl. kurzer Kinoshow -- ein Kurzfilm mit Gerad Depardieu). Auch unsere schrecklichen An- und Abreisezeiten waren kein Problem fÌ_r ihn. Vielen Dank und gerne wieder!! :)From Yeji Jo Busan, South Korea Jul 30 Met in person Surfed 3 days  PositiveRakesh  is a very amazing man. He offered me (and my friend )everything he can. He gave us pretty cozy place to sleep and very delicious food and tea. Ola SÌÉÛ_awiÌÉÛ_ska Rugby, England Jul 21 3 days  PositiveRakesh is a very kind, knowledgeable man who can prepare a DELICIOUS dinner and make you laugh while you are enjoying the food. He is the best guide, and staying with him was a pure pleasure. He told us (me and my boyfriend) what we should visit in London such as Tate Modern or Japanese Tea Ceremony on Piccadilly. It was amazing! He also explained to us how to move around the City which proved to be very helpful. In the evenings we sat and talked about everything. He shared with us a lot of experiences and stories about his past and travels. It is a shame we stayed with Rakesh only for two nights but our stay was full of fun and unforgettable time. Thank you very much and I hope to meet you again very soon!Cezary LipiÌÉÛ_ski Nottingham, England Jul 21 Met in person Surfed 3 days  PositiveRakesh is a very kind and genuine man, he has done a lot of things in his life, and has extensive knowledge on a variety of subjects. You can spend hours and hours on discussions on music, politics, travels or art.He is a great cook - he made us several dishes (e.g. a great Indian Soup made to his mother's recipe). We had a great time listening to some of the stories from his past, for example an elephant stealing bananas from a banana tree in his back garden in India! He knows London like nobody else and he proved to be priceless when it came to advising us on what to see and how to get there. He was always very generous to us and happy to help. We could not have wished for a better host. And we hope to meet him again in the very near future. Thank you once again. Tina Liashchuk Wroclaw, Poland Jul 20 Met in person Surfed 3 days  PositiveMany thanks to Rakesh, it was really lovely experience to stay at his place. Wise man with good heart, thoughtful, very experienced and educated, I could spend hours talking to him. Rakesh gave us some very useful tips what to see in London. Also he is a god cook, indian food was really delicious!I hope to see you in Poland!Francesco Savi Terranova dei Passerini, Italy Jul 19 Met in person Surfed 3 days  PositiveTime permitting, I can be a good guide too. One can get an idea of London as explored by me and my guests...A reference from a guest from Brazil: I think there are two kinds of hosts: the ones who just rent you a room and expect you to respect a list of rules and there are the ones who cares about your travel experience. Rakesh is definitely in the second group. I told him, before I get in there, that I'd twisted my feet, so a cane was waiting for me. He always was interested in knowing about my day and plans and he tried to help as much as he could, even taking me to places. My room had a nice view of trees and rooftops of Crystal Palace. The flat is really close to rail station and a bus stop is just in front. Close to the rail station there is a Tesco, so I usually bought my lunch there and then would eat during the 30 a hour silent train trip to the center city.November 2013One guest from Rome, Italy writes:Rakesh is a nice host, ready to meet your needs, to exchange chats and cultural opinions, travel and cooking experiences; probably, you should not even ask: he will be friendly helpful in everything. Thanks!November 2013 One guest from India writes:Rakesh is the most wonderful host and an Encyclopaedia of knowledge about history, art & culture about things all over the world & specially London. I stayed in Rakesh's home with my, then girlfriend / Now wife. It was an extremely pleasant and comfortable stay.The house is very close to different means of transports (train & bus) and various Shops of daily needs. Central London is just a short train ride away.Rakesh even showed us around London, he arranged for us to see a wonderful play at a theatre and took us to some rather inaccessible parties since he gets exclusive invitations to them and he was far too kind to take us with him AND he cooked Fish & Chips for us.I would definitely recommend Rakesh.February 2013One local guest writes:I have known Rakesh for many years after we were connected by a mutual friend in New York.He is an incredibly friendly guy and very generous with his time and resources. Over the years, we have met at various social events and he has a very gentle and friendly presence.He would be a great host and one day soon I might even get to taste his vegetarian food:-)August 2013Another reference from a guest from Brazil: I think there are two kinds of hosts: the ones who just rent you a room and expect you to respect a list of rules and there are the ones who cares about your travel experience. Rakesh is definitely in the second group. I told him, before I get in there, that I'd twisted my feet, so a cane was waiting for me. He always was interested in knowing about my day and plans and he tried to help as much as he could, even taking me to places. My room had a nice view of trees and rooftops of Crystal Palace. The flat is really close to rail station and a bus stop is just in front. Close to the rail station there is a Tesco, so I usually bought my lunch there and then would eat during the 30 a hour silent train trip to the center city.Fr:Rakesh est un journaliste passionnÌ© par les voyages. Il aime rencontrer des nouvelles personnes venant des 4 coins du monde et c'est pour cela qu'il met a disposition 2 de ses chambres de son coquet appartement situÌ© prÌ¬s du magnifique parc de cristal palace.Grazie mille a Pappu per averci ospitato a Londra!!! Ì¬ stata proprio una bella esperienza, lui Ì¬ molto gentile e la sua casa Ì¬ comoda... grazie anche per le chiaccherate che abbiamo fatto, tutte molto interessanti; anche il fatto di sapere che c'Ì¬ un uomo indiano che conosce molti personaggi italiani importanti che si recano a Londra per conferenze e silimi, all'ambasciata e al centro culturale italiano... veramente strano! per il formaggio, se avrÌ_ la prossima volta un formaggio che si puÌ_ trasportare e conservare, lo potrai assaggiare! Ciao!Manuela.and.Alessandro Antibes, France May 30 Met in person Couchsurfing Friend, Hosted 1 days  PositiveWe hosted Pappu for one night.It seemed to us that you know how to adapt easily. Polite and nice.Very nice and helpful the gift that has brought us.We are happy to have known him!Rakesh Ì¬ una brava persona molto gentile. Mi ha spiegato le differenze circa le religiosi presenti in India e mi ha fatto provare il cibo indicato chiamato Moon Daad un mix di carote Chantenay e mascarpone. Ìö molto disponibile e anche abile a darti consigli sui trasporti londinesi per arrivare alla tua destinazione. Gli piace condividere interessi ed esperienza ed Ì¬ molto curioso di imparare le parole e la lingua italiana. Se hai un problema non esitare a contattare Rakesh.

summary: The private room is in a flat is 3 minute walk to Penge East Railway Station, which is 20 minutes train journey from Victoria. space: A comfortable single room is in a spacious three bedroom flat only three minutes walk to by Penge East station which is 20 minutes directly from Victoria Station. You will stay in our recently furnished single room  with access to our shiny new bathroom, kitchen and lounge and dining room. Our bathroom has recently been completely redone and we have a shower booth, washbasin and a separate toilet room. We generally hang out in the large lounge area and we've got a suitably large TV, the room is also big enough for the dining area. neighborhood_overview: Sydenham high street has supermarkets, banks, pharmacies, post offices, cafes, pubs and restaurants.  Penge High street hosts larger supermarkets and shops too.  Sydenham high street hosts some excellent pubs, restaurants, cafes and pop up craft beer establishments. We also live close to Crystal Palace park which boasts a Victorian Dinosaur park, the National Sports Centre.  As well as green spaces, Crystal Palace also has great restaurants, accessible by bus or a 15-20 minutes walk uphill. The flat itself is one in a low rise block of six which were built as social housing in the 1950's but are now privately owned.
notes: You'll be able to help yourself to tea and coffee provided, and access the WIFI. Help yourself to shampoo. Iron and ironing board is at your disposal as is the washing machine and dishwasher.
transit: The flat is a three minute walk from Penge East station, which will take you to Victoria in 20 minutes. On week days they run every 15 minutes. Sydenham station is a ten minute walk away which connects to London Bridge and London Overground services to Canada Water and Shoreditch High Street, which run about 6 trains an hour.  Penge West station is about 13 minute walk away too. There is a bus stop 1 minute walk away, which can connect you to Sydenham station, Penge High street, Croydon and Lewisham. The 176 24 hour night bus is about 10 minutes walk away on Penge High street. To the south of London trains run to South Bromley and Croydon, the latter of which allows for easy to access to Gatwick airport.
access: The kitchen is large enough for 2 people to use simultaneously. We cook most nights in the week but there is plenty of space and you're welcome to share it with us.  A washing machine is available for use too. You'll have the room as your private space and access to the shared kitchen, lounge/diner and bathroom and toilet.
interaction: We've both lived in London for many years and we both work full time. We are usually around after work in the week and over the weekends. We'll be up for a chat in the evenings and happy tell you about the local area as well as our favourite parts of Greater London itself.
house_rules: You'll have a key so you'll be welcome to come and go as you like, but please be considerate about noise on work days evening, as we both work regular office hours.
host_about: Londoner born and bred, who loves travel

The house has an open plan living room / dining room / kitchen in the ground floor which is the heart of the home. The dining room opens up to the garden giving it a lovely inside / outside feel. We have underfloor heating in these rooms which makes it very cosy.     On the ground floor we also have a toilet where the washing machine / dryer is kept. neighborhood_overview: Cudham is a typical charming rural English village. The local pub is 5 minutes walk from the house, across the cricket ground, where there is also a small children's playground. Several footpaths pass close to the house giving you plenty of opportunities for countryside walks. The historic airfield of Biggin Hill is 10 minutes away and the village of Downe, former home of Charles Darwin is 3 miles away. The town of Orpington is 10 minutes drive away where you can take the train to Central London in 20 minutes.
transit: There is a bus service that serves Cudham from Orpington. A taxi from Orpington station costs approximately å£10. The house is 30 minutes drive from London Gatwick Airport, 1 hour from London Stansted and 1.15 from London Heathrow. There is plenty of safe, secure parking outside the house.

The Sydenham area has a great mixture of city and quiet. The streets are tree-lined and there are many green parks around including Crystal Palace, but we've also got a busy high street and shops close at hand.   Public transport connections are excellent. There are two mainline/overground stations close by with direct trains to central London: Victoria, London Bridge, Blackfriars, Canada Water, Highbury and Islington; and to south London: Croydon and Bromley.

The last train from London Victoria to Shortlands is 23:50pm Last train to Bromley is 12.30am. If you plan to stay out till the early hours, there is a night bus from London to Bromley, or Uber taxi from London is about å£25. Heading in the other direction out to the countryside and coast, if you fancy a day trip you can easily get to: The beautiful village of Shoreham. Whitstable, (very pretty fishing town with fabulous sunsets and oysters). Eastbourne and Bexhill beaches. Chartwell, (house and gardens of Sir Winston Churchill). And so much more!

The seaside is about an hour away by train if you fancy venturing further.

All the house including the garden, but please remember that this is my home - there will be some personal things of mine in the house during your stay. I won't be on the property if you booked the whole house (this listing) but will be available on the phone or email to help with any queries. This is my home, not a vacation rental so there will be personal items of mine in the house during your stay. neighborhood_overview: The cottage is in zone 4 (Heathrow Airport is zone 6) so it's close enough to Central London to get there in a little over 20 minutes, but is a quiet leafy suburb where you can hear birds singing and if you listen carefully, the church bell at St George's Church, Beckenham, striking the hour.
notes: The house is very close to the railway station, which is incredibly handy, but also very close to the railway line. Trains don't run all night (midnight to 6am) but you will hear them during the day especially if you are sitting in the garden. They are every 15 mins or so (every 30 mins early mornings and late evenings) but they all stop at the station so aren't thundering through. They may disturb you if you are a light sleeper so maybe bring ear-plugs if this is likely to bother you. Most people don't tend to notice after a night and some people don't really notice them at all.
transit: Cator Cottage is one minute from New Beckenham Station and as such you won't have any problems getting into central London, which can be done in around 22 minutes. There is also a car park on the other side of the railway line, where you can park for around å£1.80 per day.
access: All the house including the garden, but please remember that this is my home - there will be some personal things of mine in the house during your stay.
interaction: I won't be on the property if you booked the whole house (this listing) but will be available on the phone or email to help with any queries. This is my home, not a vacation rental so there will be personal items of mine in the house during your stay.
house_rules: Please treat my home as you would your own. Please don't let children play the piano unless they actually 'play the piano' The piano lid is delicate and I've had to get it repaired twice in the first 12 months of owning it. No smoking in the house. Please read the instructions for altering the heating controls. If you need help with the heating, message me and I can alter the settings remotely. For security reasons, there is a recording motion detector pointing at the back doors. I will always switch it off when I have a booking, but if you feel uncomfortable about it being there, please place a cloth over it rather than unplugging or moving it - if you move it, I have to come over there to put it back into position.
host_about: Friendly, sober, new to hosting. Love to travel and will hopefully love to host.

Crystal Palace park also has a children's farm, a playground, a maze, an outdoor concert stage and plenty of green space to run about in. For sport fans you could take in a Premier League football match at Selhurst Park. Crystal Palace is also home to the Crystal Palace National Sports Centre  with a 45 station gym, swimming pools, a climbing wall, athletics track as well as other indoor and a range of other outdoor facilities is within the park. Bromley is a large suburban area whithin the administrative headquarters of the Greater London. It was historically a market town chartered since 1158 and an ancient parish in the county of Kent. As part of the suburban growth of London in the 20th century, Bromley significantly increased in population and was incorporeted as a municipal borough. The town has a large retail area, including a pedestrianised High Street and the Intu Bromley centre. he main shopping mall. The shopping area includes retailers such as Gap, Oasis, Russell & Bromley, Waterstone's, Zara, Massimo Dutti, HMV and many more. The area also offers a good choice of restaurants. Bromley has a number of theatres, the most notable being the Churchill Theatre in the town centre and the Bromley Little Theatre close to Bromley North railway stat

The town has a large retail area, including a pedestrianised High Street and the Intu Bromley centre. he main shopping mall. The shopping area includes retailers such as Gap, Oasis, Russell & Bromley, Waterstone's, Zara, Massimo Dutti, HMV and many more. The area also offers a good choice of restaurants. Bromley has a number of theatres, the most notable being the Churchill Theatre in the town centre and the Bromley Little Theatre close to Bromley North railway station.

host_about: About the HomestayI have hosted many foreign students over the past 3 years and I have vast experience . I understand that students want independence whilst away from home as for many this may be their first time traveling and they want to experience life, but it can be also be very over welming that's where I come in . I'm here always for any help it may be for a little to a lot,  from something as simple travel information to helping cope with home sickness. We are also a wheelchair access house , with wider door frames and ramps in place. We are very accommodimg to any requirements , be it diet, religion or culture. We have pets which consist of 2 gold fish, a hamster and 2 ginunea pigs. Our home is not a tipical London home but we love it . It is not modern and is lived in , so if you are looking for 5 star please don't book to stay with us but if you are looking to be welcomed to a friendly family whom would love to make your time in England a happy one then this is the place for you We have 3 children , a boy 22 who works away from home and 2 girls (11 and 10) , they enjoy meeting new people and learning about different cultures. FREE WIFI in the house and garden area

host_about: We are Steven, Evi & and our little white dog Lumi. We live in a large peaceful house in a zone 6 suburb of London, perfect to return to after a long day sightseeing or travelling. We are professional musicians but have also worked in the City so are attune to the varying needs of travellers! We travel across Europe playing shows so like to take in new places, experiences and bring a bit of that home every time. Our passion apart from music is interior design, so slowly improving the house to industrial chic Berlin-esq style.We pride ourselves on being relaxed, friendly and helpful, whilst giving people as much space and peace as they need.The house (maybe rarely!)  is also 'band' friendly, in that we have had bands stay here to use the local recording/rehearsal Ascape studio in Bromley. We are professional musicians so understand the requirements and jargon needed to make it a comfortable relaxing stay away from the studio sessions.We are happy to welcome respectful travellers to our home.

House is in the high street lots good restaurants and cafes to sit outside if sunny we are  next to large ponds and woodland if you like wild life and walking. Just 18 minutes by train to london bridge or 25 minutes  from Charring Cross.
