neighborhood_overview: Chislehurst is a beautiful small village set in the middle of a large green common and lots of  woodland and fields we have 2 ponds and miles of walks outside the front door, plus 10 restaurants and cafes and 4 pubs. People move here as its so green but its so close to london and only 1 hour from the sea. Car rental is minutes away.
notes: I can guarantee staying here will be an experience like no there as we like to laugh a lot and draw a lot too as my art studio is here too so you can do some drawing with felt pens if you feel the need to relax.   You will also  meet Victor the Volvo who i am shooting people on for a major project  (URL HIDDEN)   The house is full of my photography so expect creative conversations.   Heres a video of my ltd edition pictures of The Rolling (URL HIDDEN) and celebrating the people of Great Britain (URL HIDDEN)  If you love photography and would like a Duncan day out. Then please advise me as my PA handles these very different days out.  I took Lionel Ritchie out for a day to shoot a day in his life and he kindly said ''that was a day like no other '' Duncan
transit: The train station is 15 minutes walk alongside beautiful woodland There are Buses and trains direct to london with an 18 minute service to london Bridge or  and 25 minutes to Charring Cross so for visitors thats next to the famous  Trafalgar square and 10 minutes walk from Buckingham palace  services. The other station is Bickley which has trains to Victoria 25 minutes.
access: You will have use of the kitchen and cool lounge gallery area we have sliding doors to garden opposite local church
interaction: You will be staying with me Duncan a rather unique photographer I worked all over the world for 25 years with superstars such as The Rolling stones Tina turner and others the house is full of my pictures and now offer people various Duncan experiences wild days out full of fun . I live my son Tom 21 the trendiest young man who like me loves people we just love people and thats the only reason to let people stay here as we are creating a kindness movement and want to interact with other cultures.  So be prepared for very creative conversations or you can spend time on your own as the room is separate from the rest of the house. People rather different ask how I became a photographer so heres my story in felt (URL HIDDEN) a little story (URL HIDDEN)  lots more i could say.  In essence you are going to meet a rather unique artist and his son and daughter Katie a singer songwriter oh and very friendly neighbours we all meet every morning in the Coffee shop next door so if you are from othe
house_rules: No smoking in the house.  We like posh cheeses and nice wine.
host_about: A person who loves people and is developing a kindness exhibtion using his photographs of the wonderful people as  I have said hello A STRANGER EVERY DAY around Great Britain for 10 years. An artist photographer (URL HIDDEN)  a little story (URL HIDDEN)   my life mottos do what you love and the money will follow say hello to a stranger every day and your heart will glow daily and you will make the hearts glow of the people you say hello to and say something nice a compliment as we all in truth want to be loved and liked.  Try to say hello to our fabulous oldies as they're our walking libraries of wisdom

name: Bright and chic loft opposite park
summary: Newly built 1 bedroom loft apartment in a stunning 1880s Victorian house. Uninterrupted views of Crystal Palace park and the dinosaurs, as well as the South Downs. Finished to a high standard with hotel features, this is a luxurious home from home.
space: A converted loft in a beautiful Victorian home. The apartment was finished in 2016 with design and functionality at the fore. It's is the perfect size for visitors to London looking for a comfortable, stylish and well connected home from home.  All the finishes are new or lovingly refurbished with a eclectic mix of high end and antique finds. Theres also plenty of coffee table books, magazines and a tv should you not wish to leave the apartment! The house is located directly opposite Crystal Palace park with the famous dinosaurs and beautifully landscaped grounds and sports centre. There's a wealth of bars, excellent pubs, restaurants, coffee shops and fabulous vintage stores in the Triangle, all of which are within a short walk away. Excellent train connections to central London (17 mins to London Bridge and 23 to Victoria) and an easy (one change) journey to Gatwick make this a perfect base to explore our vibrant city The bedroom has a wonderful walk in closet space with plenty of ha

neighborhood_overview: After living all over London we have finally settled in Crystal Palace in 2013 and absolutely love the neighbourhood. It's a perfect mix of greenery, fantastic pubs, nice community and good connections to central London. I'm more than happy to recommend a dozen local places to eat, drink and play. It's perhaps not the best location for those wanting to party, but you can reach East London and Peckham very easily should you want more buzzing night-life.
notes: We live on the floor below so are always easily reached should you need anything.
transit: Free parking is available on the street outside the house. Crystal Palace, Penge West and Penge East are all within a 10 minute walk, connecting you to London Bridge, London Victoria and Shoreditch/East London via train. Taxis are also easily arranged should you need.
access: You'll have the entire apartment to yourselves. There is a private entrance and use of the communal garden should you wish.
interaction: Myself or my husband will be available any time to help with London recommendations or anything to do with the apartment of your stay.
house_rules: Please no smoking, parties or pets.  We've put a lot of love and care into renovating this apartment and sourcing the furniture. We'd love you to treat it as your home but please respect the property and our neighbours.
host_about: I grew up in Sydney, but have spent the last 9 years living in London. I often travel with work and have spend many months in foreign cities, exploring and soaking up new cultures. I'm always up for a chat and a glass of wine, but am equally happy to leave others to their own devices.

name: Self-contained log cabin
summary: A large log cabin with lounge,kitchen,shower\toilet and Double bedroom. Situated in the historic village of Downe and neighbours of "Charles Darwin". Buses run hourly and serve both Bromley and Orpington Stations and London is 30 minutes away.
space: Our Log cabin is  well built and spacious with all mod cons. It has a kitchen with washing machine ,dishwasher, small oven/microwave, hob & fridge (website hidden) , radio and Free Wifi . Very cosy ,set in our big garden.
description: A large log cabin with lounge,kitchen,shower\toilet and Double bedroom. Situated in the historic village of Downe and neighbours of "Charles Darwin". It has a kitchen with washing machine ,dishwasher, small oven/microwave, hob & fridge (website hidden) , radio and Free Wifi . Very cosy ,set in our big garden. Our big garden ,surrounded by lovely country side We will be in our cottage a stones throw from the Log cabin and always on hand if you need any help or advice. We live in the historic village of Downe ,surrounded by country side but in under one hour you can be in the centre of London. 5 minutes walk to Downe village where there are 2 pubs , a Tea shop and Indian restaurant. neighborhood_overview: We live in the historic village of Downe ,surrounded by country side but in under one hour you can be in the centre of London. 5 minutes walk to Downe village where there are 2 pubs , a Tea shop and Indian restaurant. 'Downe house ' home of Charles Darwin is 10 minutes walk away. We are also close to the historic Biggin Hill airport .
notes: We have 2 Very friendly Border Collie dogs that do like to say hello. There is a travel cot available
transit: The 146 bus takes you to Bromley South station  which runs 7 days a week and the R8  bus goes to Orpington train station Monday to Saturday.  Trains to London take 20 minutes. Excellant links.
access: Our big garden ,surrounded by lovely country side
interaction: We will be in our cottage a stones throw from the Log cabin and always on hand if you need any help or advice.
house_rules: No Smoking, Friendly Pets by arrangement as they would have to get on with our dogs. Children by arrangement although there is only 1 Bedroom and 1 double bed . There is a camp bed available.
host_about: I live in our brick and flint  cottage  built in 1860 in Downe village with my muscian  husband Ed , Son Ben and my 2 very friendly Border Collies ,Bud and Meg . We have a large garden and surrounded by beautiful country side and love living in this idyllic Village. We love walking with our dogs and being in our garden with a glass of wine  and you are very welcome to join us.

name: Double room in South London
summary: Double room available in a pretty little cottage situated in the heart of Penge.
space: Double room in a pretty 2 bed cottage in the heart of Penge. The house is bright, spacious and clean with an 18ft garden.   The room looks over the garden and has a double bed with plenty of storage and a small TV (with freeview). The cottage estate where my house is situated is a quiet, pretty and friendly area - you'll think you're in the country, not South East London!
description: Double room available in a pretty little cottage situated in the heart of Penge. Double room in a pretty 2 bed cottage in the heart of Penge. The house is bright, spacious and clean with an 18ft garden.   The room looks over the garden and has a double bed with plenty of storage and a small TV (with freeview). The cottage estate where my house is situated is a quiet, pretty and friendly area - you'll think you're in the country, not South East London! Welcome to use all shared area's as your own - Kitchen, Bathroom, Living Room, Dining Room and Garden. You're welcome to use the washing machine, dishwasher, TV etc. as you need. My work and social commitments vary so interaction will depend on that so you should just feel comfortable to relax and treat the place as home for the duration of your stay.  Penge itself has many cafes and parks including the Crystal Palace park which is a 15 minute walk.   The local high street (s Supermarket, Tesco Express, butchers (+Halal), bakeries and ind
neighborhood_overview: Penge itself has many cafes and parks including the Crystal Palace park which is a 15 minute walk.   The local high street (s Supermarket, Tesco Express, butchers (+Halal), bakeries and independent home ware shops.  The list goes on!
notes: I will provide clean sheets and towels. There is tea and coffee etc for general use. The garden has a gas bbq for the nicer weather. If you have any questions please message me and I'll get back to you as soon as possible.
transit: The surrounding area (Crystal Palace, Sydenham, Lewisham, Bromley, Croydon etc) are all serviced by regular local buses and two that run as 24 hour/night services into and out of central London. Closest train station is Penge East (5 min walk) 17 mins to London Victoria with trains running every 15 mins day time, more during the morning rush hour.   There is also Penge West station (10 min walk) with trains direct to London Bridge (19 min journey) and the Overground network towards East London.
access: Welcome to use all shared area's as your own - Kitchen, Bathroom, Living Room, Dining Room and Garden. You're welcome to use the washing machine, dishwasher, TV etc. as you need.
interaction: My work and social commitments vary so interaction will depend on that so you should just feel comfortable to relax and treat the place as home for the duration of your stay.
house_rules: No smoking in the house but feel free in the garden (I can provide ash trays) and please tidy up after yourself. Other than that, please feel comfortable and enjoy your stay!
host_about: I'm Kay and you'll be sharing the house with me.  I'm a busy bee and keep unregimented timings.  I usually work office hours and try to be home in the evenings but that rarely happens so you'll have the house to yourself often enough!I'm easy going and generally tidy.  I often have baking on the go for various friends and family occasions so if you like to test the cakes before general consumption then make sure you're around the kitchen when I'm making a mess!The area is pretty with great transport links so take a look at the pics and I hope to speak to you soon.

There are number of stores open far later than normal which is always handy! It's such a great place to be for communications as the beautiful parks of South London are close by as is the access to the City and West End.

name: Cozy Family Home in Kent, Room #1
summary: Our family home is in leafy Kent on a quiet street, with easy access to green fields and woodland. The village shops and station are within walking distance, central London is just a 40 minute train ride away, or Bromley shopping centre a short bus or car ride.
space: Our house is warm a friendly. Our guest bedroom is big enough for two, with two single beds. We have a separate listing for a room with a double bed. There is a wardrobe and chest of drawers, and a big window looking out to the garden. There is also a television with sky channels.
description: Our family home is in leafy Kent on a quiet street, with easy access to green fields and woodland. The village shops and station are within walking distance, central London is just a 40 minute train ride away, or Bromley shopping centre a short bus or car ride. Our house is warm a friendly. Our guest bedroom is big enough for two, with two single beds. We have a separate listing for a room with a double bed. There is a wardrobe and chest of drawers, and a big window looking out to the garden. There is also a television with sky channels. We have a shower room and toilet especially for guests, and share the use if the kitchen, dining room, living room and garden We will be present at the listing during guest's stay, but will be at work/school during the day, and out some evenings. There will always be someone available on the phone for any advice or problems and we are happy to chat when home. Our neighbourhood is suburban, friendly and quiet, away from the busy roads and hustle and bus
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is suburban, friendly and quiet, away from the busy roads and hustle and bustle of town. We have some good pubs and restaurants nearby and shops are easily reachable. If the lights of London are calling, we have a station in Hayes village to get you there and back in no time. There is a theatre in Bromley nearby, or you may want to go further into the countryside and feed the animals at Christmas Tree Farm. There are lots of day trips to take as trains from Bromley South will take you out to the Kent coast and all stops in between. Or you may just want to relax in our vintage style village tea shop and watch the world go by.
notes: As we are at work and school/uni during the week, we need to sleep at night! Therefor we have to have reasonable peace and quiet after 10pm. If you come home late and want to sleep in we will do the same for you and keep it down in the morning. We don't invite smokers as we don't smoke ourselves, and no pets please. We do have a little pug dog visit us occasionally, belonging to family member,  If you object to this happening during your stay let me know, it won't be a problem.
transit: We have two railway stations nearby, and lots of bus routes and there are no parking restrictions on our street. Gatwick is the nearest airport, but all London airports are reachable from the M25 motorway, about 30 minutes drive away. There is a fast train from Gatwick Airport to Victoria Station, and trains come from London Victoria to Bromley South, where there is a cab stand.
access: We have a shower room and toilet especially for guests, and share the use if the kitchen, dining room, living room and garden
interaction: We will be present at the listing during guest's stay, but will be at work/school during the day, and out some evenings. There will always be someone available on the phone for any advice or problems and we are happy to chat when home.
house_rules: We would expect the Kitchen to be kept clean and tidy as it is a shared area. We leave our shoes at the door, please bring indoor slippers to wear around the house. Drunken or shouty behaviour would not tolerated, we like to be nice! Please feel free to ask advice about any trips you might be planning, or just come and share an evening coffee with us This is a no smoking house.

name: Cosy apartment, 30 min from London
summary: Ground floor apartment with spacious bedroom, private tv, shared living room and bathroom with me, situated in a green leafy area in Chislehurst, greater London. You have the possibility to relax outdoors in the sunny garden with a glass of wine next to the fire and if you are lucky, you will encounter Faro and Foxy (two wild foxes that visit my garden in the mornings and evenings).
space: My place has a very long garden on the south side which means very sunny! So it's the perfect place to relax outside and enjoy a nice BBQ with a glass of wine in the sun. You will only hear the sound of the birds chirping as the main road is too far to hear the cars. So all in all very relaxing.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood could best be described as a small town outside London with lots of green forest areas and big villas. It feels like the English countryside to me, extremely relaxing.
notes: I have two wild foxes (Faro and Foxy) visiting my garden in the mornings evenings so you might encounter both of them if you're lucky. They are beautiful and very intuitive animals. Foxy (the female) is darker brown and Faro (the male) has a more golden brown color with a white fluffy tale. Recently a baby fox has arrived as well which is called Fion. I am not sure if the baby is from Faro and Foxy, but I have seen and heard them mating in my garden.
transit: Elmstead Woods Rail station is the nearest train station to my house (10 min walk) and St Keverne Road the nearest bus station (2 min walk). From Elmstead Woods it takes about 20 - 25 min to get to the city center of London by a direct train.
access: You will have access to your room, the living room, the bathroom, the kitchen and garden.
interaction: I'm mostly at home the whole day during week days as I paint and work from home. If you are up for it, I'm always very happy to have dinner together. For a few days you can just pretend that my house is home for you, and that's how I want you to feel during your visit.
host_about: Passionate about art (painting) & skateboarding, love traveling, experiencing new cultures & connecting to the locals. Very impulsive & always up for an adventure.

name: Overdale Villa Apartment Bromley
summary: An immaculate 1 double bed, self catering apartment annexed to a bungalow in a peaceful, friendly and relaxed leafy suburb of South London, with easy access to local amenities and all areas of London and beyond. The area is enriched with natural surroundings , ample wildlife and recreational parks including golf.
space: This is a  bright and cosy Double bed, self catering apartment. It is a quaint annexe to a bungalow in a leafy suburbia of London. It is located in a peaceful,private, friendly and a secluded area of Bromley, London with ample natural/ wildlife to enjoy.  The property is well-located with easy transport access to the city and much of the  beautiful countryside which surrounds London . The nearest Train Stations are Bromley South and North, Grove Park and Ravensbourne. You can get into  Central London in about 30 minutes. Travelling to Gatwick or Hearthrow Airport will take around 1 hour. Nearby you will also find many local restaurants and shops  such as The Glades and  many great local parks and various Amenities to suits all ages and abilities.  The apartment comes with free Wifi. Towels and Linens provided Meals and other services such as Cleaning, Transfers etc. can also be provided at extra cost.  If you have any questions please contact me.  I look forward to hearing from you so

name: Large Victorian house with garden
summary: AVAILABLE END JUNE & EARLY AUGUST! Recently converted, secluded & stunning Victorian house, 4 bedrooms and loads of communal space. In Crystal Palace, a bustling London village packed with restaurants/bars, very near to station with great train links into centre
space: Come and stay in our large and beautiful Victorian house, recently converted, set back from the road in a secluded spot with a huge garden. There is one double bedroom downstairs alongside its own shower room, and a huge kitchen/diner with wood burner, opening out onto decking, and a lounge with open fireplace. Upstairs are 3 more bedrooms, one en suite, one a children's room with a small adult double platform bed and a child's bed, a separate family bathroom, and an office.

neighborhood_overview: We are a very short walk or jog from the beautiful Crystal Palace Park, great for strolling and running, and which also contains the National Sports Centre, complete with a public 50m swimming pool. At the heart of Crystal Palace is a vibrant mix of restaurants, pubs and shops, with views over the whole of London.
notes: You will be sharing the house with our two cats, Tom & Max, and we would like you to feed them daily. They're very friendly and independent!
transit: We are just 5 minutes from Crystal Palace train station which has great transport links into central London, via the Overground, and trains to either London Bridge or Victoria. Gatwick Airport is around 45 minutes by train. Parking is free on our road.

We love travelling ourselves, also food, movies, hanging out with friends and keeping fit.

summary: Rustic Farmhouse situated in the countryside yet only a half an hour journey into central London. Log burner, beautiful country walks, nearby tea room. Enjoy a fantastic cosy double bedroom with en suite shower and toilet facilities and a snug area.

Enjoy a fantastic cosy double bedroom with en suite shower and toilet facilities and a snug area. Two rooms and toilet on the top floor for your private use. Communal kitchen, conservatory, and lounge area with fireplace. There is also a cinema room and a study in the basement. On a quiet country road, this is the perfect place if you want to take relaxing walks or visit nearby tea rooms and pubs. However, at the top of road (5 min walk) there is also a bus stop which takes you into Bromley town centre in 15 minutes, and from there you can get a train to London Victoria in another 15 minutes.

name: Fantastically located single room
summary: A comfortable single room in a family home located 16 mins from London Victoria and 20 Mins from East London on the National Rail and Overground.
space: A comfortable single room in a family home located 16 mins from London Victoria and 20 Mins from East London on the National Rail and Overground. The house is located 3mins walk from Penge East station (16mins and 5 stops to London Victoria station) and 7 minutes from Sydenham station (20mins and 5 stops on southern train to London Bridge station or 20 mins via Overground line to Whitechapel) so it is very conveniently located for those wanting to sight-see London and want great easy transport links. You will have your own small single room with access to bathroom, toilet kitchen, dining room and front room however please note that the kitchen and front room are usually busy since it is a family house with children however you will have every opportunity to cook your own food, just let us know when or go for it if it's already free. There's more than enough freezer space, a little limited on the fridge space however we will make space for you and we will free up some cupboard space for

neighborhood_overview: A quiet family neighburhood fantastically located for Central London and East London. There are a few parks close by but the best has to Crystal Palace park which is full of history and attracts people from all over the country and world. Sydenham High street is full of lovely cafes and many shops and supermarkets, perfect for a stroll on a sunday morning. Also close by are big retail shops such as NEXT. Beckenham and Crystal Palace are a short bus ride away (10-15min) and both have many  clubs and bars to spend your weekends. Generally a lovely quiet neighbourhood with great easy access to most things you'd want as a traveller.
notes: Note there are two babies so there will be some noise however as it is a big Victorian house the noise does drain so hopefully that won't affect you much.  We have one bathroom and two toilets. The Bathroom is used by the my three sons between 6.30-8am so the bathroom will be busy during that time however free after that.
transit: The house is located 3mins walk from Penge East station (16mins and 5 stops to London Victoria station) and 7 minutes from Sydenham station (20mins and 5 stops on southern train to London Bridge station or 20 mins via Overground line to Whitechapel) so it is very conveniently located for those wanting to sight-see London and want great easy transport links.  Lewisham shopping center is 20-30mins on the bus 75 from Sydenham hish street (7mins walk).  Bromley shopping center is 20min on the bus 227 from Penge High Street (10mins walk from the house).  Beckenham High street where there is a cinema and lovely restaurants is only 15mins on bus 194 (3mins walk from house is the bus stop)
access: You will have your own small single room with access to bathroom, toilet kitchen, dining room and front room however please note that the kitchen and front room are usually busy since it is a family house with children however you will have every opportunity to cook your own food, just let us know when or go for it if it's already free. There's more than enough freezer space, a little limited on the fridge space however we will make space for you and we will free up some cupboard space for for dry food, please ask if you require this.  We also have a largish garden for London so most welcome  to use that space.
interaction: We are definitely available to help you, so please ask, might be that  my son's are in a better position to help
house_rules: 1. Outside shoes off in the house - slippers and house sandals are fine 2. Kitchen - please clean and tidy the things and areas you use 3. Bathroom - please clean the bath and remove hair after use, bathroom products are available. 4. No friends allowed.
host_about: Hi My name is Reba and this is my family home. Living in my 5 bedroom house are my three sons, one daughter in-law and my two baby granddaughters (11 months and 22 months. My other children (now adults) often visit so it is a big family however you will be have your room upstairs away from hustle and bustle. My three sons are working professionals, Doctor, Accountant and a Businessman so they are usually out and about so it is my daughter in-law, my two granddaughters and me who are usually at home. So if you don't mind a busy household and want  to be around a family surrounding with a great location, you are more than welcome to come and stay. My English is not great but I'm  here to help and where I can't, my son's will be more than happy to. I am retired and spend majority of my time at home helping my daughter in-law with my grandchildren. I love gardening and use my garden to grown a variety  of British and bagaldeshi vegetables, some weird and but wonderful.

description: Confortable, pretty spare bedroom. Shared use of bathroom and toilet. The family home has a front and back garden. The living spaces are downstairs. It is a 3 bedroom house in central Beckenham. Apart from your room and the bathroom/toilet, you will be able to use the hallway, landing and can be given a space in the fridge, if required. You may go to the garden if you wish. We can suggest places to visit and advice on travel routes. My son is 24 and we are both friendly and welcoming people. We are used to host foreign language students. Beckenham is a very pretty suburb with many parks. Kelsey Park is charming. It has many restaurants, cafes, bars, a cinema and the local pool and gym. All just around the corner from us. Two main commuter train stations into central London (20min journey). Tram to East Croydon
neighborhood_overview: Beckenham is a very pretty suburb with many parks. Kelsey Park is charming. It has many restaurants, cafes, bars, a cinema and the local pool and gym. All just around the corner from us.
notes: The house is in an average suburban street, inhabited by families with children and pets. You may expect to hear normal noises children, cars, lawn-mowers etc.. It is an old house with character and colour but not in a modern style. Parking is free in the street but not always easy to find a space. Many public car parks around us, but need to pay.
transit: Two main commuter train stations into central London (20min journey). Tram to East Croydon and Wimbledon. Many buses. A very easy journey from Gatwick airport, using train and tram/taxi. Several taxi companies but can arrange black cab for you.
access: Apart from your room and the bathroom/toilet, you will be able to use the hallway, landing and can be given a space in the fridge, if required. You may go to the garden if you wish.

house_rules: People should be courteous and make sure they are quiet after 11pm. No pets. No smoking but can smoke in the front garden.
host_about: I am a friendly woman living at home with my 24 year old son. We both speak English and Spanish. Additionally, I speak Italian, French and Catalan.We like to watch sport on TV (football and tennis) and I play tennis.I love books and movies. Greece is my favourite holiday destination, I love the light and the sea and the hills and I like the Greeks!I also love nature and walking around London, meeting up with friends.My son likes to go out with his friends more than anything else, apart from Manchester United!We are chilled and relaxed at home and outside the home.

neighborhood_overview: Rural location - wonderfully dark at night so you can see the stars. 10 minute up hill walk takes you to shops (including waitrose) and a pub and various  restaurants. Biggin Hill airport close by for the plane enthusiasts. Where you can see Spifires, hurricanes and Bernie Ecclestone F1 plane frequently fly.
notes: Hosts have 2 friendly dogs.
transit: You have a 7 minute walk to a bus stop which will take you to our fast train link to London (17 minute train ride). The bus runs every 12 minutes and on average the bus ride 20 minutes. We have local taxi firms available. Flying from Gatwick to somewhere nice? Why not stay with us the night before and leave you car safely on our driveway - please ask.

interaction: Hosts willing to provide meals if required and advice during guest stay. Breakfast of cereal, toast, fruit juice, tea/coffee offered. host_about: I am married with 2 children Natalie and Adam and 1 Grandchild Alfie. My son Adam is 25, lives at home and works in London. Ian my husband is retired and I work part time in the leisure industry.We love walking our dogs, going to the theatre and meeting friends for a meal. Our holidays are usually in this country so that we can easily take our dogs. We have a lovely size garden that faces South so in the summer we enjoy being outside and having BBQ's. Although we have travelled abroad to many places, Turkey is one of our favourites.  We are easy going and always ready to help and as Ian has always lived in this part of the country he can give you great advice on where to go in and around London.

access: as well as your rooms,  you will be able to enjoy the Lounge with real log wood burner with sliding patio doors onto the huge private garden, breakfast room, kitchen for self catering ( oven, washing machine, dishwasher) gorgeous stone Bathroom with wet room. parking space!we have porch doors keeps us snug and warm as well as secure.
interaction: We are a considerate generous couple,  very aware that you will want to enjoy you time here,  We would be there to greet you,  (possible pick up from the station if pre arranged) we would show you to your respective rooms & around the house,   available to help you with your travel plans, directions,   places to visit both in London or locally, or just step back and let you enjoy the space, you will see us in the kitchen! and time to time run into us in the hallways & lumi of course ( our fluffy white husky rescue dog, she is a very loving girl) but if you have pet allergies be aware we do have a dog. we will be staying in our studio room downstairs giving you plenty of  privacy. as above if you require the whole house this is also possible depending on length of time needed.
house_rules: we want you to enjoy your stay with us, we are calm, clean, respectful people, love art and music, this is a non smoking house( not even out the window!! )  ( outside yes of course ). just taking care of your own washing up ( we have a dishwasher! so its easy!) keep bathroom clean,  something like that! we can go through recycling dishwasher stuff Û_ just respectful of others sharing the space with you Û_ careful closing doors through the night if you come home late ! we will take care of bedding and everything else once we have said our farewells.
host_about: We are Steven, Evi & and our little white dog Lumi. We live in a large peaceful house in a zone 6 suburb of London, perfect to return to after a long day sightseeing or travelling. We are professional musicians but have also worked in the City so are attune to the varying needs of travellers! We travel across Europe playing shows so like to take in new places, experiences and bring a bit of that home every time. Our passion apart from music is interior design, so slowly improving the house to industrial chic Berlin-esq style.We pride ourselves on being relaxed, friendly and helpful, whilst giving people as much space and peace as they need.The house (maybe rarely!)  is also 'band' friendly, in that we have had bands stay here to use the local recording/rehearsal Ascape studio in Bromley. We are professional musicians so understand the requirements and jargon needed to make it a comfortable relaxing stay away from the studio sessions.We are happy to welcome respectful travellers to our home.

neighborhood_overview: Bickley is a leafy suburb in the London Borough of Bromley. Local shops and great pubs are close by. The town of Bromley with its restaurants, bars and shopping mall is 3 minutes by train or 7 minutes by car. Close by are lovely walks through forest, some of which is owned and maintained by the National Trust.  A local attraction worth a visit is Chislehurst Caves. The Bickley is a popular, local pub with good food, great decor and lovely outside area. It is a pleasant 10 minute walk from the property.
notes: We are within walking distance to Bickey and Chislehurst stations. Both stations offer quick access to central London and the Kent countryside and coast.

summary: Quiet & cozy,  the bedroom's 3/4 bed comfortably fits two. Built in 1900, the Edwardian flat is high-ceilinged, light-filled, with a private deck, shared garden, eat-in kitchen, & dining/sitting room. Close to Sydenham train & Overground station.
space: This tranquil flat is calm and light-filled, yet 12 mins walk to train and with bus links at the end of the street that take you into the heart of the city.  The flat is full of books and artworks, reflecting my job as a curator and university lecturer. You will share with me plus my cat, Romeo. The room would comfortably suit two people for up to three weeks.   Longer-term bookings are suitable for individual guests.

neighborhood_overview: Sydenham is a lovely friendly neighbourhood in South East London, known for its large numbers of parks and historic woodlands. There are convenient shops, pubs and restaurants nearby. Crystal Palace Park is two streets away, and a haven of urban tranquility.
notes: The flat has WiFi and a TV with Freeview plus a washing machine for clothes.
transit: Mainline and Overground trains from Sydenham (12 mins walk) and Penge West (10 mins walk) as well as Penge East (15 mins walk). The 197 bus from the end of the street takes you straight to Trafalgar Square via the South Bank, and runs all night.
access: Access to a private deck, huge communal garden, eat-in kitchen, large dining-living room, and shared bathroom.
interaction: I am at College several days a week and work at home from time-to-time. I love to cook and share a meal and a glass of wine. A native Londoner and a curator of contemporary art, I enjoy connecting people to cultural gems and lesser-known delights in London.
house_rules: Having lived in Canada and the US, and as a frequent traveller, I love meeting people from around the world. Minimum 2 days booking. Up to 3 weeks for couples. Sorry, no pets ...

Crystal Palace triangle is local for perusing antiques by day and going out for dinner with a bit of atmosphere in the evening. transit: Off street car parking available for 1 car. house_rules: No smoking inside the property.  No shoes to be walked around inside.  No dinner parties of more than 6 people.  Please wipe tables down from food mess after you have eaten (hopefully this sounds obvious to you but I can assure you it is not to some!).  After a shower, make sure you leave the air vent on for at least 15-30 minutes and the door open.  If you stay for 2 weeks or more, you are expected to clean the shower room at least once, midway during your stay to prevent build up please.  Do not hang any wet laundry outside.  Strictly do not leave the thermostat on at all times, ideally just a few hours in the evening. Please remember to turn it down to 16/17 before you go to bed and during the day. name: Beautiful Retreat on the River
summary: Enjoy our new, stylish houseboat in the heart of Kew, with great river views. Quiet and peaceful, yet very well situated for central London, Heathrow, easy access to tube, bus and train. Private and self contained, close to shops, pubs, walks etc.
space: This is a unique opportunity to experience nature all around in a peaceful and lovely setting, yet close to all transport links and amenities. Our new houseboat, "Cettia", is situated on the north side of Kew Bridge, facing south, on the quietest part of the river. However, there is plenty of wildlife to enjoy, as we are opposite Brentford Ait, which is a bird sanctuary.  There are also many small boats, rowing boats and paddle boarders on the river, so there is always something of interest to see. There are two other boats on the mooring, and a private and pretty garden. Please note: our boat is for residential use only.
description: Enjoy our new, stylish houseboat in the heart of Kew, with great river views. Quiet and peaceful, yet very well situated for central London, Heathrow, easy access to tube, bus and train. Private and self contained, close to shops, pubs, walks etc. This is a unique opportunity to experience nature all around in a peaceful and lovely setting, yet close to all transport links and amenities. Our new houseboat, "Cettia", is situated on the north side of Kew Bridge, facing south, on the quietest part of the river. However, there is plenty of wildlife to enjoy, as we are opposite Brentford Ait, which is a bird sanctuary.  There are also many small boats, rowing boats and paddle boarders on the river, so there is always something of interest to see. There are two other boats on the mooring, and a private and pretty garden. Please note: our boat is for residential use only. Our houseboat, recently built to a high standard, is exclusively for guests' use during their stay. My daughter lives in t
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the loveliest areas of London; we are very close to Kew Gardens, and beautiful Strand on the Green. There is a gym and tennis court on the opposite side of the river, lovely walks along the towpath to several places of interest, and some excellent restaurants and pubs situated close by. The whole area has been recently renovated with some attractive gardens and luxury apartments, but it retains its charm and character.
notes: The houseboat has a number of attractive features, including bespoke doors and stairs made of iroko hardwood, two handmade bedroom wardrobes, some fun porthole windows, a lovely atrium which floods the sitting room with light, and new fittings and fixtures.  We have a night storage system ensuring that the boat is warm and cosy, although the boat is very light and spacious with lots of headroom. There are good sitting out areas fore and aft, so as to fully appreciate life on the river! Eco features include a MVHR ( mechanical ventilation heat recovery system), plenty of insulation, double glazing, lots of LED lights, an ecological waterless Separett lavatory, night storage heaters running off Economy 7 ( off peak electricity) and an induction hob.  There is no gas or engine which simplifies life on board, and there is a lot of storage space.
transit: Driving From M4; Exit M4 at Junction 2 and follow South Circular Road (A205) to Kew Bridge. Just before Kew Bridge and immediately after the traffic lights, filter right, across the incoming traffic, and continue down the slip road running parallel to the bridge, (there is a Costa and Sainsburys on the right). There is parking in this area. Leaving the river on your left, walk west along The Hollows, and Ciconia is the eighth mooring from Kew Bridge, (just after a red-brick wall) on the left-hand side. The nearest railway station is Kew Bridge, less than 5 minutes walk, with direct connections into central London, to Waterloo or, in the other direction, to Gatwick. Gunnersbury is the nearest tube station on the District Line and is a 10 minute walk away. From both these stations, walk towards Kew Bridge, take the slip road on the west side of the Bridge, called Kew Road, and then follow the path along The Hollows to Ciconia. Planning Your Journey; From anywhere in London, whether cycli
access: Our houseboat, recently built to a high standard, is exclusively for guests' use during their stay.
interaction: My daughter lives in the other houseboat moored alongside Cettia, and will be on hand to help with any problems and queries guests may have. We also have very helpful neighbours!
house_rules: We are pretty relaxed and flexible, but would expect our guests to respect our non smoking rule, and treat our boat with care.  Regretfully, we cannot accommodate pets.

Kitchen is equipped with a stove, oven, microwave, fridge, kettle and cooking utensils. Chiswick is a district of west London. It is the former residence of the 18th-century English artist William Hogarth, his home Chiswick House is a Neo ÛÒPalladian villa regarded as one
neighborhood_overview: Chiswick is a district of west London. It is the former residence of the 18th-century English artist William Hogarth, his home Chiswick House is a Neo ÛÒPalladian villa regarded as one of the finest in England located in a historic park, as well as FullerÛªs Beer Brewery and the famous Sipsmith Gin Distillery. It occupies a meander of the River Thames used for competitive and recreational rowing, with several rowing clubs on the river bank. The finishing post for the Oxford Cambridge Boat Race is just downstream of Chiswick Bridge. Historic figures who lived in Chiswick include the poets Alexander Pope, W.B. Yeats, the Italian revolutionary, Ugo Foscolo, the impressionaist painter Camille Pissarro, and the novelist E.M Forster. Chiswick's Hogarth Roundabout, the Great West Road from central London converts to the M4 motorway, providing a second mode of transport connection to Heathrow Airport and the M4 corridor, and the WestWay which is the fastest connection to central and east London.
transit: Super fast and easy access from Stamford Brook tube (district line) plus plenty of day and 24hour night buses for the ravers.
host_about: I am a painter- always on the move- researching, sketching, exploring, documenting, forever inspired to make my next art work.....

Playroom with day bed which  can be either a sofa, a single or double bed. 2nd floor: two single bedrooms, bathroom. We also have a travel cot and high chair, if required. We have a dog who will not be in the property during your stay. He does not go on the sofas or upstairs. His breed is considered to be hypoallergenic, and he barely sheds. Downstairs is all tiled or wooden floors which is regularly steam cleaned.
transit: 5 minute walk to mainline station into Central London. Good local bus network with easy access to tube network from Chiswick Park & Turnham Green (both District line).  Heathrow Airport is twenty minutes by road, the attractions west of London such as Windsor Castle, LEGOLAND are thirty minutes by road.
access: Our guests are welcome to the whole house and garden, including children's playroom.
interaction: I can provide local recommendations for visitors.  We may not be present during your stay but you will be able to reach us by phone/text with any queries.
house_rules: We kindly ask guests not to smoke in the house. No extra house guests. No shoes indoors. No candles, open flames or fires in fireplace. No food or drink to be consumed on the sofas or upstairs.  You are welcome to use our condiments and dried foods.  This is a family home; not suitable for parties, loud music,  groups of adults (ie hens & stags). Please be considerate to our neighbours and no noise after 10pm.  You are welcome to use the BBQ, but if you do, please could you clean it afterwards.   Please could you put the recycling rubbish out on the allocated day. Thank you!
host_about: I live in leafy West London with my family. We enjoy socialising with friends and the local restaurants and cafes of Chiswick. We have lovely river walks and Kew Gardens nearby - a fantastic place to visit!  Our home is a twenty minute drive from Heathrow airport and a two minute walk to Chiswick overland station (30 minutes to Waterloo).

The bathroom is situated next to the bedroom, it is modern with a big basin,  deep bath and shower.   Sheets and towels are provided. 2 nights min stay up to 4 nights max stay.

Wi-Fi is available throughout the flat.   I can be available during your arrival to show you around the flat and answer any questions you may have. The ho
neighborhood_overview: The house is close to a railroad though the underground doesn't run at night and I have very effective earplugs in case you need them, though most guests who have stayed here before didn't require them. It's a quiet safe residential area. There are many cafÌ©s, pubs, wine-bars and restaurants, as well as  supermarkets just around the corner,  the flat is very close to Chiswick High Road (1-2 minutes walk). The local restaurants specialise in cuisine from all over the world.  It is close to the river Thames, and a riverside walk is highly recommended.   There is also one of the biggest shopping centres in Europe, Westfield and many more restaurants,  a multi-screen cinema, in the near area of Shepherds Bush, which is about a 10 minute bus journey.  Chiswick is also where  Hogarth's House is located, the former residence of the 18th century English artist William Hogarth. A visit to the neo-Palladian villa Chiswick House, regarded as one of the finest in England, is a must see.
notes: Feel free to post any questions and I will respond as quickly as I can.
transit: With excellent transport links,  the flat is just a 2 minute walk from Chiswick High Road and 5 minute walk to both Stamford Brook and Turnham Green stations (both on zone 2). It really is easy to get around London from here in pretty much any direction. The nearest airport is Heathrow (9 miles/14 Km) The bus is also a great way to see London while you travel.  Bus 94 is very close to here,  which can take you to to Holland Park and Notting Hill (for Portobello market) and a little further is Queensway (for  great indian food, bowling, ice skating). It will take you straight to Oxford Street too. The number 27 bus which is also very close,  will take you to Camden Town (for the market).
access: Wi-Fi is available throughout the flat.   I can be available during your arrival to show you around the flat and answer any questions you may have.
interaction: I am happy to offer advice and travel information to visitors.
house_rules: I would like you to feel 'at home', it's a two-way respect thing, that's all I am after. I provide breakfast in the kitchen but do not offer cooking facilities. No smoking. No pets. No stilettos on the new white wooden floor. I have guests slippers or please bring your own. This is a quite residential area,  so not too much noise after 11pm please.
host_about: I am an artist, working with photography and video, I also freelance as an arts  consultant and curator.Originally from Italy, I have lived in London for nearly 20 years and still love this amazing city. Berlin is 'my second home'. I love meeting lots of new and interesting people, there is so much to learn from different backgrounds and cultures. I am pretty easy going. I just ask you to clean up after yourself and have mutual respect.I look forward to meeting you here.

transit: Chiswick is very well connected. We're a 2 min walk away from the tube station, in zone 2 (that's the cheapest fares on the tube). It takes about 20 min to get downtown.  If you like shopping, Westfield mall is 10 min away by bus.  On Saturdays, Notting Hill and Portobello road market are worth a visit. They're only 10 min away by bus.  And on sunny days, Richmond and Kew are great for a stroll by the river - you can even walk down to the river from the house (about a 10 min walk), and head down to Richmond or Kew on foot.

summary: Lovely sunny room & study in Feltham, close to Heathrow Airport, Windsor Castle, Twickenham, Richmond Park, Kew, Hampton Court, and fast train to London Waterloo. The bedroom and study look out over a field with horses.  Off street parking available.
space: We love living here on the edge of town, because we have the best of both worlds - access to rural Surrey and the convenience of easy travel to the centre of London. If you need to write or study while you are in London, then this is a good place to be. Or if you are here because you are a tourist, then you have the convenience of airports and trains! The house is quiet and peaceful. There is also a study you can use. You are very welcome to bring your pet dog too. You can interact as much or as little as you want. You will be sharing with one other guy and he is working full-time. We love travelling using Airbnb and have had great experiences staying with people in Italy, France the USA and in the UK.  Feltham is a completely mixed, multi-ethnic London neighbourhood, so you can buy groceries from all over the world here.

neighborhood_overview: Chiswick is a beautiful leafy suburb of London with easy access to the centre of the city and all its attractions. The river Thames is a 5-minute walk from the property with lovely walks along the towpath between Chiswick and Kew bridges. Historic Chiswick House and gardens (London seat of the Dukes of Devonshire) is about a 7-minute walk. Bustling Chiswick High Street, with its many coffee bars, restaurants and shops, is also about a 10-minute walk from the house. Kew Gardens and the National Archives are one stop on the tube from Gunnersbury (the nearest tube station).
notes: There is a friendly family dog (standard dachshund) living on the ground floor of the property (in the kitchen). The house has some overhead plane noise in common with all properties in West London.
transit: Gunnersbury tube (District line) is about a 11 minute walk. Chiswick train station (connections via Clapham Junction to the centre of London) about a 10 minute walk in the other direction. Central London travelling time is approximately 30-35 minutes from the property. Heathrow airport is 25 minutes via taxi or tube.

neighborhood_overview: This is a fairly quiet residential area with easy access to central London and to Heathrow Airport. There are bus stops at either end of the road with routes running to the main towns (Twickenham, Richmond, Hounslow and Kingston) and to Heathrow Airport. Fulwell Station is a 5 min walk away and the train takes 30 mins to Waterloo. Twickenham Station is a faster option with trains taking 19 mins to Waterloo. Mainline South West Trains, The Overground and District Line Underground Trains run from Richmond and the Piccadilly Line runs from Hounslow.
notes: We are near to Heathrow and you will hear some planes overhead but we do not notice them. The washer and dryer are in the main house and these are available when we are home. Otherwise there are cleaners and launderettes available locally.
transit: There is access to free parking on the road outside our house but no off street parking.
access: The chalet is your home from home and it has a fridge to store essentials and a microwave if you don't want to go to restaurants all the time. The main house is only available if we are home.  Access to the room is private and you can come and go as you please. there are plenty of pubs and restaurants around Twickenham, Richmond and Kingston Upon Thames.
interaction: We are sometimes away but access to the room is private and keys will be made easily available to guests. We respect your privacy but are also friendly, so please let us know if you need anything or would like some company.
house_rules: We are flexible but have neighbours who have a right to peace and quiet so we expect guests to be mindful and respectful. No loud music or parties please. We do not smoke and do not permit smoking in the room. Well behaved children may sleep in the garden room with their parents and play in the garden which is enclosed. Babies will need a travel cot. We do not accept pets.
host_about: Hi I am MoI live in West London with my husband, Paul and adult daughter, Emily.We are friendly and open, have been entertaining guests from around the world for the past five years as well as teaching English. We love living in London and recommending places to visit.I like reading, walking, music and salsa dancing. Paul is a Graphic Designer who likes sport, cooking, running and cycling. Emily is an animator who is currently working in a marketing company. There are beautiful parks nearby where we go most days when not travelling. We both like socialising and meeting new people but also respect your privacy.We have recently decided to try out Airbnb to offer shorter term rentals that would suit people who want a quieter place to stay outside the bustle of the metropolis, although it is only 20mins by train from Twickenham to the centre and all the well known sites of London.  Heathrow is our nearest airport and if we are around often meet and greet our guests. We are on a bus route from the airport or a short cab ride away, if we are not available.We are near to Twickenham Stadium, the home of English Rugby and it is also used as a music venue. We are also near the Thames path, Richmond and Kingston for shopping and nights out. Hampton Court Palace and Bushy Park are also near our home. There is a lot to do and see in this part of London.We do all we can to make guests feel comfortable and welcome.
street: Fielding Avenue, Twickenham, TW2 5LY, United Kingdom

summary: Stunning historic barge on tidal Thames next to Kew Bridge/Kew Gardens with three double cabins, two bathrooms, roof terrace and off street parking. We are moored opposite an island bird sanctuary and only a 20 minute train ride from the South Bank.
space: Our barge is often described as the nicest one on this stretch of the Thames. She has a  perfect balance of original features and modern additions like the sliding glass roof and comfortable bathrooms. You don't need to know anything about boats to stay on her.
description: Stunning historic barge on tidal Thames next to Kew Bridge/Kew Gardens with three double cabins, two bathrooms, roof terrace and off street parking. She has a  perfect balance of original features and modern additions like the sliding glass roof and comfortable bathrooms. You don't need to know anything about boats to stay on her. We let the entire boat out so you have access to the three bedrooms, two bathrooms, kitchen, wheelhouse, living room and roof terrace. I stay on the boat next door so will let you in and show you the ropes and be on standby if you need any further help or information. We have the best of both worlds, a countryside feel in the city. We overlook an island bird sanctuary with Kingfishers, Grebes and Herons yet we are only 20 minutes train ride from the Southbank. We are a short walk fro
neighborhood_overview: We have the best of both worlds, a countryside feel in the city. We overlook an island bird sanctuary with Kingfishers, Grebes and Herons yet we are only 20 minutes train ride from the Southbank. We are a short walk from Kew Gardens, historic Strand on the Green, and its possible to walk to Richmond on the tow path.  I love to get out on the river when I get a chance and it's possible to rent kayaks or paddle boards from Kew bridge, or I might even take you out on my fishing boat if I have the time.
transit: We are five minutes walk from Kew Bridge station which goes directly to the Southbank/Waterloo, or a ten minute walk to Gunnersbury tube station or the 267 and 237 buses take you to Shepherds Bush and beyond. We also have a dedicated off street parking space available.
access: We let the entire boat out so you have access to the three bedrooms, two bathrooms, kitchen, wheelhouse, living room and roof terrace.
interaction: I stay on the boat next door so will let you in and show you the ropes and be on standby if you need any further help or information.
house_rules: We live in a small community of 6 houseboats, sharing the pontoon, garden and car park and everyone would appreciate it if noise is kept to a minimum and no one other than the listed guests come aboard.

neighborhood_overview: * Quiet family neighborhood, incredibly close to various transport links, very close to Twickenham Rugby Ground.  * Osterley park, Syon Park, Kew Gardens as well as a load of other places are very close by.  If the weather is good, they are truly wonderful places to visit.  There is an umbrella or two under the stairs if needed * West Middlesex Hospital is 10 mins walk away * Heathrow airport right next door and Gatwick airport is easy to get to on the train.
notes: * We're using Airbnb's smart pricing feature which automatically adjusts the price of the house using it's own internal settings - so the price does fluctuate, if you like it, book it sooner rather than later. * I've attached both my number and my brothers number on my profile, in case I am unavailable, mine is the one ending in 2030. * The house is under the flight path (that's how close to Heathrow it is).  You will hear/see planes.  I geek out watching them. * There is a security deposit, it's very low - if there is any damage or loss please let us know at the time, accidents happen, and we are reasonable.  And as a responsible guest, you would be obliged to cover any damage.   * Please keep the place clean; there is a moderate cleaning fee, it's there just to cover the cost of a cleaner to do washing of bedsheets, and general tidying up. * This is my first listing, and am open to feedback, please let me know if there is anything we could reasonably do to make things better for you.
transit: Incredibly easy for travel to * Heathrow Airport (15 minute car ride away)  * 30 minute direct train to Central London (Waterloo), or 22 mins with no traffic by car (hint there's always traffic) * Osterley tube station on the Piccadilly line (direct to Heathrow and London) about 20 min walk.   * Isleworth station is 6 minutes walk from the house.  *  A4 / M4 / M25 main routes to and out of London are very close by *  Wembley stadium is around 8 miles away * If you need to, we can let you borrow some Oyster Cards (touch in and out NFC), which you can use to get discounted travel around london on the buses, trains, and tube.   Let us know in advance how many you need.  Please return them at the end of your stay as there is a charge for us to get them (no charge to you, just if you lose them - don't lose them butter fingers).
access: * Access to the entire house, except for one storage room.
interaction: * I'm away, so you'll have the entire place to yourself - and my family live close by and can help you check in/out, or if you have any questions when you're there.   Please give them a little notice and time to respond, they're working and looking after a little one.
house_rules: * This my home, I'd like it to be yours while you stay, kick back and relax.  Please respect the space.  It's a non smoking, non-party house.  Please keep it clean.  Don't download anything on Internet I'd get in trouble for. For everyone's protection, the reserving guest must provide photo ID to receive the keys.
host_about: 40 something traveller, reader, thinker, occasional writer and taker of pictures.Work is varied, executive coach, trainer, and NED.  As well as consultant and knower of digital things.Things people don't know about me.  Love puppies.  Cry at movies (disguised as having an allergy).  Ride motorbikes, slowly round corners.And yes, I don't look as good as my profile pictures suggest.Onwards and upwards

summary: Guests have their own bathroom and are welcome to use the kitchen and open plan lounge. neighborhood_overview: I am in a quiet tree lined street with unrestricted free parking, close to the river for walks to Barnes and Hammersmith, in the other direction is Chiswick High Road, about a 20 min walk or frequent buses, there you will find loads of shops, bars and restaurants.  There is a very good cafe at the end of the road, also a gastro pub, newsagent and corner shop.
notes: There is free parking in this area (no Controlled Parking Zone). Hairdryer is available.
transit: Chiswick mainline station is a few minutes walk.  Mon to Sat trains are every 15 mins (only two an hour on Sundays!).  From there it is approx 20 mins to Vauxhall for the Victoria tube line (Oxford Circus 4 stops), or 25 mins to Waterloo for Westminster, Holborn, the South Bank etc., so perfect for sightseeing.  For fuller information I suggest you visit the Transport for London website.

interaction: I am happy to help with transport advice, places to eat, and so on.
house_rules: Shoes off indoors please, and non smokers.  It's a quiet block so please be considerate after 11 pm.
host_about: I have owned and managed a children's day nursery for nearly 30 years, and have three adult sons.  I love to read, do puzzles and research my family tree but balance all the "sitting" time with classes at the local gym 3 or 4 times a week, I love body pump and zumba!  I also like watching football.

space: This bright and airy double room in a well-decorated and clean 1920s apartment is available for short-term and longer stays.  It is in a 2 Bedroom apartment, sharing with one friendly host and a cat.  The apartment is in a cul-de-sac with very low traffic and lots of trees. Parking, however, can be difficult. name: Light Double Room in West London
summary: This is a large and light-filled second floor bedroom, which looks out over the garden. It is easy to feel happy and content in this quiet room in a charming area of West London, with plenty of local coffee shops and bars and great transport links.
space: The room is bright and airy with a lovely view over the garden. The bathroom and kitchen (shared with two lovely tenants) are both close to hand. The room is equipped with a desk and chair, as well as plenty of storage space. The tube station is a few minutes' walk away, and multiple buses are available just at the end of the street. A well-connected overground station is also just a short bus ride away. Heathrow is about 20 minutes by taxi, but can also be reached easily by the underground/night bus.

neighborhood_overview: Chiswick is lovely area, with the River Thames just a short walk away. It is a great place to relax in and explore, with local sites such as Hogarth House and Kew Gardens within easy reach. You can also sit back in one of its numerous coffee shops, restaurants, or bars, and have a moment of calm. Being in West London, it is easy to reach many popular tourist sites, such as the Natural History and Science Museums, and the Royal Albert Hall.
notes: - We have a Maine Coon cat. She is very friendly, but if you are allergic to/don't like cats, this may be something to note  - We are in walking distance of Chiswick Business Park, for any business guests
transit: - Turnham Green underground station (District line; Piccadilly line early mornings and late evenings) is a 5 minute walk  - various buses into central London (e.g. 27, 94, N9) depart from the end of our road, or just outside the underground station  - Hammersmith can be reached very quickly by bus/tube and Earl's Court is a short journey away on the District line  - Chiswick station (National Rail) is a 5 minute bus ride away (on the E3)  - Gunnersbury and South Acton (Overground) are also nearby
access: Guests will be able to access their bedroom, the bathroom, and the kitchen.
interaction: If we are around, we are very happy to help out with any questions you may have. We've had many a house guest from all over the world and have lived in London for many years, so we have a good stock of knowledge! You are welcome to chat with us as much or as little as you wish. Whatever makes your stay enjoyable.

space: I have a double room in  a two-bed  Victorian house in a lovely street in Chiswick available. The house is about 4 mins away from  the tube.: you are in Central London in 20 mins. The room has a very comfortable double bed, a bedside light and you will have use of a mirrored double wardrobe and underbed storage: there is a cellar and an attic in which you can store your luggage if you like.  I have a lovely  patio area for you to use on sunny days, a good sized  and well equipped kitchen and also pretty and cosy  dining and living space with working fires, which you would hopefully enjoy. house_rules: No Smoking in the house, you can in the outside front porch...Just the usual keep the place tidy. No strangers or guests in the house. Timing no problem. cooking no problem..but tidy up. No drunken behaviour acceptable, no drugs... Music no problem, using the lounge, late nite tv...welcome...just the usual consideration of volume.  This is a late nite house...and very relaxed.
host_about: I am fun loving, I love to dance. I also like peace and quite and my own company some times.More than anything I love people, besides friends and family I like to connect with new people from all over and every walk of life.I love to host and entertain, especially long dinners with red wine, cooking together and a little boogie after..!!I love the mountains ..Turkey, I loved, Austria..Bali, the world is too beautiful, and so much to discover yet.I am a relaxed host, I would make sure my guests are at home, any advice, help, more than happy to help. You are welcome to use all the facilties at home, cook in the kitchen, late nite snack...I am a late nite person, and love to sleep late into the morning.I read adhoc..too many books i like, but to name one.."The New Earth, by Tolle" Jazz music, and old bollywood is my current style..I am changeable..!!My life motto is.." In life you dont have to find your self, in life you have to create your self". And " My greatest adventure lies ahead"...Oh one thing I hate is paper work. I am idealistic, but have loads of common sense so I am very practicle too...and would love to know my guests well, and treat them as a friend.

summary: South facing 3rd floor flat with a lift, overlooking a private green. Spacious living room with an original Art Deco fireplace. Well connected! Only 20 minutes to central London by underground or overground. 20 minutes by taxi to Heathrow. Fast and free Wi-Fi for business travellers.
space: My artwork hangs on the walls, mainly portraits of Arsenal Legends as I am a keen Arsenal FC supporter. The large bedroom opens out into the sun trap private balcony where you can chill out with a morning coffee or a cool drink or sunbathe. It overlooks the beautifully maintained green where you can also sunbathe in peace and quiet, as it is for the exclusive use of  Chiswick Village residents. It is a very relaxing and quiet place.

neighborhood_overview: Great Location for visiting -Chiswick House, Kew Gardens ,Hampton court,Ham house, Syon Park.AND  the beautiful river walks and of course Central London.. Good location for getting out to countryside -west and south West -M4 to Cotswolds and M3 to Hampshire in one hour and Southampton.
notes: Dear possible guest I have a lot of people request to stay in my house when they have no "profile" for me to read about them-please fill out your profile and say what you do for work and leisure ..let us possible hosts learn about you !  We have a house cat who does not like to move away from her home or to travel with us so we have found her to be very independently staying at our home in and out of her "cat flap " door she stays out all night and comes in to eat in the morning -then sleeps most of the day,,she is very shy of new people so will stay clear ..I can have a neighbour come in to feed her or my guests may choose to feed her them selves ..of course I leave masses of food for her in the house . We expect the house to be treated with up-most care and respect-it is our home -not a hotel ! Every effort should be made to keep it clean especially sofa's and rugs which are difficult -as I would need to get them professionally cleaned.
transit: Free parking outside my house -accept one Sunday a month for half the day there is the car boot sale across the road at the school play fields then they restrict parking in front of my house in the morning -It is good to rent a car and drive to my house 15 min..from Heathrow Airport .or ask me for a "mini cab" phone number as there is a company that drive from Heathrow here for 20å£.  The closest public transport is the bus outside my door and the train on my road 500 metres away by the corner shop the  "Chiswick Station" that connects you to the central London underground  The E3 Bus stop outside my front door is called"Chiswick House" bus stop and it arrives every 10 min.from across the street it takes 10 min to the high street for shops & to Turnham Green station which is on the underground train "District Line" close to Hammersmith..There is the 190 bus going to Hammersmith Tube station 5 min walk down Staveley Road.  From the train station  10 min to Waterloo..20 (URL HIDDEN) or on
access: My studio -which was the garage is not to be accessed I have some boxes stored here and a mess of my paints etc..please do not let children in .. the "armoir" -the tall dark chestnut wood French antique cupboard in dinning room is not to be accessed -there are sentimentally precious ceramics I have made in here ...not to be used in case of breakage .. then I have 3 locked doors -the door to attic the door to understairs cupboard  and my dressing room .
interaction: I can offer help easily if I am in England -but mostly I am away and I have a house keeper [and back up incase she is ill]
house_rules: There is a big rule of no smoking in the house ! But there is the garden and furniture to sit on outside. The house must be locked at all times and also the garden gate. The door from Kitchen to garden must be locked at night and not forgotten please. We ask our guests to have our trusted cleaning lady come at your expense to clean the house at least once a week. This is our way to make sure everything runs smoothly and to give you a piece of mind. The cost for cleaning the house is 60å£ and must be budgeted in on top of your rental fee. You may need a cleaning after a week or 5 days in the middle of your stay, which you will pay directly to her . My cleaning lady is to be completely trusted after years with me and many guests -she has the keys of the house, so you can arrange a convenient time for her to clean either when you meet me opening the door for you or she will open and explain the house for you and you can take her phone no etc..
host_about: Artist living in London, mother of 2 splendid fifteen-year-old twin boys, wife to a very talented Italian architect. We are a very creative family: we love sailing, skiing ,riding ,cooking, designing things and painting.

house_rules: I am a easy-going person but there are some rules: - No smoking in the house and outside the window - No pets - No shoes in the house (new slippers are provided) - No parties  - No loud noise during the night - Do not put your baggage and shoes on the bed - Kitchen cannot be used for cooking
host_location: Orchard House, 20a Stamford Brook Road, Hammersmith, London W6 0XH UK
host_about: My house, Orchard house, is a three story semi-detached Victorian style house.  With modern, traditional and stylish English feature, the House is arranged to provide four guest bedrooms, one ensuite, one family and one share bathrooms.  All bedrooms have an abundance of natural light and include heating, hot drinks station, safe box, broadband internet access, flat screen TV, hairdryer and desk. New slippers and clean towels are provided as standard as are shampoo.The house is situated in a prestigious conservation residential area in West London.  A mere 20 minutes from central London and Heathrow airport. Whether you are travelling on business or leisure with your family or friends, you will find the perfect location here. The House has easy access to the excellent local shops, restaurants, pubs, cafes and boutique shops and amenities around Chiswick High Street and a great family feel to it. Within a 5 minute walking distance of Stamford Brook tube on District Line.No smoking, no pet and no shoes in the premises.As the independent individuality, love for travel and sports, I started my wonderful journey of transnational life from the schooldays of university at Japan.  From Tokyo, Japan to London, England, even to Los Angeles, USA, no matter study or work, easygoing me made a group of friends worldwide.If you are first arrived at London, why not be a guest of Orchard House, to make a friend with me, and you will know London, the juiciest city in the world by my words, within the shortest time!  If you often come to London, Orchard House will also be your warmest home in this city!

name: Close to Heathrow!!
summary: Our flat is conveniently located close to Heathrow airport (we'll even get you if we're free), one stop on mainline train to Twickenham for the rugby and easy access to the tube or trains for central London. We love London, so would love to host you!
space: Katie and I are both Londoners born and bred. We love this city and love Airbnb as we have travelled many places in the world staying with people making great friends along the way. We have a homely two bed flat (with one room that could be yours) which is in the small town of Bedfont. The bedroom you'd have is a double and has a TV and DVD player. There are local takeaways nearby if you fancy a night in with a DVD in your room, or we are close to the lovely towns of Richmond or Twickenham where you can enjoy a really nice meal or a walk along the river. Not forgetting central London which is not too far away at all about 45 mins door to door. We're also one of the closest listings on Airbnb to Heathrow airport, which is just a cheap taxi or short bus and tube ride away (if we're not around to drop you of course!)
description: Our flat is conveniently located close to Heathrow airport (we'll even get you if we're free), one stop on mainline train to Twickenham for the rugby and easy access to the tube or trains for central London. We love London, so would love to host you! Katie and I are both Londoners born and bred. We love this city and love Airbnb as we have travelled many places in the world staying with people making great friends along the way. We have a homely two bed flat (with one room that could be yours) which is in the small town of Bedfont. The bedroom you'd have is a double and has a TV and DVD player. There are local takeaways nearby if you fancy a night in with a DVD in your room, or we are close to the lovely towns of Richmond or Twickenham where you can enjoy a really nice meal or a walk along the river. Not forgetting central London which is not too far away at all about 45 mins door to door. We're also one of the closest listings on Airbnb to Heathrow airport, which is just a cheap taxi
neighborhood_overview: Heathrow is located to the far West of London, and within walking distance we have a few local amenities and restaurants. However, just a 45 min journey away from our flat are the bright lights of the West End, the cool bars of Soho or Shoreditch, plenty of historical palaces and our amazing capital to be explored, and where we can we'll do our best to run you up to the nearest stations that you'll need to get to in order to travel into town.  We're 15 minutes on the overground train to Richmond too - famous for it's beautiful park full of deer. Perfect for a picnic and a walk. Hampton Court palace is only a short ride away too if you fancy seeing where Henry VIII put his feet up.  We are just one stop away on the train to the home of English rugby, Twickenham stadium if you're looking to catch a game or do a stadium tour. The small town of Bedfont where we live has a few local shops for you, but you may have to travel slightly to the better nearby attractions, and to get to the neares
notes: Our flat is conveniently located above a small parade of shops, however it is therefore on the main road where some noise does get in. It is also on the first floor so there is a small flight of stairs to get up.
transit: From our flat it's a 10 minute bus ride to the nearest station which is either Hatton Cross on the tube or Feltham on the train. Both are close and very easy to then travel on from.
access: Guests will have access to not only their room which has double bed, TV, DVD player and WIFI but also a washing machine, cooker, microwave, fridge and freezer, shared bathroom and the rest of the flat if you fancy relaxing with us or having a game of FIFA with Phil.
interaction: We will interact with you as much or as little as you want. We do enjoy getting to meet new people and share stories, but if you prefer the quieter life then that's fine too. If we are around we will more than happily take you to nearby stations, pick you up or drop you off at the airport (Heathrow is just a short ride away) if we aren't at work, and do our best to make your stay as comfortable as possible.
host_about: We're both born and bred Londoners who love travelling and meeting like minded people as we enjoy seeing the world. We love food, drink, sports and traveling of course. We enjoy socialising which is why we love staying with hosts who enjoy a chat and maybe a glass of red wine as we share stories and experiences.
