neighborhood_overview: The flat is a new-build property in Old Isleworth, situated in a gated community with secure parking. Isleworth boarders Richmond and has great transport links to the city. Its a beautiful part of London, very green, lots of parks and you're so close to access inner London, but also you feel like you are in the country at the same time! Isleworth train station is a 10 mintutes walk away, where trains head directly into the city (Waterloo) or Clapham, so its a perfect commuter location. George Street in Richmond is a 20-30 minute walk away along the river (I know it well, as it is my commute to work) but in the rain, it is 10 minutes on a bus that comes every 15 minutes. To get to Heathrow Airport, its 20 minute drive or a 10 minute bus to Hounslow East and the tube from there. Living with us would suit people commuting to any near by areas or going into the City. I bought this flat (myself, Louisa along with my parents) in Dec 2015 and I live in the second bedroom with my boyfriend Jef
access: As well as their private bedroom and private bathroom, guests have access to all communal areas: Our lounge (sofas, TV, DVD player, radio) Fully equipped kitchen (fridge, freezer, cooker top, oven, microwave, stove, dishwasher, washing machine and clothes horse) Dining area. Hallway (shoe rack, coat cupboard). Secured bike storage. Off road secure parking in a gated car park outside building.
interaction: We work long hours and hope this flat will remain peaceful and calm. No party house I'm afraid! It's a home away from your home and we hope you can enjoy it and respect it. We will see you over dinner potentially, but it's a place for you to live independently and use as a base to enjoy the beautiful local area and London itself!
house_rules: Please respect our house. It's new to us and I want to keep it as lovely as it is!!!
host_about: Hello- my name is Louisa and I live in Isleworth with my boyfriend Jeff.From June 2013-Feb 2014 I hosted airbnb guests at my old flat in Bethnal Green, East London. I have since moved from that rented house and now we have our own flat as of Feb 2016. When we left our old flat the new renters carried on that old Airbnb and so we have since set up a new page... And here it is!So I work as a Travel Consultant for a company called Trailfinders and specialise in long haul holidays and trips. I do love exploring the world. I think staying in residential areas or in unusual accommodation or with people who are local to the area really enhances your trip and broadens your take on a country. This is why I love Airbnb.Unfortunately my languages are limited to English and basic Italian. Hope to meet you soon!

notes: Check in / check out can be flexible depending on the day of the week - get in touch if you have any questions.
transit: Brentford station has regular trains into London Waterloo. That's the easiest and quickest route into Central London (30mins). You can walk to the station in just 5-7 mins.  Or, if you want to hit the tourist spots it's worth taking one of the buses leaving from outside the flat to either Northfields or Boston Manor Underground Stations on the Piccadilly Line. That line will take you past South Kensington for the big museums, Knightsbridge for Harrods and into the West End and Leicester Square. Buses run from right outside the flat to Twickenham in the West and to Central London to the East. Check out the Transport for London website for more details on how to get about. For further afield, there's a Zipcar parked out the back available to hire for the day.
access: HD and internet connected TV plus free wifi in the flat.  Everything you'll need will be in the kitchen and the bathroom has a washer/dryer if you need it too.
interaction: I'll be staying within reach if you have any problems - just a call away.
house_rules: Just leave it as you find it please!

space: This is a bright and spacious double room in a 3 bedroom modern house which has been completely refurbished throughout. neighborhood_overview: We are a 5 min walk into Chiswick and Kew in West London where we have some lovely restaurants and bars in the high street or alongside the river. Directly opposite is Gunnersbury Park Estate where you can still see buildings and gardens that date from the time when it was a grand estate owned by Princess Amelia and the Rothschilds. The park has 2 play areas, 2 rugby pitches, 1 cricket square, 10 football pitches and 15 tennis courts which can be hired. The estate also has a bowling green and a pitch n putt golf course.  Gunnersbury Tube station (District Line) is a 10 min walk from the house. You can reach major attractions on this line ÛÒ Kew Gardens,  national archives, South Kensington ÛÒ Science Museum, V&A Museum, and Natural History Museum, Sloane Square with its boutique shops and restaurants. We are also a 10 minute drive from Richmond Park and Twickenham Stadium.
notes: Only a 10 minute walk to the Chiswick business park. This house is quiet and perfect for the business traveller during the week.
transit: 15 mins drive to Heathrow airport, 10 mins walk to tube/overland train station and 20 min tube/train journey to central London
access: Kitchen - you are welcome to use the microwave to re-heat food and the kettle/toaster - you will be given shelf space in the fridge/cupboard - if you want to use the washing machine it's å£5 a load.  Lounge - this has 40" sky/smart TV and Internet/wifi access
house_rules: From my reviews so far you can see I'm friendly and an easy-going person but there are some rules: - No smoking in the house - No pets - No shoes in the house - No loud noise during the night - Shared bathroom with another room - Kitchen cannot be used for cooking but of course you are more than welcome to use the toaster and kettle for breakfast in the morning and microwave for heating up food. Check in is from 5pm and departure is from 10am. Please let us know in advance your arrival time when you book so we can arrange to meet you at the property. Please also bring a copy of your passport for ID purposes.
host_about: Hello! My name is Clare. I look forward to offering you a great vacation at my family home. It's a fantastic house which is suitable for tourism and business travellers. It was recently refurbished in 2015 and I take pride in keeping the house clean and tidy. Please check out my reviews. We are 10 minutes walk to Gunnersbury tube / Chiswick business park and 20 mins to Heathrow and central London. Manor Gardens has 3 double beds and 1 single room, a large family bathroom to be shared between 2 rooms and the third room has its own en-suite. There is also a separate toilet downstairs.I will be there to give you any information on the local area - I have lived in Chiswick for 6 years. I'm a free lance Project Manager and stay at home Mum and started hosting back in 2015 (please  see previous reviews)It's a really lovely house with light and spacious rooms. I look forward to meeting you!

So putting 2 and 2 together seemed to make sense in making our two houses available.I love thinking of the little details that will delight guests, and even if I won't be there when you are in our house, you can be sure I will be available to make sure you have absolutely everything you need.I'm French, so good cooking, good food, good wine are pretty high on my agenda.  And I'm a mum, so being the best mum ever is higher still.
